story:
Short Summary

  • Hi! My name is Vedika and I am 17 years old- a rising senior. I was born in New Zealand and raised in Australia before moving to the United States at 12 years old. Music has been a staple in my life throughout, and I am glad you are here to see it!
  • This campaign is for my EP, my first ever independently released one as well! Doing an independent release allowed me to have so much input on my creative process, and this EP is more personal than ever. It truly encompasses my teenage years. This project is so important to me because of that. 
  • If you choose to support me, you will have no idea how much you will help. You will assist me in production, mixing and mastering, PR, and marketing. Everything counts: following me on social media, streaming my music, sharing this campaign, or making a donation are all included.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am so grateful for your support! Here is exactly what your money is going towards: $600 for mixing and mastering, $1600 for production, and $1099 for marketing.
  • I have chosen a flexible goal, so even if the funding goal is not achieved by the end of the campaign, I will still be able to use however much money was donated! I am very grateful for this opportunity.
  • Now, I am busy writing, composing & recording the songs and once it’s done, you’d be one of the first people to hear it!

The Impact

  • Like I mentioned earlier, I released my debut single a couple of months ago. It was a worldwide release to 170+ countries through 250+ streaming platforms. My single has also been featured on radio, both local and international, and playlisted on the Spotify Editorial "Women of Indie India."

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Everything counts! If you are not able to contribute, you can still help me a lot by making some noise about my campaign! Sharing on social media and by using the Indiegogo share tools, you can help me increase the reach of my campaign, which is an invaluable thing! Your generosity is highly appreciated.

Short Summary

Hi! My name is Vedika and I am 17 years old- a rising senior. I was born in New Zealand and raised in Australia before moving to the United States at 12 years old. Music has been a staple in my life throughout, and I am glad you are here to see it!
This campaign is for my EP, my first ever independently released one as well! Doing an independent release allowed me to have so much input on my creative process, and this EP is more personal than ever. It truly encompasses my teenage years. This project is so important to me because of that. 
If you choose to support me, you will have no idea how much you will help. You will assist me in production, mixing and mastering, PR, and marketing. Everything counts: following me on social media, streaming my music, sharing this campaign, or making a donation are all included.


What We Need & What You Get

I am so grateful for your support! Here is exactly what your money is going towards: $600 for mixing and mastering, $1600 for production, and $1099 for marketing.
I have chosen a flexible goal, so even if the funding goal is not achieved by the end of the campaign, I will still be able to use however much money was donated! I am very grateful for this opportunity.
Now, I am busy writing, composing & recording the songs and once it’s done, you’d be one of the first people to hear it!


The Impact
Like I mentioned earlier, I released my debut single a couple of months ago. It was a worldwide release to 170+ countries through 250+ streaming platforms. My single has also been featured on radio, both local and international, and playlisted on the Spotify Editorial "Women of Indie India."

Other Ways You Can Help
Everything counts! If you are not able to contribute, you can still help me a lot by making some noise about my campaign! Sharing on social media and by using the Indiegogo share tools, you can help me increase the reach of my campaign, which is an invaluable thing! Your generosity is highly appreciated.

story:
After years of writing, studying, serving as a cantor in Memphis and balancing my wonderful new family of five, I am ready to get back into the studio. My first albums, Inside Out, Nitzotz (Spark) and Hakol L’tovah (It’s All Good) have been featured on Jewish Rock Radio, PJ Library Radio, in publications, and CDs and most importantly in your cars and Spotify playlists!  You have all inspired me and I cannot wait to give back the love you have given me with this new project.

As I embark on this partnership with you, I am reminded of a powerful story about a woman who lost the spark of life when times got tough and the world seemed to be spinning. The Rebbe, known for bringing meaning and answers to the darkest moments of life, responded powerfully after simply studying and praying with her, "I have given you the match.  Now go and light your own fire." Confused, the woman asked the Rebbe for more guidance. The Rebbe said, "I have given you a match that works.  When the right moment comes, you will strike it and light your fire."

I hope this project hands you the match and inspires you to find love and light in your life as well.  We are all waiting for light and meaning, and this project is a collaboration of finding hope and ultimately my God with the match I was handed at this moment in my life.  Throughout all the distractions in our lives, this project helps us take that breath and renew ourselves by spreading light and love. 

The funding raised with this campaign will go directly to recording, mastering, notating and distributing the music. Please choose the perk that fits you!  I appreciate your help and for sharing this music and project with your friends and family.  This music will bring light and love to all that support!!

story:
"We didn't really consider it a serious record, which really helped because you can get bogged down in those things. We just took an approach of 'we don't know what this is, and we don't know if we're going to-put it out or what.' So for that reason, I think that it maintained a little life, and a little individuality that it probably wouldn't have had if we got too serious about the whole thing and tried to make it into an album. ~ Mark Heard"  Luckily for Heard fans, Dry Bones Dance did eventually find its way into album format and the result is nothing short of a Heard classic. Leaving behind the old "Ideola" sound, Heard has found what seems to be a much more comfortable niche (and perhaps a hearkening back to the old days) with some striking blues, bluegrass and folk rock music. And the lyrics...well, as expected, are second to none. Most Heard devotees would agree. Even if he didn't sound good (no chance), the lyric sheet would be worth the price of the album. Mark Heard has truly earned a place among contemporary poets.  Roberta Croteau ( Release, Fall 1990 ) © 1990 Release

Lo-Fidelity and Fingerprint Records are pleased to announce the long awaited reissue campaign for Mark Heard's "Dry Bones Dance". Released on the distant heels of his synth-pop/rock album "Tribal Opera", "Dry Bones Dance" ushered in a period of artistic brilliance most artists can only dream of. To be able to expand and offer these albums again to the public, starting with "Dry Bones Dance" is an honor not taken lightly. We hope you'll join us in this journey.  

"Dry Bones Dance" Reissue Facts:

I don't see the exact pledge level that I want, can I add additional Shirts, CDs, Vinyl, etc to my pledge? ~ Yes, and it's easy! Choose your closest desired pledge level, and when you go to check out, you can add additional items to your pledge prior to adding your payment info. 

What formats are being offered in this campaign? ~ We are offering Deluxe CDs, limited edition 180g Vinyl (this will be a 2 LP set in a gatefold jacket with insert), and deluxe downloads in this campaign. ***Please note, if you are pledging for vinyl, we ship via USPS Mail using the Bags Unlimited heavy duty "Mighty Mailer" and an additional poly/bubble overwrap. 99% of shipments arrive without issue. That said, unless your record arrives broken or in some other way unplayable, we (Lo-Fidelity, Fingerprint, Indigogo and the Mark Heard estate) cannot exchange or accept returns for vinyl damaged during shipping.***

Will there be bonus material on the deluxe Double CD & download? ~ Yes! We are planning on including previously unreleased tracks and mixes, taken directly from Mark's tapes. Buddy and Julie Miller have also graciously offered to write expanded liner notes for the reissue. While subject to change before manufacturing, the bonus tracks for the double CD version of the reissue currently being considered for inclusion are as follows:

CD, Download and Vinyl Download Bonus Tracks:

Rise From The Ruins (Accordion Mix) - previously unreleased
Our Restless Hearts (Alt Mix) - previously unreleased
Strong Hand Of Love (Alt Vocal Mix) - previously unreleased 
Mercy Of The Flame (Alt Mix) - previously unreleased 
Lonely Road (Fiddle Mix) - previously unreleased 
Lonely Road (Michael Been Mix) - previously unreleased 
All She Wanted Was Love (Shakey Vocal Mix) - previously unreleased 
Everything Is Alright (Mix #1) - previously unreleased 
How Many Tears (More Fiddle Mix) - previously unreleased 
Mercy Of The Flame (Remix 1) - previously unreleased 
Mercy Of The Flame (Remix 3) - previously unreleased 
House Of Broken Dreams (89 Demo) - previously unreleased 
Our Restless Hearts (89 Demo) - previously unreleased     
Nobody's Looking (89 Demo) - previously unreleased      
All She Wanted Was Love (89 Demo) - previously unreleased      
Lonely Road (89 Demo) - previously unreleased     
Waiting For Dry Bones To Dance (89 Demo) - previously unreleased      
Everything Is Alright (Ideola 2 Version) - previously unreleased  
Everything Is Alright (Demo) - from Hammers & Nails    
Mercy Of The Flame (Demo) - from Mystery Mind

Proposed Vinyl Tracklist:

Side 1
Rise From The Ruins
The Dry Bones Dance
House Of Broken Dreams
Our Restless Hearts
Nobody's Looking

Side 2
All She Wanted Was Love
Strong Hand Of Love
How Many Tears
Lonely Road
Waiting For A Reason

Side 3
Everything Is Alright
Awake In The Nighttime
Mercy Of The Flame
Fire

Side 4 (Demos)
Waiting For Dry Bones To Dance (89 Demo)
Our Restless Hearts (89 Demo)
Nobody's Looking (89 Demo)
Lonely Road (89 Demo)
Mercy Of The Flame (89 Demo)

What kind/size of T-Shirts are being used in the campaign? ~ Our manufacturer will use BLACK pre-shrunk, 100% cotton, heavyweight Fruit Of The Loom or Gildan shirts in sizes Small through 5XL. The T-Shirt design has been made courtesy of Chris Taylor.

Do you know what the vinyl pressings will look like? ~ We have artist renderings that give an idea of what the vinyl will probably look like, but they aren't exact...and pressings that feature multiple colors will always be different from record to record. All vinyl will be pressed in heavyweight 180g. (This will be a 2 LP set, in a gatefold jacket.)

Black Vinyl (THE $25 BLACK VINYL PERK LEVEL IS NOW SOLD OUT. BLACK VINYL IS STILL AVAILABLE IN THE $160, $250, and $500 PERK LEVELS.)

Orange/Red "Smoke" Vinyl

Blue/Orange "Smash" Vinyl

Pinwheel Splatter Vinyl

 

"Dry Bones Dance" Archive Tapes - 

We are pleased to offer as part of this campaign, the chance to own a bit of music history. We are offering a total of 17 original Ampex 1/4" analog tapes from the Mark Heard Archives. Each tape contains 1 to 3 songs, and each box contains handwritten notes by Mark with brief explanations of each mix and how they differ. (Any note with a line through it means the song was ultimately not included on the tape by Mark.) These are all original, one of a kind, and have been unedited by Lo-Fidelity or Fingerprint Records. All of the tapes were baked and transferred at Steve Albini's Electrical Audio studio in Chicago IL. (Each reel will also contain a download card featuring the music from the tape.) After pledging the MASTER TAPE + EVERYTHING level, you will choose ONE tape from the selections in the "Add On" section prior to final payment."  Please note - buying a reel does not denote ownership of the music found within. You are simply buying a one of a kind artifact, and are not authorized to share - sell - or distribute it's contents. All contents remain copyright of Mark Heard, (1990 Ideola Music ASCAP). Please click on each link for an image of the back of each tape box, which show track-list and Mark's notes. 

TAPE 1 - "Nobody's Looking" - https://imgur.com/5JVzGeQ

TAPE 2 - "House Of Broken Dreams" - https://imgur.com/CtAMmXv

TAPE 3 - "Strong Hand Of Love / Rise From The Ruins" - https://imgur.com/BenZVqZ

TAPE 4 - "Rise From The Ruins" - https://imgur.com/eMfmBIq

TAPE 5 - "The Dry Bones Dance" - https://imgur.com/pmAhvB0

TAPE 6 - "Awake In The Nighttime" - https://imgur.com/0cTdENM

TAPE 7 - "Our Restless Hearts" - https://imgur.com/eNJzOkT

TAPE 8 - "Waiting For A Reason" - https://imgur.com/sQnI1j6

TAPE 9 - "Mercy Of The Flame" - https://imgur.com/CGap0mG

TAPE 10 - "Lonely Road" - https://imgur.com/O6dCZzp

TAPE 11 - "Lonely Road/All She Wanted Was Love" - https://imgur.com/deb2JTV

TAPE 12 - "All She Wanted Was Love" - https://imgur.com/EzICQcF

TAPE 13 - "Everything Is Alright" - https://imgur.com/FWSC5YS

TAPE 14 - "How Many Tears" - https://imgur.com/sHXB1rw

TAPE 15 - "Fire" - https://imgur.com/1v1l0YS

TAPE 16 - "Mercy Of The Flame - Remixes" - https://imgur.com/dmzSfNi

TAPE 17 - "Mercy Of The Flame - Remixes cont." - https://imgur.com/dTAPpjQ

Mark Heard Desert Painting - The pledge levels containing "EVERYTHING" will also receive a 12"x12" high quality print of Mark's desert landscape painting, suitable for framing. All other vinyl levels can add a print of the painting to their order in the "Add On" section of their order during check-out. 

If we meet the goal, how long will it be before you get your pledge perks? ~ July 2021 is the projected shipping date we have listed on this campaign. This could change based on manufacturing times, unforeseen delays, etc. It will hopefully ship much sooner. July 2021 is simply a projected release month - not carved in stone. If waiting is something you're not wild about, crowdfunding might not be for you... (Just sayin')

story:
Overview

Hi! I'm Farah Alvin and I'm incredibly excited to announce that I'm going into the studio to record an album. On Vinyl, my solo show homage to the very best decade of pop and rock music - the 1970's - will soon be a studio album. With arrangements by my brilliant musical collaborator, Michael Holland and help from my director Marc Tumminelli, I hope the record of On Vinyl will be a musical gift that keeps on giving for years to come. Michael and I are eager to get started on recording a studio album of On Vinyl, featuring our favorite songs with his incredible arrangements as well as songs from my follow up companion show, B-Side. Songs like: At Seventeen, Easy, Don't Cry Out Loud, As, Poetry Man, Dream On, Life On Mars and more!

What is On Vinyl?

On Vinyl will be a recorded studio album based off the sold out solo shows "On Vinyl" and "B-side", featuring our favorite 70's songs with Michael Holland's incredible arrangements of songs including: At Seventeen, Easy, Don't Cry Out Loud, As, Poetry Man, Dream On, Life On Mars and more! We are seeking your help in reaching our funding goal. Every little bit helps!

 

Who We Are

Farah Alvin (Artist) is an award winning vocalist and actress. Her solo show Farah Alvin on Vinyl  was named the Best Cabaret Show of 2019.   Broadway credits include; It Shoulda Been You, Nine, The Look of Love, Saturday Night Fever, and Grease! among others. Off-Broadway credits include; Window Treatment (cast album), Goldstein, The Last Smoker In America (cast album), The Marvelous Wonderettes  (Drama Desk Nomination, cast album), I Love You Because (cast album) and more. Lots of regional including; Papermill Playhouse, Goodspeed Opera House, Signature Theatre (Helen Hayes Award), Cape Playhouse, Geva Theater and Alabama Shakespeare. She has performed as a soloist with the Symphony Orchestras of Indianapolis, Cleveland, Detroit, and the National Symphonies of the United States and Canada. In New York, Farah performs regularly in the series Broadway By the Year at Town Hall, Broadway Close Up and Broadway Unplugged at Merkin Hall, Broadway’s Greatest Hits and 54 Sings…at 54 Below. Farah has taught Master Classes at Temple University, Clarke University, Troy University, Oklahoma City University, Broadway Workshop, Broadway Teaching Group and is the Master Teacher for Broadway Rising Stars at New York’s Town Hall. She teaches musical theater performance at CAP 21 at Molloy college in New York City, Pop music interpretation at Signasium, and has been the Region 3 judge for the Kennedy Center America College Theater Festival for the last three years. Follow Farah on Instagram and Facebook @FarahAlvin or at farahalvin.com

 

Michael Holland (Musical Director/Producer)  is a composer, lyricist and arranger. Music and lyrics for Twelve Angry Men (Theater Latté Da, Minneapolis; 2020 world premiere postponed until 2022). Original music for Clue: A New Comedy, Cleveland Playhouse, 2020 (Tour 2022), and Bay Street Theatre’s virtual production of Moby Dick, 2020. Other original shows include You’re Gonna Hate This (Joe’s Pub; Feinstein’s 54 Below), Hurricane (NYMF), Believe in Me... a Bigfoot musical (fringeNYC). Music direction/new arrangements for Cincinnati Playhouse in the Park’s acclaimed actor/musician production of You’re a Good Man, Charlie Brown, 2019. Incidental music for: Bay Street Theatre; Old Globe; Alley Theatre; Dallas Theatre Center; Playwrights Horizons, others. Orchestrator/vocal arranger/cast recording co-producer for the Broadway revival of Godspell. Arranger/performer in Gashole! (with Karen Mack).

 

Marc Tumminelli (Co-Producer) is the founder New York’s top training program for young actors - Broadway Workshop and is the host of popular podcast LITTLE ME: growing up Broadway for the Broadway Podcast Network. Marc adapted the book, music & lyrics as well as directed the developmental workshop productions of the school editions over 25 musicals. Marc is considered one of the top acting coaches in New York with over 60 of his students appearing in major Broadway musicals as well on TV and in Film. Marc serves as an onset acting coach for Walt Disney pictures. Marc has helped create the solo shows for many Broadway artist including the one and only Farah Alvin. @marctumminelli

 

What We Need & What You Get

Recording an studio album costs money. There's studio rental, equipment, engineering, mixing and mastering, not to mention all the stuff that has to happen after that like photography, design, packaging. It’ll take a lot of people and they need to be compensated.  This campaign will cover:

  • Paying musicians
  • Engineering
  • Producing
  • Arranging & Copying
  • Mixing & Mastering
  • Artwork
  • Manufacturing

You can help me make it by giving a little or a lot. And there are PRIZES! Check out our list of perks right here on this campaign. You can really help us out and be a part of the process of making the album happen. We can't do it without you so I hope you'll enjoy these rewards for your generous contribution.

The Goal

I’m setting a goal of 12K. If we exceed our goal, I’m hoping to do a limited edition number of prints of "On VINYL" on vinyl. This is an extra fancy goal and I really would love to offer it so please help me raise to our goal and then some. 

This crowd funding campaign is only running until October 17th! So now's your chance to be a part of making this album a reality!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign! Tell your friends, family and followers!  I can’t wait to make this album with you!
story_txt:
Overview
Hi! I'm Farah Alvin and I'm incredibly excited to announce that I'm going into the studio to record an album. On Vinyl, my solo show homage to the very best decade of pop and rock music - the 1970's - will soon be a studio album. With arrangements by my brilliant musical collaborator, Michael Holland and help from my director Marc Tumminelli, I hope the record of On Vinyl will be a musical gift that keeps on giving for years to come. Michael and I are eager to get started on recording a studio album of On Vinyl, featuring our favorite songs with his incredible arrangements as well as songs from my follow up companion show, B-Side. Songs like: At Seventeen, Easy, Don't Cry Out Loud, As, Poetry Man, Dream On, Life On Mars and more!

What is On Vinyl?
On Vinyl will be a recorded studio album based off the sold out solo shows "On Vinyl" and "B-side", featuring our favorite 70's songs with Michael Holland's incredible arrangements of songs including: At Seventeen, Easy, Don't Cry Out Loud, As, Poetry Man, Dream On, Life On Mars and more! We are seeking your help in reaching our funding goal. Every little bit helps!

 
Who We Are

Farah Alvin (Artist) is an award winning vocalist and actress. Her solo show Farah Alvin on Vinyl  was named the Best Cabaret Show of 2019.   Broadway credits include; It Shoulda Been You, Nine, The Look of Love, Saturday Night Fever, and Grease! among others. Off-Broadway credits include; Window Treatment (cast album), Goldstein, The Last Smoker In America (cast album), The Marvelous Wonderettes  (Drama Desk Nomination, cast album), I Love You Because (cast album) and more. Lots of regional including; Papermill Playhouse, Goodspeed Opera House, Signature Theatre (Helen Hayes Award), Cape Playhouse, Geva Theater and Alabama Shakespeare. She has performed as a soloist with the Symphony Orchestras of Indianapolis, Cleveland, Detroit, and the National Symphonies of the United States and Canada. In New York, Farah performs regularly in the series Broadway By the Year at Town Hall, Broadway Close Up and Broadway Unplugged at Merkin Hall, Broadway’s Greatest Hits and 54 Sings…at 54 Below. Farah has taught Master Classes at Temple University, Clarke University, Troy University, Oklahoma City University, Broadway Workshop, Broadway Teaching Group and is the Master Teacher for Broadway Rising Stars at New York’s Town Hall. She teaches musical theater performance at CAP 21 at Molloy college in New York City, Pop music interpretation at Signasium, and has been the Region 3 judge for the Kennedy Center America College Theater Festival for the last three years. Follow Farah on Instagram and Facebook @FarahAlvin or at farahalvin.com
 
Michael Holland (Musical Director/Producer)  is a composer, lyricist and arranger. Music and lyrics for Twelve Angry Men (Theater Latté Da, Minneapolis; 2020 world premiere postponed until 2022). Original music for Clue: A New Comedy, Cleveland Playhouse, 2020 (Tour 2022), and Bay Street Theatre’s virtual production of Moby Dick, 2020. Other original shows include You’re Gonna Hate This (Joe’s Pub; Feinstein’s 54 Below), Hurricane (NYMF), Believe in Me... a Bigfoot musical (fringeNYC). Music direction/new arrangements for Cincinnati Playhouse in the Park’s acclaimed actor/musician production of You’re a Good Man, Charlie Brown, 2019. Incidental music for: Bay Street Theatre; Old Globe; Alley Theatre; Dallas Theatre Center; Playwrights Horizons, others. Orchestrator/vocal arranger/cast recording co-producer for the Broadway revival of Godspell. Arranger/performer in Gashole! (with Karen Mack).
 
Marc Tumminelli (Co-Producer) is the founder New York’s top training program for young actors - Broadway Workshop and is the host of popular podcast LITTLE ME: growing up Broadway for the Broadway Podcast Network. Marc adapted the book, music & lyrics as well as directed the developmental workshop productions of the school editions over 25 musicals. Marc is considered one of the top acting coaches in New York with over 60 of his students appearing in major Broadway musicals as well on TV and in Film. Marc serves as an onset acting coach for Walt Disney pictures. Marc has helped create the solo shows for many Broadway artist including the one and only Farah Alvin. @marctumminelli
 

What We Need & What You Get
Recording an studio album costs money. There's studio rental, equipment, engineering, mixing and mastering, not to mention all the stuff that has to happen after that like photography, design, packaging. It’ll take a lot of people and they need to be compensated.  This campaign will cover:

Paying musicians
Engineering
Producing
Arranging & Copying
Mixing & Mastering
Artwork
Manufacturing

You can help me make it by giving a little or a lot. And there are PRIZES! Check out our list of perks right here on this campaign. You can really help us out and be a part of the process of making the album happen. We can't do it without you so I hope you'll enjoy these rewards for your generous contribution.

The Goal
I’m setting a goal of 12K. If we exceed our goal, I’m hoping to do a limited edition number of prints of "On VINYL" on vinyl. This is an extra fancy goal and I really would love to offer it so please help me raise to our goal and then some. 
This crowd funding campaign is only running until October 17th! So now's your chance to be a part of making this album a reality!
Other Ways You Can Help
Share this campaign! Tell your friends, family and followers!  I can’t wait to make this album with you!

story:
Who are you? 

 

Hi all! I’m Wryn, a musician based on the Central Coast of California. My work investigates transmutation, reflection, and absorption of the self.  I pull inspiration from the many facets of my life as an artist, single parent, and non-binary human. For me, creation and performance are spiritual experiences, forms of processing, and intrinsic parts of who I am. 

In the past I have taken my music to venues such as Webster Hall in New York City, The Hi-Hat in Los Angeles, and overseas for indie music festivals. My demos have been played on ‘Morning Becomes Eclectic’ on KCRW and recently I was featured for a second time on NPR’s All Songs Considered for my 2021 Tiny Desk Contest Entry “Patterns”.

Now you may ask, “How is this your debut?” This is my first time releasing under the name Wryn. I’ve taken a giant leap as an artist/person to grow and transform into my most authentic self. These songs have grown with me and are a direct result of that surrender. 

 

My Instagram
My Website

What are you making? 

I am recording and releasing my debut album ‘Shapes’.  The songs on this record touch on themes including self discovery, healing, and processing the world around me. It really is some of the best work I’ve done and I am so grateful to be able to have some amazing people help bring them to life. 

I am excited to say that I will be working with engineer, mixer, producer, and musician Bella Blasko. She has worked on Grammy nominated/winning tracks and with some amazing artists including; The National, Bonnie Light Horseman, and Taylor Swift. 

 

Check out  this interview with Bella about her recent  work: 

https://www.audiofemme.com/meet-sound-wizard-be...

 

Grey Bear Erickson will be hosting me at his Santa Ynez studio and engineering my foundational tracks. He is a cool spring in the desert, a talented and grounding force of a human being residing in the valley.

 

What I Need  to Make This Happen

& What You Get For Helping!

 

The Breakdown:  

Recording Studio + Engineering:   $1,800

Production + Mixing:                          $3,000

Mastering:                                              $1,000

Musicians:                                              $   500

Art/Photo/Design                              $   500

Manufacturing/Replication             $1,000

P/R                                                           $1,200

                                                         Total $9,000
 

Goal 1:  A majority of the cost will be studio time, engineering, producing, mixing, and mastering. This includes Bell Blasko’s and Grey Bear Erickson’s fee

  • Engineering and Studio rental: $1,800
  • Production and Mixing: $3,000
  • Mastering: $1,000

       $5,800:  covers studio time

Goal 2: Hiring other artists: musicians, photographers, graphic designers. I priced this VERY low and will most likely pay out of pocket if I want to work with more than one or two people. 

  • Musician/s: $500
  • Photographer/Artist/Graphic Designer/s: $500

        $6,800: covers hiring artists

Goal 3: Manufacturing a physical copy of this album.  While we live in a digital age I love having a physical representation of my work. Plus, I need things to bring to gigs, sell, and spread the word! I decided to go with cassettes (don’t worry there will be a download card). I can’t tell you how many cd’s I’ve scratched up and ruined over the years. There is something tried and true about the little package of a tape that really does it for me. Of course Vinyl is always desired but I have more to say about that later…

  • Cassette Manufacturing: $1,000

        $7,800:  covers the first run of tapes + download cards

 

Goal 4: Hiring a P.R. person/firm. The unfortunate reality is that no matter how amazing someone’s work is (unless they are Beyonce status) major publications will not write about it unless it’s handed to them by a Public Relations person they know. Pitchfork, NPR (I was lucky), Stereogum etc. all receive countless submissions.  And while artists (like me) would like to keep the illusion alive that it is just hard work and musical excellence, it is really the only chance to even get heard. I decided that this was a really important part of this campaign to share my music as much as possible with people and to give this work the best shot I can. 

  • Hiring someone for a short time for P/R: $1,200

         $9,000: Goals 1-4 Funded 

The rest of my goals are stretch goals. Meaning these are things I would LOVE but didn’t want to make the original budget any higher. 

Stretch Goal 1: 2 more songs! It was so hard for me to cut some of my really cherished songs from the original recordings but another day of recording, studio time, producing, mixing + mastering fees seemed out of reach. I would love to add another day and get two more songs out into the world. 

  •  2 more songs: $1,000

     $10,000: covers an additional two songs 


Stretch Goal 2: Music Video - While I dabble in making videos with my ipad I would just be head over heels if I could hire someone to help me breathe one of these songs come into life. I have a secret list of videographers and directors I’ve got in my back pocket just in case I can make this a reality. 

  • Bare bones estimate of music video: $1,000

       $11,000: covers music video

Stretch Goal 3: Limited Vinyl Pressing. You know it, you love it -  the warm and alive tones of a record spinning, there’s really nothing that tops it. I have always dreamed of having a vinyl of my very own - with lyrics sheets, beautiful art, and lush sound. Unfortunately it is VERY expensive to create. This would be the perfect cherry on top. While I can’t guarantee they will get made (thus they aren’t a perk) I will 100% send out an email to all who donate to the cause if I make this goal. 

  • Limited Vinyl Pressing: $2,000

        $13,000: ALL GOALS FUNDED!!

Perks/Thank You Gifts

For donating to this project I have some special thank you gifts. I decided not to do this in a traditional tiered fashion but there are some bundles available. These are just different ways I can show my appreciation. You can imagine it as a kind of pre-order if you’d like but really it’s about helping me birth these songs into the world. Take a peak: there are zines, concerts, demos, cassettes, commissioned songs + more. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk of having a flexible goal is that I may not get the project funded as much as is needed. I guarantee you this album will be made eventually but it will take much more time to complete without making it past the first few goals. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every action you take on social media can help me! Sharing this campaign is the best way to spread the word and would be much appreciated. 
Thank you so much everyone!!

Wryn

story:
We met in early 2019 at a brewery in Asheville, NC where Laura was performing at a songwriters event on International Women’s Day. Our friendship was immediate and easy, and before long we were singing together. Finding our voices in harmony was like slipping on the most well-worn, comfortable, best fitting pair of jeans- as natural as if we’d been doing it forever. We share a love of many of the same genres of music and artists; mostly folk, plenty of old stuff and some new, from the well-known classics to our lesser known favorites. And so began one of our most treasured pastimes: Singing cover songs. We sang with no purpose but the joy of it and to find our voices in that delicious dance of harmony that is so healing all in itself. 

When Covid hit about a year later our singing practice took on an even deeper meaning for us. It became a lifeline, an anchor, a place to renew ourselves and rest. We began to meet two and often three times a week, singing in the grass in Molly’s backyard, singing on the porch, singing by the river. We sang through hard days and better days, we sang to the neighbors and we sang to the birds. Mostly we sang to our own hearts, to help ourselves through the hardest year.

From time to time we’d share a song on social media and hear feedback from friends near and far that our harmonies and songs were helpful to them too. Seems there is just something about harmony that soothes the ragged edges of life. Recently we figured, well…why be stingy? Let’s record some of these songs and get them out there so folks can hear them whenever they'd like. And this is where you come in... We need your help. We need the miracle of crowd-funding!

We are scheduled to begin recording in two weeks at the recently opened Citizen Vinyl in downtown Asheville, NC with sound engineer and multi-instrumentalist Daniel Shearin (River Whyless). The amount we are able to raise through this fundraising campaign will determine how many songs we can record. Our dream is to record 8-10 songs which would cost around $7,000,  the amount we’ve set as our goal. If we raise half of that we can record 4-5 songs. We will truly be grateful for whatever number of songs we are able to raise the funds for, and every donation, large or small, helps us to get into that studio. We are both songwriters as well and each have a song of our own that we'd like to record if we reach our funding goal. Help us get there and you can look forward to a single from both Molly and Laura!

This project will help support grassroots musicians and recording engineers who have, like so many others, fallen upon hard times this past year. We thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our campaign. Please share it if you feel inspired. Here’s to a year with a lot more harmony in it!

Love,
Molly and Laura


Cost breakdown:
$4,500: 4 full studio sessions (studio rental cost + engineer/producer's cost) with some work tracking and mixing outside of the studio.
$1,500: Hiring studio musicians
$1,000: Mastering costs

 

Perks, you wonder? Oh, there are some good ones.

$5 - handwritten thank you card

$10 - digital download of the album

$15 - digital download and a band sticker

$60 - digital download and a cover song of your choosing, arranged and recorded/filmed by us

$100 - digital download and we'll play a livestream concert broadcast to the comfort of your own home :-)

$300 - digital download and we will write a song about a topic of your choosing.

$500- digital download and we'll play a yard or porch concert within an hour of Asheville city limits.

story:
***If you have difficulty processing your payment, the most likely issue is that your bank declined the charge. You simply need to reach out to your bank to 'OK' the payment and then try again.

 If you require additional assistance, please feel free to reach out to Indiegogo directly: https://www.indiegogo.com/contact

 

Hello to my amazing friends, family, and fans !

With your  help, I am about to embark on a journey to record my 3rd studio album, which I'm calling Morning Cello. 

The majority of this music was composed in the last 6 months, during The Pandemic. As many of you know, and have been watching, I created a free bi-weekly live streaming show called "Morning Cello" as a way to help people around the world cope with the stresses of the the virus and quarantines that followed globally. And also as a way to re-reconnect with my music.

Little did I know that Morning Cello would become the most fulfilling creative endeavor I've had the pleasure of being a part of. And now, it's my full intention to do justice to the awesome and supportive community that has grown around Morning Cello, by recording and capturing what has been the soundtrack of many of our lives since March. 

Before I go on any further, I could not have done any of this without all of you. Morning Cello grew to become more about community than the music - though the music served as the glue to bond everything together. This experience has given me so much -- I never would have guessed that Morning Cello would teach me to be a better person. A better musician. A better father. A better husband. A better human being.

From me, my family, Rosario, Yo-Yo....thank you for everything. And please join me on this amazing journey!

The funds from this campaign will be used to record and distribute my new album digitally, as a CD, and also on Vinyl. The campaign itself offers some other cool perks as well, like your name in the credits of the finished product, for example. 

I like to think of this campaign as the biggest next step to becoming self-sufficient as an independent artist and musician. 

The funds won't just help me to produce an amazing album - I'll actually be using this money to build out a high-end professional studio in my home where I can record the album myself, in my own studio, with the help of bringing in another producer. But beyond producing, recording, and distributing this album, I will now have the tools to work as a composer for film, television, and my own future singles, albums, and other creative projects. 

The thought of waking up in the morning, making a cup of tea and retreating to my studio to produce amazing, beautiful music of the highest quality just makes my soul sing.

 

 

The total budget & goal for this campaign is $30,000

This may seem like a lot of money but ultimately the funds simply come from selling pre-orders & other perks on the campaign. So it comes down to: a little bit from a lot of contributors. In the last 6 or 7 months, my audience has grown to the point where this goal does not seem impossible. 

Below is a breakdown of where those funds will go:

As a musician and independent artist, I would love to sell as much of my music as I can and raise as much funding as possible. It's important for artists to believe that their work is "worth" it - and I do.  

That said, any additional funds beyond the $30k goal will  be put towards distribution, marketing, press, photography, videography, and other expenses that may come up with recording and bringing my new music to market. 

Just please know that all funds will be put towards my music business, whether that's cello strings, cables, luthier repairs, travel expenses for touring (when things open up and I come play live in your town!), or any additional gear that will help bring my studio to the next level. 

Additionally, I'll be posting updates throughout the process post-campaign to be as transparent as possible. 

If the campaign goes totally bananas, any funds beyond the mentioned above would go towards a modest stipend while recording so I can focus on just that.

The impact this campaign will have on my life is far-reaching.

As I said before, you aren't just pre-ordering a CD, or a vinyl, or a digital download -- your contribution directly impacts my future as a musician & creative and my ability to be a self-sustaining content creator (in addition to producing this album). 

Just before The Pandemic locked down The Bay Area, California, I had been desperately applying for desk jobs in the tech industry -- an industry I'm familiar with and one that caused my soul to burn out when I quit tech in 2016. In a way, this global crisis had some silver linings in that I was forced to look inward at what's really important in my life. I had to reckon with what impact I want to have on the world. What future do I want to leave for my son? How I can use my gifts to accomplish that vision? Just as I was about to hang up my cello, the universe put it back into my hands.  

I choose music. I choose community building. I choose using the arts as a conduit for emotional, spiritual and social changes. 

When my live stream started gaining traction around early April, and I began to see the profound effects my music was having on listeners -- I knew Morning Cello was about so much more than streaming music. 

I witnessed  powerful and profound responses from listeners -- and at a time when the world felt like it was falling apart.  I realized the huge responsibility I had for holding a safe, accepting place for all people to find comfort, solace, and peace. And I've been absolutely humbled by the response and support I've received. 

With your support - I can put my full energy into developing my sound, my vision, my content... not just for this album but for many more creative projects yet to come. 

As with any project, there are always some inherent risks involved. That said, I have worked professionally in crowdfunding, fundraising, and project/product launches since 2013 having worked with non-profits, start-ups, and Fortune 10 companies.  I've successfully funded many of my own projects, including my most recent campaign to fund the recording of my last album, Coming Home.

I am confident I can and will deliver on this album and it will meet and exceed expectations --  as well as honor the many supporters who helped to bring this music to life. 

The biggest risk I see is not really a risk, but more of a delay. It's possible I will miss my projected fulfillment date by a few months (which can happen in crowdfunding). If this happens it's because I will not release this album until I feel it's ready and does justice to all of you. 

In the meantime, I will be providing behind the scenes updates throughout the process to be as transparent as possible.  Plus, it's fun!

T-Shirt Sizing Charts

Unisex V-Neck Jersey_Color: Blue

Women's Jersey T-Shirt_Color: Asphalt/Slate

 

Women's Slim Fit Jersey T-Shirt_Color: Olive

Boy Howdy! I'm glad you asked!

The best way to help is to share this campaign and your enthusiasm for my music with your friends, family, and networks.  Telling people directly and sending personalized email and messages is the best way to spread the word -- otherwise you can post to your social media channels (it helps if you write a little something when you post).  :)

Please invite as many people as possible to watch my Tuesday/Thursday Morning Cello live streams to get them acquainted with my music, my story, my dad jokes, and to meet the Morning Cello community. 

Lastly, if you're thinking to yourself, "Well gosh darn, I pre-ordered a CD AND a Vinyl AND an Album Credit -- how the heck else can I support this musician?" I'd say "Please join me on Patreon," a subscription-based crowdfunding platform where fans like you can support artists like me to insure we have the necessary, continued support to bring the arts and humanities to the world. 

Lastly, lastly, please follow me on Facebook, Instagram, Spotify, Youtube, and sign up for my email list @ www.joshuamcclain.net

I could not have done this without you.
story_txt:
***If you have difficulty processing your payment, the most likely issue is that your bank declined the charge. You simply need to reach out to your bank to 'OK' the payment and then try again. If you require additional assistance, please feel free to reach out to Indiegogo directly: https://www.indiegogo.com/contact Hello to my amazing friends, family, and fans !With your  help, I am about to embark on a journey to record my 3rd studio album, which I'm calling Morning Cello. The majority of this music was composed in the last 6 months, during The Pandemic. As many of you know, and have been watching, I created a free bi-weekly live streaming show called "Morning Cello" as a way to help people around the world cope with the stresses of the the virus and quarantines that followed globally. And also as a way to re-reconnect with my music.Little did I know that Morning Cello would become the most fulfilling creative endeavor I've had the pleasure of being a part of. And now, it's my full intention to do justice to the awesome and supportive community that has grown around Morning Cello, by recording and capturing what has been the soundtrack of many of our lives since March. Before I go on any further, I could not have done any of this without all of you. Morning Cello grew to become more about community than the music - though the music served as the glue to bond everything together. This experience has given me so much -- I never would have guessed that Morning Cello would teach me to be a better person. A better musician. A better father. A better husband. A better human being.From me, my family, Rosario, Yo-Yo....thank you for everything. And please join me on this amazing journey!The funds from this campaign will be used to record and distribute my new album digitally, as a CD, and also on Vinyl. The campaign itself offers some other cool perks as well, like your name in the credits of the finished product, for example. I like to think of this campaign as the biggest next step to becoming self-sufficient as an independent artist and musician. The funds won't just help me to produce an amazing album - I'll actually be using this money to build out a high-end professional studio in my home where I can record the album myself, in my own studio, with the help of bringing in another producer. But beyond producing, recording, and distributing this album, I will now have the tools to work as a composer for film, television, and my own future singles, albums, and other creative projects. The thought of waking up in the morning, making a cup of tea and retreating to my studio to produce amazing, beautiful music of the highest quality just makes my soul sing.  The total budget & goal for this campaign is $30,000This may seem like a lot of money but ultimately the funds simply come from selling pre-orders & other perks on the campaign. So it comes down to: a little bit from a lot of contributors. In the last 6 or 7 months, my audience has grown to the point where this goal does not seem impossible. Below is a breakdown of where those funds will go:As a musician and independent artist, I would love to sell as much of my music as I can and raise as much funding as possible. It's important for artists to believe that their work is "worth" it - and I do.  That said, any additional funds beyond the $30k goal will  be put towards distribution, marketing, press, photography, videography, and other expenses that may come up with recording and bringing my new music to market. Just please know that all funds will be put towards my music business, whether that's cello strings, cables, luthier repairs, travel expenses for touring (when things open up and I come play live in your town!), or any additional gear that will help bring my studio to the next level. Additionally, I'll be posting updates throughout the process post-campaign to be as transparent as possible. If the campaign goes totally bananas, any funds beyond the mentioned above would go towards a modest stipend while recording so I can focus on just that.The impact this campaign will have on my life is far-reaching.
As I said before, you aren't just pre-ordering a CD, or a vinyl, or a digital download -- your contribution directly impacts my future as a musician & creative and my ability to be a self-sustaining content creator (in addition to producing this album). 
Just before The Pandemic locked down The Bay Area, California, I had been desperately applying for desk jobs in the tech industry -- an industry I'm familiar with and one that caused my soul to burn out when I quit tech in 2016. In a way, this global crisis had some silver linings in that I was forced to look inward at what's really important in my life. I had to reckon with what impact I want to have on the world. What future do I want to leave for my son? How I can use my gifts to accomplish that vision? Just as I was about to hang up my cello, the universe put it back into my hands.  
I choose music. I choose community building. I choose using the arts as a conduit for emotional, spiritual and social changes. 
When my live stream started gaining traction around early April, and I began to see the profound effects my music was having on listeners -- I knew Morning Cello was about so much more than streaming music. 
I witnessed  powerful and profound responses from listeners -- and at a time when the world felt like it was falling apart.  I realized the huge responsibility I had for holding a safe, accepting place for all people to find comfort, solace, and peace. And I've been absolutely humbled by the response and support I've received. 
With your support - I can put my full energy into developing my sound, my vision, my content... not just for this album but for many more creative projects yet to come. 

As with any project, there are always some inherent risks involved. That said, I have worked professionally in crowdfunding, fundraising, and project/product launches since 2013 having worked with non-profits, start-ups, and Fortune 10 companies.  I've successfully funded many of my own projects, including my most recent campaign to fund the recording of my last album, Coming Home.
I am confident I can and will deliver on this album and it will meet and exceed expectations --  as well as honor the many supporters who helped to bring this music to life. 
The biggest risk I see is not really a risk, but more of a delay. It's possible I will miss my projected fulfillment date by a few months (which can happen in crowdfunding). If this happens it's because I will not release this album until I feel it's ready and does justice to all of you.

story:
Overview | Descrição

Have you ever wanted to say something but couldn’t find the right word? Sometimes it’s on the tip of your tongue, but sometimes there’s simply no word for that... or, at least in your language.

Planned to be released in 2021, “Lost in Translation” is my new cycle of music inspired by untranslatable words from more than 10 different languages. It’s an exploration of the connections between experience, terms, and music. Discovering untranslatable words expands your sense of reality, your lexicon and spices up your curiosity for cultures. The intrepid explorers include André Matos (guitar) and José Soares (saxophone). João Almeida (trumpet) joins the group in a few tunes.

I’m excited to invite you to be part of this project and I’d love to expand our collective vocabularies. Donating now will give you access to the album before its official release, to exclusives and updates.

 

Alguma vez quiseram dizer algo mas não encontraram a palavra certa? Às vezes está mesmo na ponta da língua mas, outras vezes, simplesmente não existe uma palavra… ou pelo menos, na nossa língua.

Com lançamento previsto para 2021, “Lost in Translation” é o meu novo projecto, inspirado em mais de 10 palavras intraduzíveis de diferentes línguas. Ao aprendermos palavras intraduzíveis expandimos a nossa realidade, o nosso léxico e aguçamos a nossa curiosidade por outras culturas. André Matos (guitarra) e José Soares (saxofone) são os dois audazes músicos que formam este trio, juntando-se João Almeida (trompete) nalguns temas.

Estou muito entusiasmado por vos convidar a fazerem parte deste projecto e adorava que, em conjunto, conseguíssemos expandir o nosso vocabulário! Ao contribuírem, terão acesso ao álbum antes do seu lançamento oficial, actualizações e exclusivos. 

 

Introduction | Introdução

Hi! My name is André Carvalho and I’m New York based double bassist and composer, with 3 releases under my name. What does my music sound like? Well, people have told me that it’s like a trip into the unknown with a dose of injected adrenaline. Things veer rapidly between contemplative moments and scenes, leaving the listener suspended in time. Or, simply imagine blending a Zen Koan with a painting by Francis Bacon.

I’m launching this campaign to raise funds for my upcoming album “Lost in Translation".

 

Olá! O meu nome é André Carvalho e vivo em Nova Iorque. Sou contrabaixista e compositor, com 3 álbuns editados como líder. Como é que a minha música soa? Bem, muitas pessoas têm-me dito que é como uma viagem ao desconhecido com uma elevada dose de adrenalina. Os ouvintes ficam suspensos no tempo por a música mudar rapidamente entre momentos contemplativos e turbulentos. Posto de outra forma, imaginem misturar um Zen Koan com um quadro de Francis Bacon. 

Estou a lançar esta campanha para angariar fundos para o meu próximo álbum “Lost in Translation”.

 

What is “Lost in Translation”? | O que é "Lost in Translation"?

As fascinating as Portuguese can be, I always had problems expressing certain ideas using just one word. And, even if I knew all the lexicon, I’m sure I would still face the this problem. This is exactly what Wittgenstein meant when he once said that "the limits of my language mean the limits of my world.” Words are such an amazing Human invention and, since they are born after a certain need, they can convey so much about civilizations. I’ve met many people from other cultures who’ve taught me amazing and unique words. Unique in the sense that they are untranslatable. 

Examples: Karelu (the Tulu word for the mark left on the skin by wearing something tight) or Mångata (the Swedish word for the road like reflection of the moon in the water).

After reflecting on the importance and beauty of these untranslatable pearls, I felt an inner urge to compose a new cycle titled “Lost in Translation”. I believe that by learning words, our conscience becomes more sensitive to others, we become more empathetic and our world becomes richer.  The same happens as we are in contact with unfamiliar music. That’s why, “Lost in Translation” embraces the unknown, by having a very strong improvisational and spontaneous component, making each performance its own distinct version of the piece.

 

Por mais fascinante que a língua Portuguesa seja, sempre tive dificuldade em expressar certas ideias usando apenas uma palavra. E, mesmo que soubesse todo o léxico, tenho a certeza que teria exactamente o mesmo problema. Isto é exatamente o que Wittgenstein quis dizer com “os limites da minha língua significam os limites do meu mundo”.  As palavras são uma incrível invenção Humana e, uma vez que surgem de uma necessidade, podem dizer muito sobre dada civilização. Ao longo da minha vida, conheci muitas pessoas de outras culturas que me ensinaram palavras incríveis e únicas. Únicas por serem intraduzíveis.

Karelu (palavra Tulu para a marca deixada na pele por usar algo que está apertado) ou Mångata (palavra Sueca para o reflexo da lua na água, quando este fica como uma estrada de luz) são dois excelentes exemplos. 

Após refletir sobre a importância e a beleza destas pérolas intraduzíveis, senti uma necessidade em compor um novo ciclo de música que intitulei “Lost in Translation”. Acredito que ao aprendermos palavras, a nossa consciência torna-se mais sensível aos outros, tornamo-nos mais empáticos e o mundo torna-se mais rico. O mesmo acontece quando ouvimos música que não conhecemos. É por isso que, “Lost in Translation” abraça o desconhecido, tendo uma forte componente improvisacional, tornando cada performance única.

 

 

Who’s the team? | Quem é a equipa?

There are moments when you are so sure about something that you don’t think twice. Choosing my team was one of those. The New York based guitarist André Matos has been on my side for many years, playing and shaping my music in a unique way. Amsterdam based saxophonist José Soares has collaborated with me several times and is an extremely sensitive musician. They are the core of the group. In a few tunes, João Almeida joins the trio. He is a highly regarded trumpet player, with a broad musical language, ranging from Jazz to Experimental music.

Besides the musicians, I also have Tiago Sousa, Margarida Girão, Pedro Caldeira and José Sarmento Matos. Tiago is one of the best Portuguese sound engineers. He has worked with amazing artists and I was fortunate to have him by my side on my first 2 albums. The collage illustrator Margarida Girão is responsible for the artwork as well as the campaign's pitch video. We've worked together on "The Garden of Earthly Delights", which gained international attention by being on display at PASTE UP! an international collage festival in Mexico. Award-winning director Pedro Caldeira filmed the recording session. He is also responsible for editing the campaign's pitch video. All the recording session photos were shot by the amazing José Sarmento Matos.

 

Há momentos em que sentimos uma certeza absoluta e não pensamos duas vezes. Escolher os elementos deste grupo foi um desses momentos. Residindo em Nova Iorque, André Matos é um guitarrista com quem toco há vários anos e que tem moldado a minha música de forma única. O saxofonista José Soares tem colaborado comigo nos últimos anos e é um músico de extrema sensibilidade. O André e o José são o núcleo do grupo. Nalgumas faixas, o trompetista João Almeida junta-se ao trio.

Para além dos músicos, conto com o Tiago Sousa, Margarida Girão, Pedro Caldeira e José Sarmento Matos.O Tiago é um dos melhores engenheiros de som portugueses, tendo trabalhado com alguns dos mais importantes artistas nacionais. Ele foi responsável pelo som dos meus 2 primeiros álbuns.  A designer Margarida Girão é responsável pelo artwork, tal como se sucedeu no "The Garden of Earthly Delights". A direcção artística do vídeo desta campanha é também dela. A sua contribuição no meu último álbum foi tão incrível que este foi apresentado no festival internacional de colagem PASTE UP! no México. Pedro Caldeira é um realizador em ascensão sendo responsável pela filmagem da gravação do disco e pela edição do vídeo da campanha. Todas as fotografias da gravação são do incrível José Sarmento Matos.

 

What am I asking for? | Onde será usado o dinheiro?

In order to release the album, I need to raise $3750 to support the following costs:

  • Video shooting during the recording session;
  • Mixing and mastering session;
  • Artwork;
  • CD and LP production;
  • Promotion and publicity

 

Para conseguir lançar o álbum, preciso de $3750 (cerca de 3100EU) que serão usados para:

  • Filmagem da gravação do álbum;
  • Mistura e masterização;
  • Artwork;
  • Produção de CD's e LP's;
  • Promoção e publicidade.

 

Why did I create “Lost in Translation”? | Porque é que criei "Lost in Transation?

When I stumbled upon untranslatable words, my mind was immediately blown and I started to hear new music inside my head. To me, it was so obvious that I just dove into this new cycle. While learning each new word, my mind sparked with ideas and curiosity about its language, its culture,  and the reason it might have been created.

Quando tropecei nas palavras intraduzíveis, imaginei imediatamente música nova e foi tão óbvio que mergulhei de cabeça neste novo ciclo. Cada vez que aprendia uma nova palavra, a minha imaginação fervilhava de ideias e curiosidade pela língua, a cultura e a eventual razão para ter sido criada. 

When will it be ready? | Quando estará concluido?

I’m planning to have the album ready to be released in the second half of 2021. By supporting this campaign, you'll have access to all the steps as the process unfolds, behind-the-scenes and to the music before its official release.

Julgo que terei o álbum pronto na segunda metade de 2021. Ao apoiarem a campanha, terão acesso a todos os passos do processo, behind-the-scenes e ao álbum antes do lançamento oficial.

 

What are the risks? | Quais são os riscos?

Everything is ready on my end. However, due to the current global pandemic, there might be some delays that might affect the established timeline. We are committed to putting the album out no matter what, so rest assured that you’ll get it! 

Está tudo pronto do meu lado. Contudo, com a actual pandemia, poderão haver alguns atrasos. Estamos totalmente empenhados em lançar o novo álbum, por isso garanto-vos que o receberão!
 

How can you help? | Como podem ajudar?

 Contributions to “Lost in Translation” are much appreciated. In addition to financial contribution, please consider adding value by :

  • Spreading the word: sharing the campaign links among your family and friends;
  • Turning your entire tribe on to this: post links to the campaign on your social media and send to it your email list - they’ll thank you for the inspiration;
  • Follow me on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter;
  • Join my mailing list on my Website.

 

Todos os contributos para "Lost in Translation" serão bem-vindos. Para além do contributo monetário, podem ainda ajudar da seguinte forma:

  • Espalhem a palavra: partilhando o link da campanha entre família e amigos;
  • Apelando a toda a vossa comunidade: partilhando o link da campanha nas redes sociais e através da vossa lista de e-mail. Eles vão agradecer-vos pela inspiração!
  • Seguindo-me no Facebook, Instagram and Twitter;
  • Subscrevendo a minha mailing list através do meu site.

What is CHILD?

On a creativity-pilgrimage to uncover my own musical expression—I discovered a sound. This sound became an artist-persona, known as CHILD: an indie/experimental-pop hybrid, even described as a cross between Kanye West's "Yeezy", Bon Iver and The Weeknd. I'm not saying it's going to "change the game"—but I feel pretty confident when I say... you've have not heard much else like it.

$10,000

These are funds for the cinema-grade videography, world-class mixing & mastering, top-of-the-line equipment, and the one-of-a-kind venue. If a record label saw what we're accomplishing for this amount, well... let's just say they'd start asking questions! One thing is certain, this process has revealed the effectual power of Friendship ... along with the synergy that can spark from a mutual-vision.

Mixing/Mastering: Nicolas Balachandran (he's produced artists in some of your playlists)

Video: Josh Etheridge (Vogue, NorthFace, he even co-shot Nick Jonas' wedding)

 

Why This Campaign Is Unique: "Lights, Camera, Action! Hi mom!"
I wonder how many albums are live on IndieGoGo right now? Hundreds, at least. Artists typically pursue crowdfunding for an experience that will happen behind the closed doors of a studio; an experience only they are able to behold—thus leaving supporters with only the end result. But our "ask" is unique: you'll be funding a project that reveals the experience! Anyone in the world will be able to see how it all went down—you can even attend it! Friends, these are living results!

The Impact:
We aspire to inspire. Artists, music-lovers, producers, songwriters, videographers... the creative-communities of our world hunger for new expressions! The creative depths of CHILD, along with what is to come, could very well progress culture. It's a mechanism for challenging & stretching artistry in our generation—the "norm".

It is our goal to release this music not only in North America, but in Southeast Asia, Russia, and parts of Europe. If you have a passion to cultivate new levels of creativity in our generation—this is for you! 

$10K is the "goal" — raising more will enable our key volunteers to be supported, along with beginning the recording of CHILD's new songs, and marketing!

Thank you for considering our campaign—I look forward to sharing this experience with you.

 
- Devin, CHILD    
chldartist.com  |   @chld_artist

story:
Short Summary

We are The Common View, an emerging indie-rock band based  between Manchester and Leeds. We have been gigging regularly for the last 2 years and we have released home-made EPs, and now we're launching this campaign to raise funds for our first studio album.  We're extremely passionate and hard working, and it's our dream to make a living from the music that we make, and to get to that level we need to record our songs in a high quality environment.    

The band is made up of 5 students, so you can imagine we have a pretty tight budget, which we primarily use to travel around the UK when we have gigs and for rehearsals. That's why we're looking for a bit of external help because we think that to make significant progress we need to record our next release professionally.   

Funds are going towards:

1. Studio and personnel hire. If we don't achieve the goal, we are going to use savings to try to complete the budget we need for a 10 song album. We estimate that the cost of the project would be between £3500 and £4000. 

Contributors can expect: 

1. Their names to be featured in the album credits. 

2. Exclusive behind the scenes content from recording sessions. 

3. A cover from one of the members of The Common View (just name it).

4. A personal video saying thanks for your contribution. 

5. A private video lesson for guitar, bass, or drums. 

6. Recording tips for recording your own demos (check our Spotify to check the quality). 

The Impact

1. These days production is essential to make your music stands out, so a high quality release would mean more radio airplay and more exposure. 

2. With our latest single "Early Grey" we ran a fundraiser for Leeds Mind, and exceeded both initial and secondary targets.  

3. We're currently in conversations with a couple of studios, which have given us quotes for the recording sessions, so we are fully aware of how much we'll need to spend for this project.   

Other Ways You Can Help

1. You can stream our songs because we receive royalties from streaming services, which are now the only source of income we have from music.

2. Share our songs with your friends, to get more listeners that can stream our songs. 

3. Follow us on all of our social media platforms to make our project more noticeable and share our campaign with your mates.

We are The Common View, an emerging indie-rock band based  between Manchester and Leeds. We have been gigging regularly for the last 2 years and we have released home-made EPs, and now we're launching this campaign to raise funds for our first studio album.  We're extremely passionate and hard working, and it's our dream to make a living from the music that we make, and to get to that level we need to record our songs in a high quality environment.    
The band is made up of 5 students, so you can imagine we have a pretty tight budget, which we primarily use to travel around the UK when we have gigs and for rehearsals. That's why we're looking for a bit of external help because we think that to make significant progress we need to record our next release professionally.   
Funds are going towards:
1. Studio and personnel hire. If we don't achieve the goal, we are going to use savings to try to complete the budget we need for a 10 song album. We estimate that the cost of the project would be between £3500 and £4000. 
Contributors can expect: 
1. Their names to be featured in the album credits. 
2. Exclusive behind the scenes content from recording sessions. 
3. A cover from one of the members of The Common View (just name it).
4. A personal video saying thanks for your contribution. 
5. A private video lesson for guitar, bass, or drums. 
6. Recording tips for recording your own demos (check our Spotify to check the quality). 
The Impact

1. These days production is essential to make your music stands out, so a high quality release would mean more radio airplay and more exposure. 
2. With our latest single "Early Grey" we ran a fundraiser for Leeds Mind, and exceeded both initial and secondary targets.  
3. We're currently in conversations with a couple of studios, which have given us quotes for the recording sessions, so we are fully aware of how much we'll need to spend for this project.   
Other Ways You Can Help
1. You can stream our songs because we receive royalties from streaming services, which are now the only source of income we have from music.
2. Share our songs with your friends, to get more listeners that can stream our songs. 
3. Follow us on all of our social media platforms to make our project more noticeable and share our campaign with your mates.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everybody! I'm Kaddy Kobain and I'm super pumped to be able to, with your help, complete my first full length original album "Black Bleach". As we all know, 2020 has been a trying time for musicians, but I think also music is needed more than ever right now as it is the only way we can connect in these days of social distancing. For those of you that don't know me, I am a producer, singer, songwriter and entrepreneur. Originally from Indiana, I took a chance 3 years ago and moved to Atlanta to build my entrepreneurial music business and work on my artistry.

I have been making music since I was a teenager - the love for music was passed down to me from my parents. Sometimes people don’t understand what it means to be an entrepreneur in the music industry, and I’ll be the first to admit it is HARD. The music industry is filled with politics and superficiality, but I am here to change that and also show others that it can be done. I self funded my last album "Nevermind The Trap: A Tribute" which was truly worth every penny. Being that it was a cover album of the grunge rock band Nirvana, people didn't get to see my songwriting vocal abilities the way they will with this project.

This project is packed with songs dealing with emotions, politics, freedom, and fun, this project will be my best work yet. I believe this project will give me the momentum I need to fully break through to the masses and be the star and influence that I have worked to become. With your support, I will be able to plan and execute my next musical project and actually have a proper timeline and plan. With your help, I will make a solo album (I will produce it all on my own) and have the ability to properly market it. This album, "Black Bleach" will be a movie that you can watch through your ears. 

What We Need & What You Get

My team and I calculated that the budget for this album will come to $5,000. This budget will cover expenses such as studio time, production, marketing, promotion, mixing/mastering, as well as physical copies (CDs, vinyl, cassette), and merchandise. The entire album will be recorded in Atlanta, Georgia at the great Castle Hill Studios and will be mixed and mastered  by legendary Producer/engineer Justin Padron. 

In supporting this masterpieces full formation, you are really investing. With cool perks such exclusive signed polaroids from the the recording sessions, handwritten lyrics from the album, "Black Bleach" on vinyl, even an actual private concert at your very home! 

Due to the fact that this is an all or nothing campaign, if I do not reach the goal of $5,000, I will receive none of the proceeds and they will be returned, meaning the album will never get made. I have spent a lot of time creating this collection of songs and there is nothing I love more than to be able to share my voice and thoughts to the world. 

The Impact

During this pandemic, I released and self funded my first album "Nevermind The Trap: A Tribute" which was a compilation of Nirvana songs that I recreated in a Hip-Hop meets grunge fashion. This project was all produced and sang by me and though I basically went broke to see it in full formation, I have to say it was worth every penny. Seeing the impact that it made has truly been overwhelming in the best of ways. Hearing people thanking me for making the album and gaining fans from all over the world has melted  my heart time and time again.

I know that consistency is a big part of making it in the music industry, and that why this fund is so vital to my team and I. This will be the first album that people will be able to see the artist that I truly am. I have made many sacrifices to get this far and I know I will have to sacrifice much more to get to the top of the mountain, but I know this is the only thing I will ever be. I was born with a gift and I know I'll never be truly happy unless I share it with the world. I didn't grow up with many options. Grew up mostly by myself and had to become an adult super early. I have a son and want to  give him more options than I had at his age. I want to show him dreams can be reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who can't donate, no worries. I know these times are hard for everyone, so if you would like to help in any way possible, share my music and my story, watch my videos, follow my journey, and tell people about me!!!!! Thank You!!!!!!!

story:
Let's make an Abandoned Pools album.

I want to do it right this time. Like Humanistic was done. Not that any of the past albums have been "wrong" but I did the last two mostly on my own and it was a bit exhausting. Collaboration is needed to make an album properly - with supporters, fellow musicians and engineers - and I know who I want to help me this time around.

The Team

I've spoken with John Spiker of Tenacious D. Spiker has played bass with AP before so maybe you've seen him at a show. He's supremely talented at everything and has a great studio space. He's on board. I'm also in touch with Pelle Hillstrom. He played guitar with AP on our first tour and appeared in some AP videos. He's a wizard and will elevate the entire project. I also reached out to Jeff Friedl. He's a monster drummer who has played with A Perfect Circle, DEVO, Filter and The Beta Machine. I also contacted one of the industry's best mixers, Neal Avron. I did some work for Neal on a Sara Bareilles album over 10 years ago. His credits include Weezer, 21 Pilots and Yellowcard. I would love to add Abandoned Pools to that list.

Clone High is Back

The timing is right too. Many of you know me because I wrote and performed the theme song to Clone High. Perhaps you've heard that Clone High is being rebooted on HBO Max. Well, what better time to make an AP album than when Clone High is coming back? To have an album ready for new and existing Clone High fans to discover would be perfect.

The Campaign

I've reached out to many of you on social media to get your feedback on how to build this campaign. Your contribution was very much appreciated. I hope you are happy with what I have to offer as rewards. I will continue to listen to your feedback and adjust and accommodate as much as possible. I promise to be open with you about the progress of the album and will keep you updated if the schedule changes in any way. Your support over the years has not gone unnoticed - even while I was working on other things - and I've always felt an obligation to you. The money raised will be spent on:

  • Production and recording costs (studio, engineer)
  • Musicians
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Artwork
  • Reward production and fulfillment

None of the target goal funds will be going into my pocket.

It's been almost 8 years since Somnambulist. I've had a bunch of songs kicking around my head in various stages of completion and it's time to commit them to tape (and/or hard drive). I've come up with a budget and a plan. I'm doing this without the support of a label or management but with your help we can make this a reality. As always, thank you for your support.
