story:
Short Summary

For a long time, music has been the biggest part of who I am. I’m a shy guy, words tend to escape me, but songwriting and performance have always been the easiest ways for me to express myself and let my real self shine out.

After a rocky road coming out of college five years ago, I immersed myself fully in the music scene around Boston, growing tremendously as a person, writer and musician. I poured all of myself into creating a record that showcased my strengths as a songwriter and was ready to take on the world. It felt like a new beginning, and as such I named the EP “Starting Over.” It felt like a fresh start, like my real musical journey was just starting. And then life happened.

My mental health took a nosedive and after the worst summer of my life, I decided to pack up and move to Burlington, Vermont for a very different fresh start than I had planned for. Years of constant gigging suddenly ceased as I began working full-time in the “real world” and my grand plans for the record and my musical career were put on pause. I am still insanely proud of the EP, but my world had been thrown into disarray and I was never able to give it the promotional push it deserved.

Fast forward almost three years since the move and life has changed quite a bit. After slowly building up a performance schedule again, I am back into performing regularly, and while there have been gaps in inspiration, I have taken the curveballs life has thrown and crafted several songs which I cannot wait to bring to life and get out into the world. The biggest part of who I am has been largely missing for a while, and I could not be more excited to be taking that dive back into it.

In August I will be headed into the studio to begin working with Christopher Hawthorn, who has worked on some pretty remarkable projects with local artists. My last record could not have been made without the generous support of so many wonderful people, and I hope you are as excited as I am to be a part of this new journey!

What We Need & What You Get

There are many stages of this project that your pledges will be crucial to! In addition to paying for production and engineering, other costs throughout the making of the album will also include studio time, mixing, mastering, session musicians, and anything else that could possibly come our way. But the journey doesn’t end once the songs are ready to go. There's the actual making of the CDs and jackets still to go, design of artwork, and a whole host of promotional costs including advertising and submission fees. If we are able to raise enough, I also hope to make a music video! Any extra will be used promotionally.

Along the side of this page, you will find a number of perks to reward you for your generosity! Different pledging levels will qualify for different rewards. On the lower end, you could receive an early download of the single, a physical album, some autographed stuff; in the upper echelon, I’ll travel to you for a private show (I can play for a long time and know a lot of covers as well. My standard gig is about 3 hours)! There are a lot of things in between as well, so check it out!

The Impact

By helping me make this EP a reality, you’ll be helping me achieve an important step in my musical journey.  With this release, I hope to be able to expand my fanbase, my visibility, my performing opportunities, and I strive to bring you the best possible listening experience. Music is a beautiful thing. These songs were born from a very transitional time in my life with a lot of loss, change and eventually acceptance. A singer’s songs mean a lot to him or her, but they can mean something just as important or something entirely different to a listener, and I hope to put out an experience for those who hear the record. 

So why give me money to fund the project? Say you were going to buy the EP anyway. This just lets you purchase it a little earlier in the process rather than wait until the distribution date. You can be a part of the writing of this chapter rather than just read the finished product! And without earlier assistance from you, this release may not get to exist at all!

Risks & Challenges

Unintended costs tend to arise when working on these kinds of projects, but I am doing my best to budget for this. Aside from that, the main issue is likely the timeline. Last time I recorded, music was my full-time gig so scheduling was not overly difficult. Working a day job now while trying to book recording time will be a challenge, so this project is not going to get done overnight. It will likely be months before the recording is finished, and the final product likely won't be ready for release until spring at the earliest. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Tell your friends, family, co-workers and others about the campaign and my music. Use sharing tools from IndieGogo to get the best results. I sincerely appreciate any amount that you are able to help this project, large, small or in between. Your support is what makes my music possible!

 

Video by Warbird Creative

Photos by Caroline Alden Photography

story:
Hello everyone, I am Irene Diaz.  A singer songwriter from Los Angeles, CA and it's FINALLY DONE!!!  My FULL LENGTH ALBUM!!!  The one I've been talking about for the last COUPLE of years.  AHHH (Screaming Voice) :)

 

 

My Story:

Back in 2013 I independently released my first EP, 'I Love You Madly’.  Self produced and all, it managed to receive love from the likes of NPR, NPR-Alt Latino, KCRW to name a few. 

I've had the privilege of traveling different places because of this EP.  Places such as New York, Miami, San Francisco, IBIZA,… JAPAN!!! I’ve also been blessed with opening for artists such as Mexican Singer Songwriter Carla Morrison, LA’s newest trend The Marias, folk singer Fantastic Negrito, Cumbia fusion band Ozomatli, and many more.  In between all this and working at my day job, I managed to write new material and find out what I wanted for myself as an artist. I knew I wanted to work with a producer for my full length album so I began the search.  It wasn’t until the end of 2016 that I would find Grammy nominated producers/brothers, Alejandro and Demian Jimenez of Mexico City. 

​

So in the beginning of 2017, I packed my bags and my songs and headed to MEXICO CITY.  The guys and I diligently worked in their studio, narrowing down the strongest songs and building them up from demos. I had no idea that this album would be a two year long process, but it was.  A LOT of PATIENCE and HOMESickness (but all for the best).  

 

(w/ Producers Demian and Alejandro Jimenez) 

 

The songs on LOVERS and FRIENDS are the story of my life. This album is all of me in my barest form.  Every song was inspired by experiences I’ve had with lovers and friends over the years of my young adult life :P.  Every song received the attention it needed in order to get you to feel loneliness, to feel heartache, to feel in love, to feel confused, to feel… HUMAN.   So this process had me writing, rewriting, reworking and SINGING.... A whole lot of singing. 

 

NOW……..The Cost (and Why I Am Doing This Campaign)

 

Lovers and Friends needs to go through its final stages of production in order to get to YOUR ears. Unfortunately as an independent artist money is what makes the world go round.  And we are pretty much our own label. So far I’ve been able to support this project with money I’ve received from shows, to you purchasing my merch online (Thank you), as well as working as much as possible at a day job. But, what I have right now is not enough to give this ALBUM a proper debut!  That’s where you come in.

 

Here is where $25,000 will go:

  • Producers- I need to finish paying the producers, Alejandro and Demian Jimenez
  • Mixing and Mastering- This is a process of refining the sound of each song to sound the best it can be on each platform of music.  
  • Music Video(s): I plan to have videos made to accompany the first few singles off the album
  • Single/Album Cover Art- Artists need to get paid. 
  • Merchandise- I am working towards bringing you new merch for Lovers and Friends
  • Equipment- This album is BIG, in order to bring this to you LIVE I need NEED to update my equipment.  This ALBUM IS NOTHING LIKE I’VE EVER DONE.
  • Promotion- I need to hire someone to help me get the music out there, from blogs to radio stations across the US and beyond!!!
  • Shipping and Fundraising Costs- Indiegogo takes a commission from the funds raised (4%-9% depending on if I reach my goal) plus the shipping and handling for the perks sent to contributors

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this Campaign!!! If you can’t contribute, thats okay! Sharing my campaign and my story is the next best thing!!! Thank you!!!
  • Donate $1, Every dollar counts :) 
  • Are you interested in working with me? I’m looking for people to work with me on music videos, photoshoots and artwork. Hit me up!!! Lets make some art!!!

Mixing and Mastering- This is a process of refining the sound of each song to sound the best it can be on each platform of music.  
Music Video(s): I plan to have videos made to accompany the first few singles off the album
Single/Album Cover Art- Artists need to get paid. 
Merchandise- I am working towards bringing you new merch for Lovers and Friends
Equipment- This album is BIG, in order to bring this to you LIVE I need NEED to update my equipment.  This ALBUM IS NOTHING LIKE I’VE EVER DONE.
Promotion- I need to hire someone to help me get the music out there, from blogs to radio stations across the US and beyond!!!
Shipping and Fundraising Costs- Indiegogo takes a commission from the funds raised (4%-9% depending on if I reach my goal) plus the shipping and handling for the perks sent to contributors
  Other Ways You Can Help
Share this Campaign!!! If you can’t contribute, thats okay! Sharing my campaign and my story is the next best thing!!! Thank you!!!
Donate $1, Every dollar counts :) 
Are you interested in working with me? I’m looking for people to work with me on music videos, photoshoots and artwork. Hit me up!!! Lets make some art!!!

story:
THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME REACH MY FIRST TARGET! I AM OPEN FOR DONATIONS UNTIL THE CAMPAIGN ENDS IN MID APRIL. I AM NOW AIMING FOR A FURTHER UNLIMITED 'STRETCH GOAL'. 
I under budgeted when I put this campaign together as I was so nervous and just hoped I might make half of my initial £1500 target to help with the mix and master. After the release costs, artwork and a low budget music video for promo (which it  would obviously be lovely to UP the budget on!!), I would love to do another photo shoot for further promotional material and I would like to make a website (a central place to link all media platforms, stay in touch with followers, and most importantly link to the music) therefore some professional shots would help with this. I manage a permanent chronic illness and I am unable to perform live like I used to, therefore my output in the virtual world really needs to be the best it can be . I am so happy to have crossed my initial goal line, but if you would like to donate (perhaps if you are considering streaming the album once its released? Why not own it? ?) then I guarantee the funds will be used. The question "how much does it cost to release an album" is the same as "how long is a piece of string"?! The more budget I have to work with- the more detail I can include in the creative output. All funds raised will go towards the creative freelancers I am employing for the project, it isn't going into my pocket. Thank you for helping me create the best possible album release I can and helping me to be the artist I have always wanted to be. ❤️
 
 
 
'The Witching' album by 'Solace in the Sky' is a collection of songs celebrating an archaic connection to the natural and supernatural worlds. Delivered with a primal and vast vocal soundscape it is a journey into the mystical, a musical portal to access the intangible. Ritual magick through music......

Please take a listen to the unmixed album sampler here before reading on about how you can help me release it to the world! - 

soundcloud.com/solaceinthesky

ABOUT ME 

Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign, thank you so much for being here!

Some of you visiting this page may know my previous work in music for the last couple of decades,  working for acts such as Incognito, Lou Reed, Emeli Sande, Chaka Khan, Hotei and Iggy Pop and a whole bunch of other industry greats. 

Over the last four years my performing work has sadly come to a gradual end due to a diagnosis of CFS/ME. After an initial long period of grief I began writing again and creating an album that has been stirring within me since childhood. 

Over the last two years I have written, arranged and produced this album ‘The Witching’, under my new artist name ‘Solace in the Sky’. Solace in the Sky is my authentic musical voice, it is a lifeline of creativity for me in a way that I can manage under my health limitations and I believe it has possibilities for me to grow and continue contributing towards music which I highly value. Thematically, as you will have heard,  it is also pure escapism into a world I have musically created and I’d love for you to join me there! I am now ready to mix, master and release the album and this campaign seeks to raise the minimum funds I need to help me do this. 

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION AND YOUR RETURN 

What I need this funding for is as follows-

£750 to finish the mixing and mastering (I have already put in the same amount upfront)

£250 for album artwork 

£500 for promotional content (e.g first music video to support the launch) 

This is the minimum I need to finish and launch the album. Should I raise these funds they will help support the other creatives I will be working with, which is a nice thought at this challenging time for the arts. 

This is my first crowdfund so I have thought about ‘perks’ that might be of interest at the beginning of my journey as Solace in the Sky. Any small donation is appreciated but for £10 upwards you receive a digital copy of the album (included in all perks). Digging into my skill set other perks include a video ‘song request’ of your choice as a dedicated thank you (£30), vocal lessons for those who are interested in exploring their own voices further (£50) and also a set of signed personal photo prints of the magical natural world which has inspired my writing (£25). You can contribute any amount without perks also if they’re not your sort of thing! 

IMPACT

Some of my musical heroes such as Bjork and Bat For Lashes already create music with an immersive feel, telling stories of magic in the landscape, pagan poetry,  and natural/supernatural phenomena. These are all compelling universal themes which I have included on ‘The Witching’. I am telling my own story from my East Anglian childhood upbringing in a haunting 500 year old cottage, to my fascination with the esoteric and magic as a part of human evolution. Serenading the phases of the moon and their captivating beauty, and writing my love letter to nature as my greatest healer. My vocal style artistically has typically been of a blues and soul approach, plus my session work has required me to use my voice in a wide array of sounds, styles, dynamics and textures. I feel that this is what gives this album a unique appeal. I can’t quite categorise it which I believe is a good sign.

As well as offering my own brand of music to the world I hope to inspire others with my personal story. I couldn’t have coped as well with my own chronic illness without certain friends I have met along the way who also manage health conditions but are still highly active and wonderfully vibrant on the arts scene. I hope to pay that forward. 

Additionally, I know many vocalists who have not yet dared take the plunge into self production and I hope to inspire them to do so- especially women who are under represented in this area of the industry and that needs to change. 

I also aim to fly the flag for independent artists, just as other indie artists have inspired me so much. Especially at this point in my life and career. Whatever age, race, gender and physical ability you may be/have we no longer need to rely on labels taking control. With a lot of determination, a great group of supporters and the internet we can do this ourselves and carve out our own creative scene. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

I understand you might not be able to contribute financially. You can still help out by following me on social media @solaceinthesky and telling any of your friends who might enjoy this wyrd musical vibe all about it. If perhaps you are a creative who is interested in future collaboration or a skills exchange then that is also a wonderful currency! 

 

 

Thanks for your time and consideration of supporting this campaign!

story:
James Baldwin once said in an interview,  "...if you can examine and face your life you can discover the terms with which you are connected to other lives, and they can discover too, the terms with which they are connected to other people."  The cultural and social importance of Jazz and Hip-Hop and how these genres shaped their generation's consciousness, must continue to be documented and articulated.

‘Articulated Language’ is the name of this incredible collaborative album.  As I mentioned in the video not only am I excited about producing this project but I am excited for you to join our team.


 I am Carlos Mena, an artist and music producer. I have  produced music for, and collaborated with, Grammy Winning and Multi-Platinum selling artists such as, Arrested Development, Tre from Pharcyde, and Jody Watley to name a few.  My last album "Hip-Hop Meditations" which was described as "...Common and Wyclef sitting down with a book from occultist Sylvia Browne and a bag of somethin' somethin'."  Was very well received by critics and fans and led to me touring around the world in support of the project.  I have opened for everyone from Counting Crows to The Roots, to Parliament Funkadelic to The Fugees and Black Eyed Peas.  After years of touring, remixing songs for dance labels and began running my own label ‘Ocha Records’.



A short time ago, I felt a calling and burning desire to create again and explore musical and lyrical ideas around Jazz and Hip-Hop.  As a child of the 70s and 80s in New York City, my musical vocabulary was informed primarily by Hip-Hop, but also included Afro-Latin and Jazz.  And in these days of mindless disposable music I feel obligated to put this important project together and continue the movement of creative honest music.

 I remember how artists like Run-DMC, Sugar Hill Gang, MC Lyte, and Rakim, affected my life and gave me hope when I felt hopeless during times difficulty while growing up in Bushwick (very different from the Bushwick you may know today).  I also remember when I picked up a cassette of Miles Davis at Newport where I was introduced to John Coltrane.  As a student of music I am still trying to understand what I heard and experienced. Other inspiring musical forces schooled me included A Tribe Called Quest, Public Enemy, Gangstarr, Jay Dilla, Steve Coleman and so many more.  Each of these talents has uniquely colored the landscape of my musical journey. And I would like to continue this journey with your help.


In the spirit of community and collaboration I invited some of the illest legends and up and coming artist in this hemisphere to bless us with their gifts.  We have already recorded incredible songs with Georgia Anne Muldrow, Marcus Gilmore (Flying Lotus, Chick Correa), Lazaro Galaragga (Herbie Hancock, Cachao, Paquito D'Rivera), Vinia Mojica (De La Soul, Mos Def, ATCQ), Victoria Theodore (Stevie Wonder, Arsenio Hall Show) Burniss Earl Travis (Robert Glasper), Marcus Machado (Rolling Stones Magazine Next Young Gun), Farnell Newton (Jill Scott), my brothers Osunlade and Ezel, and producers like Kokayi, Jazzmattik, and Navi Beats. We are adding other talents as we speak and as a part of the team you will be the first to know. 



With a true desire for integrity, we want to insure that we are continuing to pay musicians for their work and not just asking for favors.  Know that they have been incrediblily generous because they are just as passionate about getting this project to you as I am. To fully round out this project we are adding a symphonic element to the production with a live string section and arrangements.  Your contribution will be used for this purpose as well as for mixing and mastering.  By the way, we are working at Brooklyn Recording which has hosted some of the top musicians on the planet including Keith Richards, Robert Glasper, Norah Jones, and Meshell Ndegeocello and beyond.  Brooklyn Recordings is one of the top studios in New York and are thrilled to have the one and only Andrew Taub engineering this project.

The only thing that can make this any sweeter is the incredible packages I have put together as a special thank you for joining the team and movement.

We need $10,000 to cover the recording, mixing, musicians and mastering.  If we do not reach the entire goal, the funds raised will still go to cover these costs and we will have to ask for a few favors, do some bartering, use synth strings (yuck), but we will get it done.  Our last campaign was for the Casamena Radio Hour Compilation CD that was fully funded in less than two weeks!  I know we can do this!

Please check out the unique perks we have available.  Some even include exclusive gear, vinyl, and you can even join us in the studio!

I know that for some of you even $5 can be a lot to ask.  Please support us however you can.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word on on Facebook and Twitter.  Thank you soooo much!

story:
Songs for the Breakdown is almost here!

Friends, I made an album that I can't wait to share with you. It feels like a personal departure from anything I've done before, exploring peaks and valleys of my own experience, and touching on some of the bigger themes that keep us all connected, while exploring new musical edges, and pushing myself both in the lyrical content and compositional arrangement. 

The album feature's my band, who I like to call "The Good Dream" and the good news is that you too can be a part of "Maya Elise & The Good Dream". 

The tracks are recorded, mixed, mastered, and sitting in a dropbox file, but I need your support in order to get them to your ears! 

The Goal:

  • If I've learned anything about this process, is that if you want to do it sustainably, it isn't quite the cheapest endeavor. Sustainable, to me, means choosing eco-friendly printers for the vinyl & merch, recording as much as we can in one go to avoid multiple trips, and fairly paying artists and designers, so that they can live a more sustainable life as an artist. The total cost of making this album is about $9,000. I have invested all funds from my Patreon into the production, and I am left with about $7,500 to make back up - so that is where you come in!
  • There is so much here to snag while you can, including a limited edition vinyl, a *naturally-dyed* shirt (hand-dyed by me), a digital-illustrated songbook of all the original songs on the album, and more (all delivered August 2021)!
  • In order to receive all of the funds, I need to reach my goal! Will you help me get there? 

How This Works & Why Support?

  • Choose a "perk" level. Each level contains different items that I will ship to you, but don't worry, if you want an extra vinyl or CD or shirt, you can add that on at the checkout. 
  • A successful pre-order campaign leads to a successful launch, which leads to all sorts of growth for me and my band down the line, allowing for a sustainable music career for all of us.
  • And here is some honesty: most people who listen to this album will probably stream it on Spotify or Apple music (yay!). With the amount of money streaming services pay the artists, my songs would need to be streamed for over 12 years straight in order to make it to my goal of $7,500. Yikes! 
  • New to my music? Check out my previous releases here to see if you vibe! https://spoti.fi/39kqMy2

Other Ways You Can Help

Already pre-ordered and want to know what you can do next? You can help me reach my goal by sharing this on social media, email, text, however you want to share it! 

If you share on Instagram, make sure to tag me @mayaelisemusic <3

story:
MARE is excited to announce that she is launching, The Mafia Experience. This will be a 30-day crowdfunding campaign with a twist! As a show of gratitude for the unconditional support from Mare Mafia: every person who donates, will receive a special and personalized Mafia Box! The tier packages of the box will have exclusive items and merchandise. 

The crowdfunding campaign has the goal of $5,000 and the proceeds will be used towards the rollout of MARE’S new EP and a new merchandise collection. Our crowdfunding campaign is unique because every donator will be gifted with MARE’s limited merchandise from her new collection! NO MATTER HOW MUCH YOU DONATE, MARE wants all her fans to receive something special from her. Any contribution makes a difference!

The Mafia Experience will start May 11, 2021 until June 11, 2021. You will be able to participate in this campaign by saving and sharing The Mafia Experience promotional flyers. Be sure to share the campaign link with all your friends and family! If you don't wish to have a Mafia Box sent to you but would still like to support, that is also an option! Lastly, use the secure link to donate to MARE’s campaign directly. Once the 30-day campaign is completed, all Mafia Boxes will be sent out to supporters. 

Thank you in advance to everyone who has shared our flyers and has donated to the The Mafia Experience.

"The support I get from Mare Mafia is unmatched and I will always be thankful for each and every one of you. As always, thank you for believing in me and my dreams!" - MARE

Once the 30-day campaign is completed, all Mafia Boxes will be sent out to supporters. Thank you in advance to everyone who has shared our flyers and has donated to the The Mafia Experience."The support I get from Mare Mafia is unmatched and I will always be thankful for each and every one of you. As always, thank you for believing in me and my dreams!" - MARE

story:
We started out with a bang!

Its been a bit over 11 years since we released our first and what would become our only album, "Only Ghosts Remain".  Soon after the release, life pulled us all in different directions and down diverging paths.  But damn, what an album we made!

Now, over a decade later we have reconnected and decided to put something new out into the world.  The world is quite a different place from where we as a band left it.  Some may say now is not the time to be asking folks for money for an album that in all honesty, doesn't need to happen now.  We waited this long, right?  We would argue that now is quite possibly the best time for something like this.  Our world, our nation and your ears need a little more beauty at the moment, and we are gonna try our darnedest to give it to you in the only way we know how.

Our estimate to complete the album is $6,000 dollars.  We are only asking for $2,000.  Why are we campaigning for only part of the bill?  Well, its been so long, we aren't sure how many of our fans from long ago are going to come out of the woodwork and back to us.  Maybe they are all into K-Pop now. Who knows.  Of course if we go above the asking amount, we will have stretch goals and every penny will go into making something amazing.  If we just hit the 2K goal, then we will find a way to pay for the rest out of pocket.  It may take us a bit longer, but we are focused and back in the saddle.

STRETCH GOAL  If we raise double our goal, we will do a very short run of vinyl records.  Anyone who wants one can pitch in an extra $30 to get their hands on one!

Read this far and still on the fence, but curious?  Our old album is up on bandcamp for free, so give that a spin and get a taste of what you would be in for should you choose to back the band.

Check out the brand new single!

https://fermata1.bandcamp.com/track/silhouettes

story:
ACCOLADE will be releasing their fourth studio album in Summer 2021. 
(Pre-release for Indiegogo supporters will be  May 13!)

TRIA PRIMA is the culmination of several years of recordings produced by the band in their Seattle, Washington studio.  The 10 song album is being mixed and mastered by Martin Bowes of the legendary experimental band, ATTRITION (Coventry, UK)

Please help us raise the money to get us through the final stretch of mastering, production of the merchandise,  and promotional materials for the release.

We really appreciate your support!

* Many thanks to Dane Hendricksen & Erica McAdams for their help with the video production!

ACCOLADE was founded in San Francisco by classical singer Stefanie Reneé and multi-instrumentalist Aaron Goldstein. The band relocated to Seattle in 2014 where they were then joined by electronic composer Mike Hines who brought new compositions and live percussion to the project.

story:
Hello Dearest One!

I am Eternally Grateful you are Here.

Thank you for taking the time and energy out of your Life to support this creation that is so near and dear to my heart and the hearts of all those who have been and will be touched by S.H.E.

 

WHAT IS S.H.E ?

 

S. H. E. is many things, but let me begin by sharing a few of its components.

 

S.H.E. is...

 

      ✧  A 3-Song E.P.

      ✧   My Artistic Debut as LADY MU.

      ✧   3 Music Videos that weave together as a seem-less cinematic journey of song, dance, and ceremonial storytelling.

 

The Heart of S.H.E. is composed of 3 powerful songs that came through me whole and complete from a source I honor as the Feminine Aspect of Creation. Each of these songs is connected to an Archetype of the Feminine...

 THE MAIDEN - THE MOTHER - THE WISE WOMAN

...and each of these potent songs will be accompanied by Music videos that weave together as a cinematic Muse-ical that brings the viewer through a timeless tale of initiation into the Mysteries of the Goddess.

 

LADY MU & THE MU MISSION

 

Some of you may know me as a Healer, some of you may know me as a singer/songwriter, some of you may know me as an Actress, some of you may know me as a Director & Visionary...and in essence, LADY MU is all parts of me woven into an integrated expression of my lifetime dedication to the Art of being a Muse.

My Mission as LADY MU is to give a Powerful Voice to the Feminine Creator through the Ancient-Feminine Arts of Song, Dance, and Ceremonial Storytelling. As a channel for our Cosmic Mother - I aim to create exquisite entertainment that is rooted in service to the healing, evolution, and reverence of all Life on this planet.

 

SUPPORTING S.H.E. & THE MU MEDICINE EXCHANGE

 

As many of you may know, bringing Music and Film into the world in a professional quality takes funding beyond what any independent artist can typically shoulder.  While I am wholeheartedly investing my own savings and taking out a small business loan for this project, it will not be enough to cover all of the necessary costs of creating S.H.E.

Though it’s never easy to ask for help, I know it is time to humbly ask for support from my commUnity and Allies who can bring this vision into the world with their love and backing. There is such power in numbers, and with a little bit of financial support from many I will be able to give life to this creation!

And in Sacred reciprocity for all those who generously support S.H.E. I have an array of Mu Medicine Offerings…Everything from my recorded Sound Ceremonies, Mu Medicine Bags & Handcrafted goodies, One-on One Sessions, 3 Month Metamorphosis Mentorship, a Private Medicine Immersion with yours truly…and infinitely more!

To give you an idea of what your generous offerings will be going towards, I have broken down the budget for this project below…

[listed in order of funding prioritization]

 

RECORDING - $7,000

  • Recording Studio (5 days)
  • Recording Engineer
  • Session Musicians
  • Music Producer

 

FILMING - $5,200

  • Cinematographer
  • Equipment
  • Hair/Makeup
  • Location Rental
  • Set/Props/Costumes
  • Dancers/Performers

 

POST – PRODUCTION - $4800

  • Film Editing
  • Color Grading
  • Mixing/ Mastering
  • Album Artwork
     

DISTRIBUTION - $3500

  • Copyright
  • Promotion
  • P/R
  • Vinyl Print

 

S.H.E. TOTAL COST = $20,500

                  - $5,500 (Personal Savings & Loan)

 

INDIEGOGO FUNDING GOAL  =  $15,000 + (10% Platform Cost)  = 

$16,600

 

THE IMPACT of S.H.E.

 

I have been deeply humbled to witness these songs transform the hearts and lives of many in the 2 years I have shared them in healings and ceremonies.

By assisting to bring S.H.E. into the world, you are not only empowering me as an artist, woman, and healer to step into sharing my fullest creations with a wider audience ~ you are giving life to timeless songs and stories that will serve to open and activate many hearts.

This project is much more than an E.P. to me, it is part of a life mission to give voice to the Goddess. For in the coming times, I believe S.H.E. is the one who will teach us to live in harmony with ALL LIFE and lead us home to our Hearts.

 

ARTISTIC RISKS & REWARDS

 

Making independent art always requires immense courage and a deep trust in the creation you are bringing into the world. This project will take 100's of hours, love, resilience, leadership, commitment, financial risk, and unwavering certainty ~ but I have never been more willing to offer myself so fully for a project (materially, emotionally, & spiritually).

The truth is whether I receive $1 or all $16,600 – I will find a way to bring this vision into the world, because it is what I am here to do!

However, without financial support, it will take far longer and require that I put myself in greater debt, which is never ideal as an independent artist. So my highest hope & prayer is that I can bring this beauty into the world with greater Ease, Abundance, and support from my Community.

 

OTHER WAYS TO GIVE A VOICE TO S.H.E...

 

For those of you that are not able to contribute financially at this time ~ I truly and deeply get it, I have often not had the extra resources to offer monetary support to the art I would have liked to. I want you to know that I Love and Appreciate you for supporting me and S.H.E by reading this! 

Luckily, if it is in your heart to support me and this project, there are several other ways you can help this campaign flourish...

  ✧  Post this Campaign on your Social Media Platforms

  ✧  Personally share the Campaign with your Community

  ✧  Send me a little Loving Encouragement (I'm a Sensitive Artist at Heart)

  ✧  Follow me on YouTube & Instagram - https://www.youtube.com/c/ladymu

  ✧  Join my Patreon SOUNDTRIBE for Sound Ceremonies – patreon.com/meramu

  ✧  Hold S.H.E. in your Wishes and Prayers ~ Help me create a resonant field of abundant success!

 

Thank you for Empowering me to make the Art I'm here to Birth.

Thank you for Supporting Feminine Wisdom & Expression.

Thank you for Giving a Voice to S.H.E.

You are so Appreciated.

 

Infinite Gratitude,

L▲DY MU

 

SPECIAL THANKS

Lucas Harper ~ Campaign Video ~ https://dlhphotography.com

Kaisi Berick ~ Music Production ~ https://www.whatisthesiren.com

Jenny Parker ~ S.H.E. Artwork ~ www.jennyparkerdesigns.com

Ashe Jordan ~ Make-Up ~ www.ashejordan.com

story:
Greetings, I’m Dan West, pianist/composer/arranger/producer coming to you from scenic Shadow Hills, California. Big band music is near and dear to my heart. From the first time my parents played big band vinyl in our living room when I was a tyke, I knew I was listening to something special. As I absorbed music composed by Duke Ellington, Billy Strayhorn, Nelson Riddle, Clare Fischer and others, I poured over the record covers, reading the liner notes, enthralled by the imagery of the band immaculately dressed to the nines. The nuanced layers of ensemble compositions truly swing, and constitute a rich, sophisticated musical dynamic like no other.

It's no wonder that this genre took hold of the jazz world and music fans for decades, captivating live audiences, rapt listeners on the radio, and dancers in ballrooms the world over. Long before Elvis, Big Band swing was the genre that raised the morale for troops on the war front which made band leaders to me feel larger than life.

These composers were true storytellers, creating wondrous works of art that have stood the test of time, becoming the memorable standards of the modern day and going forward. For many years now, I have been composing and arranging my own works for Big Band. Many of these pieces have been performed by accomplished musicians here in Los Angeles and none of them have ever been properly recorded.

When the quarantine hit in March of 2020, I figured I would take advantage of the extra down time and begin the process of finally realizing the dream of getting these arrangements recorded. Much of the passion I feel in recording my Big Band album revolves around keeping this timeless genre alive.

In my career, I have worked with a wide array of artists producing and arranging in the Pop and Jazz fields. Some of my collaborations include arranging for seasoned jazz artists such as Gary Herbig, Ralph Dudley, Socrates Trial, This Ain’t Your Daddy’s Big Band, and The Speakeasy Spies. In the pop field, I am currently producing trailblazing artists Mystery Rose, Frieda’s Roses, Lexx & The Roadzies, as well as my own groups, LoveyDove, Sidewalk Society and d’Animal.

With the help of some extremely talented musicians I know utilizing their home studios in addition to my own, we began the process of recording these charts. Ron Blake’s distinctive trumpet playing can be heard on performances and recordings with legendary artists Poncho Sanchez, Brian Setzer, Elton John, Dr. Dre and Green Day. His Hi Speed Horns, which include James King on Saxophone and Francisco Torres on Trombone, are also lending their immense talents on these recordings as well. Tony Pia, whose resume includes Maynard Fergusson, Mose Allison, Al Green, Diane Shuur, and The Temptations, provides his rhythmic expertise on drums.

So far, we have recorded three arrangements. My goal is to continue this process which includes tracking a dozen original arrangements including my big band tributes to Nirvana, Jimi Hendrix and Herbie Hancock. In order to do this, I will need to raise money to complete the project. The musicians involved need to be compensated as well as the arranger.

Therefore, I have launched this campaign where my dear friends, associates and devoted lovers of the arts can contribute whatever they can to help fully realize this vision. As a thank you, we're offering exciting perks ranging from autographed copies of the forthcoming recording on vinyl, to a piano or arranging lesson, one of my original paintings, a personalized arrangement of your favorite song and a thank you on the album credits.

One final point that is important to me. As a producer of, and teacher and mentor to young students and musicians today, I'm delighted to see how they embrace Big Band music. I'm hoping this project inspires the next great generation of musicians to honor and continue this elevated art form in their own way. Any contribution you make to this project also serves as a tool and an incentive for upcoming young talent to achieve that dream.

Thank you for your time. I hope you all will share this campaign with friends and family, and, to music lovers, art lovers and historians with whom I have no doubt, this project will resonate. My heartfelt thanks to all of you for hearing my story. In my eyes, each and every one of you are true Kings and Queens of Swing.

story:
BUY TICKETS:
 http://tickettailor.com/events/larkopera

The return of LIVE opera*

What's the perfect way to spend a June evening after months of lockdown?  Listening to beautiful music and sipping a glass of local pinot while the sun sets over the rolling hills of the Willamette Valley. (Of course.)

*Outdoors, socially distanced 
 

Perhaps you remember our performances of The Magic Flute back in the fall... (Read all about that in Oregon Arts Watch.) After a long winter, hunkered down at home, we're at it again! Rehearsing and programming pandemic-friendly opera performances, graciously hosted by our favorite Willamette Valley wineries,  

Our fall production was possible thanks to you, our loyal audience and generous supporters! And we're so incredibly grateful. We're counting on you to help us meet our funding goal by May 21st. Contribute today and to reserve your seat (they are limited). And, yes, children are welcome.

 

Performance dates

Friday, June 11, 2021
7:00pm @ Lady Hill Winery, St Paul, OR.
On a spacious looping lawn with mountain & valley vistas. Picnic tables, wooden lawn chairs, and sterilized blankets will be provided. You may bring food. Excellent wine will be for sale by Lady Hill. (Max audience size:  75)

Saturday, June 26, 2021
7:00pm @ Utopia Vineyard, St Paul, OR.
Utopia sits on a hill, overlooking mountains and forests. A wide flat lawn awaits, with some chairs and picnic tables (or bring a blanket). You may bring food. Excellent organic wine and snacks will be for sale by Utopia.
(Max audience size:  75)

 

Our story 

We are 7 classical singers (mostly young) from in and around Portland, Oregon. For most of the year, we've been singing alone, at home. Or "live" on Zoom and Facebook. Which really isn't fun for anyone. So we asked: how can we share live music during a pandemic? – by rehearsing and performing outdoors... by keeping the production lean and flexible ... simply letting the music shine!

That's how Lark Opera was born.

Now that the weather is warming up again, we're hard at work on our second production: Humperdinck's charming, Wagner-inspired Hansel & Gretel.

  • Sung in English
  • Costumes & props
  • Audience on blankets, picnic tables, lawn chairs (social distanced of course)
  • Bring a picnic
  • Wine will be available for sale at the event

 

WHO WE ARE

We are a small dedicated group of Portland-area singers: music teachers, choristers with both Portland and Eugene Opera, performing artists with Opera on Tap PDX, Classical Revolution PDX, Ping & Woof, and more. We will be sharing biographies of our singers throughout the campaign. 

  • Allison Knotts
  • Angelica G. Hesse
  • Erin Mikelle Walker
  • Jenna Skarphol
  • Katherine Goforth
  • Lauren Servias (piano)
  • Lindsey Rae Johnson
  • Rochelle Murphy

 

Your support makes this real!

We're reaching out to you to help cover the essential costs, to share with your friends – and most especially to come see & hear the opera! 

Our fundraising goal covers the minimum productions costs for our pianist, costumes pieces, program printing, and  advertising. If there's extra left over, it goes to the singers for the many, many hours they have already devoted to this project.   :) 

​With a song in our hearts, we thank you for your support! 

___________________________

Questions? Contact Angelica.
Learn more at larkopera.org
story_txt:
BUY TICKETS: http://tickettailor.com/events/larkopera
The return of LIVE opera*What's the perfect way to spend a June evening after months of lockdown?  Listening to beautiful music and sipping a glass of local pinot while the sun sets over the rolling hills of the Willamette Valley. (Of course.)*Outdoors, socially distanced  Perhaps you remember our performances of The Magic Flute back in the fall... (Read all about that in Oregon Arts Watch.) After a long winter, hunkered down at home, we're at it again! Rehearsing and programming pandemic-friendly opera performances, graciously hosted by our favorite Willamette Valley wineries,  Our fall production was possible thanks to you, our loyal audience and generous supporters! And we're so incredibly grateful. We're counting on you to help us meet our funding goal by May 21st. Contribute today and to reserve your seat (they are limited). And, yes, children are welcome. Performance datesFriday, June 11, 20217:00pm @ Lady Hill Winery, St Paul, OR.On a spacious looping lawn with mountain & valley vistas. Picnic tables, wooden lawn chairs, and sterilized blankets will be provided. You may bring food. Excellent wine will be for sale by Lady Hill. (Max audience size:  75)Saturday, June 26, 20217:00pm @ Utopia Vineyard, St Paul, OR.Utopia sits on a hill, overlooking mountains and forests. A wide flat lawn awaits, with some chairs and picnic tables (or bring a blanket). You may bring food. Excellent organic wine and snacks will be for sale by Utopia.(Max audience size:  75) Our story We are 7 classical singers (mostly young) from in and around Portland, Oregon. For most of the year, we've been singing alone, at home. Or "live" on Zoom and Facebook. Which really isn't fun for anyone. So we asked: how can we share live music during a pandemic? – by rehearsing and performing outdoors... by keeping the production lean and flexible ... simply letting the music shine!That's how Lark Opera was born.Now that the weather is warming up again, we're hard at work on our second production: Humperdinck's charming, Wagner-inspired Hansel & Gretel.
Sung in English
Costumes & props
Audience on blankets, picnic tables, lawn chairs (social distanced of course)
Bring a picnic
Wine will be available for sale at the event
 WHO WE AREWe are a small dedicated group of Portland-area singers: music teachers, choristers with both Portland and Eugene Opera, performing artists with Opera on Tap PDX, Classical Revolution PDX, Ping & Woof, and more. We will be sharing biographies of our singers throughout the campaign. 
Allison Knotts
Angelica G. Hesse
Erin Mikelle Walker
Jenna Skarphol
Katherine Goforth
Lauren Servias (piano)
Lindsey Rae Johnson
Rochelle Murphy
 Your support makes this real!We're reaching out to you to help cover the essential costs, to share with your friends – and most especially to come see & hear the opera! Our fundraising goal covers the minimum productions costs for our pianist, costumes pieces, program printing, and  advertising. If there's extra left over, it goes to the singers for the many, many hours they have already devoted to this project.   :) ​With a song in our hearts, we thank you for your support! ___________________________Questions? Contact Angelica.Learn more at larkopera.org

story:
A Once in a Lifetime Story...

Once upon a time, two women met and had an instant connection. Faith and Charlie had shared values, common interests and an undeniable chemistry which made it clear to both of them: this could be something different than either of them had ever experienced before. Despite Faith's inexperience with women, or Charlie's commitment issues, they were both ready to take the next steps forward...

And then 2020 happened.

Once in a Lifetime is a musical love story about what happens that perfect person shows up at a less-than-perfect time. Set in the early days of the Covid-19 pandemic, the story of Charlie and Faith seeks to explore many of the questions that have come up for all of us in the past year. Most importantly: can  new love make it in "the new normal?"

This six-episode podcast features a breathtaking original song in every episode, phenomenal scoring, and an incredible cast that will make you laugh, cry, and root for a happy ending...whether or not it comes.

 

LinCo Media: Who We Are, and What We're Doing...

LinCo Media is the creative partnership of Linda Hildonen and Colby Michaud, two passionate die-hards who have been working on this (our first project to go public!) for over a year.  Musicals are our passion, and we dream of a day where we can share our words and music with you on a full-time basis. But we need your help to make this first step a reality.

 

The Cast

We are blessed and delighted to be working with the following amazing talents (which is why we're asking for your help to compensate them!) 

  • Becca Lewis as Faith
  • Sam Dedian as Charlie
  • Linda Hildonen as Lisa
  • Tony Morin, Tamara Lilly and Sean Wallace as The Newscasters
  • Myra Lee Diehl as Amy
  • Jacquie Baker as Amanda
  • Daniel Bridgman as Jordan
  • Glenn Atkins as Rick
  • And more TBA...

 

We Need Your Help...

Don't be fooled by our professional-looking video (thanks to Colby's video production company, Praxis Motion Pictures), we really ARE a home-grown operation working on a shoestring budget. Despite their enormous talent, everybody involved in this podcast has a day job and is going above and beyond the help this project come together. We need your help to compensate our incredible cast, and to pay for studio time at the incredible Prism Analog in Portland. Some of the funds raise will also go to marketing the project, some equipment costs, and, of course, printing the amazing, limited-edition items that are available as perks.

Thanks from Colby and Linda!

story:
Wilfy Williams Brand New Album 2021!

After Wilfy's first Album The Pledge was crowdfunded in 2014, Wilfy went on to play live on BBC Radio 1. It's been a long 6 years since Wilfy has released any new songs so why now?

The Return of the Wilfy

After the success of the first album Wilfy was inspired to return to education to master his craft and was determined to reward his fans with something we could all be proud of.  So Wilfy returned to University and graduated with a degree in Music in 2018 and then graduated with a Masters degree in Music Performance in 2019. Just a few months later Wilfy went viral when busking in London. Putting his crowd-pleasing musical skills to good use he incited joy on the London Underground and made the national news, receiving over 6 million social media views and shares in a day. The pandemic has stopped Wilfy entertaining the crowds, but this time has enabled him to craft and complete the most inspiring album of new songs - and he's now excited to get into the groove in the studio.

A New Hope

Wilfy has teamed up with producer Rob Toulson (Talvin Singh, Mediaeval Babes, Daisy and the Dark) and they are already creating magic in the studio. So its that time again to gather round, get your face on the album artwork, get ready to conga away and contribute to Wilfy's first release since 2014! We are aiming to raise 1k to fund the album, which will cover the remaining production costs and the time of many wonderful musicians Wilfy has met along his journey.

Here is how you will help;

  • Wilfy is offering you the first download of the album as soon as it arrives back from being mastered and that could be months before the public will hear it.
  • There is also the chance to have your face on the album artwork! If you pledge a contribution you can have you or a loved ones face in a beautifully designed mosaic, which worked really well on the first album and is a thank you from Wilfy to you for supporting him.
  • You can participate in a live performance gig which is planned for a live venue in 2021 (Covid permitting). Wilfy is also offering the chance to book an intimate zoom gig with him.
  • Companies looking for some creative visibility can also sponsor the album. Wilfy will share sponsor logos and weblink's throughout his social media campaign. Private online gigs are also amongst the perks for album sponsors. 

So you've read this far and we can say you are already a part of the Wilfy family. With his charismatic charm and energy, you can look forward to sharing this amazing journey with Wilfy which is sure to be full of star studded opportunities and exploits.

"Thank you so much for all your support, my supporters have always supported me with the same passion I put into my music. This album has taken me 6 years to write because I wanted to produce for you something world class to say thank you for sticking with me. Was so much fun playing Live on Radio 1, and being seen by millions online performing music. Please continue your magical support and I am excited to let you hear something I feel we will all be so proud of. Oh and I want to see your face on the artwork again! Just a way for us all to be involved. Lots of love. Wilfy Feb 2021."

story:
Highways and Rocketships: Florence's Story

I am a Nashville-born, North Carolina-based independent musical artist making a new record, Highways and Rocketships. Some of you will already know that there have been all kinds of twists and turns on the road from my first record Perfect City (Slewfoot 2001) to Highways and Rocketships. I spent a lot of time between then and now riding around on Steve Earle’s tour bus, catching up with my Dukes-drumming husband Will Rigby, and getting tenure at UNC. I wrote a book on rock and roll and put on a conference at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, eventually taking a seat on the board at the Bob Dylan Institute as well. Somewhere along the way Will and I had a baby girl and have been raising her too. In my travels I have had the opportunity to interview masters of the trade (the late great John Prine, Richard Thompson, Lucinda Williams, and Steve Earle, to name a few) and am working on a new book now that compiles these. It dawned on me at some point that I was ready to write songs again and start touring. So I did. I assembled a great band (you know these guys: they play with Steve Earle, Bruce Springsteen, and Son Volt) and began to tour. And then the world shut down. 

Recording in Quarantine

As soon as the pandemic hit, we experimented with a social-distancing version of recording to keep the wheels turning, each of us playing our instruments in our own living rooms-- Don Dixon producing from his home studio.  We now have a version of Marshall Crenshaw's beautiful song "Somewhere Down the Line" that became the inspiration for a charting record to benefit Cat's Cradle called Cover Charge. You can hear how it came out for yourself at http://coverchargemusic.com and read about it in various media outlets, including Pitchfork: https://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/various-artists-cover-charge-nc-artists-go-under-cover-to-benefit-cats-cradle/

The quarantine recording method worked so well that I am going to finish Highways and Rocketships the same way, with the same musicians, and with Don Dixon producing. Pandemic or no pandemic, Highways and Rocketships is coming, and now we know that we can make it sound beautiful for you. Contributors can expect a lot of fun perks. I am very excited to announce that Ken Stringfellow (of the Posies) and I have recorded as a duo. He's been covering my song "Christmas" for years and we do it together for a single available to my supporters.  So you'll have access to that through this campaign, to some beautiful t-shirts designed by the inimitable Jon Langford, and a lot more goodies. Then, in Spring 2021, you'll receive the finished EP, Highways and Rocketships, available digitally, on CD, and a limited run of vinyl.

 

What I Need & What You Get

The funds raised here will pay for recording costs--production, mixing, musicians, mastering, and video--as well as CD and vinyl pressing.  In addition to supporting music when it has become harder to make, contributors are helping employ folks who work in the original gig economy. 

Perks for you (be sure to click on them, to see all that comes with each): 

* Exclusive track, duo of "Christmas," by Florence Dore & Ken Stringfellow (available here only)

* Highways and Rocketships, CD & vinyl

* Jon Langford designed t-shirts & other merch

* VIP tickets to safe, outdoor record release party following social distance rules  

* Autographed copies of my book on rock and southern fiction, Novel Sounds

* Autographed copies of my first record, Perfect City  

All items aside from physical copies of Highways and Rocketships will ship early 2021.

If the campaign makes more than we need for expenses related to this record, we'll roll it over to the next record.

 Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't contribute but still want to be a part of things, you can still get the word out and make some noise about the project!  We appreciate your sharing!

story:
A Place Tells a Story... 

As an artist, I strive to tell authentic, vulnerable and compelling stories that truly move people. 

Hi, I’m Taylor Dahl, and I’m a singer-songwriter from Los Angeles. 

I was born in Berkeley, CA and was raised by parents who loved Joni Mitchell, The Beatles and CSN&Y.  I have always loved music and performing.  I began songwriting 7 years ago, after a major life change, and released my first album in the Spring of 2020.  Spinnaker Street  (available on Spotify, iTunes, Bandcamp, YouTube etc.) was very well-received.  This strange year of pandemic isolation and introspection has inspired me to continue with some creative momentum. 

 

The Plan

I’m starting this campaign to raise the funds to record my 2nd album.  

The place?  San Felix, Colombia.... A quiet countryside, located an hour outside of Medellin. 

The story?  The journey of an artist who travels to a foreign land to endeavor an immersive experience of recording an entire album in 2 weeks. 

The songs?  Well, those will tell a story in and of themselves. (6 new songs)

The timeline?  November 15th-27th … over the course of 2 weeks. 

My buddy Rob LaFond suggested I come to Colombia for 2 weeks to record my next album and I thought, "That’s crazy… Or genius..." 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $6000 to fund the project
  • This budget will cover the costs of the recording studio, mixing/mastering, videographer, hiring local musicians, distribution, travel accommodations, and $500 to directly fund Medellin AV Club's project Legends of Medellin.
  • I'm offering some awesome perks for your generous donations including... a copy of the new album, a copy of both albums (Spinnaker Street and the new album), t-shirts, signed copies of the album, a collection of special limited edition Taylor Dahl Music merch (designed and made in Colombia just for this project), behind the scenes video footage, and a personalized video from Taylor.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will still go to the making of my next album.  There will still be awesome new music, it just may take a little longer to produce. 

 

The Impact

Your contributions will help make this project happen.  So much goes into the making of an album and ANY donations are greatly appreciated.  Production is much more affordable in Colombia and your contributions will also help support local Colombian musicians and videographers.  Additionally, your donations will directly support Rob’s amazing project, Legends of Medellin, a documentary series highlighting the different neighborhoods and culture of Colombia.  

 

Obstacles

You might be thinking, "How is Taylor going to record an entire album in 2 weeks? This seems unrealistic".   You can rest assured that my entire reason for this trip will be to record the acoustic album.  Life in Los Angeles is busy, and it always seems that I am juggling a dozen projects at the same time.  I feel confident that focusing and immersing myself into this singleness of purpose for 2 weeks will yield great results.  

You might also be thinking, "Is this a good time to go to Colombia with all that is going on in the world?"  Sadly, the news paints a negative and fear driven portrayal of Colombia.  I've spoken to Rob, who lives in Medellin, and he has confirmed that it is relatively safe if you make good choices.  I'm fully vaccinated and Rob also confirmed that people in Colombia are still following Covid-19 safety protocols.  Of course, there is always the chance that this could change... in which case I would delay my trip until it is safe to travel or make a new plan for recording.  Regardless, the new album will be made.  It is dying to come out!

Other ways you can help

If you're unable to donate for any reason, don't fret.  There are other ways you can help. 

Please consider sharing this campaign link with friends, colleagues and/or on social media.  Helping to get the word out is amazingly helpful!!  This is easy to do using the IndieGoGo share tools.  Let's make some noise!!

story:
We’re As Is

Hi! We’re Alan and Stacey Schulman also known as  "As Is” (Alan & Stacey Is…) – a couple of dreamers who started out as one Guitarist,  and one Vocalist,  who accidentally met over the chord changes of ‘Somewhere Over the Rainbow’ back in 2005.  When the song ended,  we went… “OMG that was soooo musical. We should do this.”  Well, it only took 1 wedding, 2 children, 3 CDs and 15 years for the world to notice too. We finally cracked the Top 10 on the Billboard Traditional Jazz charts with our indie-produced album, "Here’s to Life."  Jazz radio embraced the album and critics rated the effort 4 stars.   And then, just as quickly as we hit the clubs to perform the songs from “Here’s to Life”, the COVID pandemic hit and, like most of the world, we returned home to shelter in place. 

During these months of fear and isolation, we re-discovered how lucky we are to have music in our lives - and how crucial music is to our ability to express the joy, fear, love and loss of being human.   Like so many of you, we have been waiting to finally emerge from behind our masks and feel the fullness of LIVING!  Although the pandemic has been challenging, we feel so fortunate to have had this time and opportunity to explore a range of human emotion through music -- and we’ve given our hearts over to writing, selecting and arranging a collection of songs for a truly unique new album. 

Now, at long last, we are ready to bring this new group of songs to life - and we need your help.  

This is Where You Share the Stage!

Our new album entitled "Heart to Heart" is finally ready to be recorded - but we will need your help to make it a reality.  We would like to invite you to share the stage with us by donating your financial support to help us bring the music to life as we prepare to record and release it to the world in 2022.   "Heart to Heart" is not a collection of the same old jazz standards you’ve heard time and again (and no it’s not a tribute to that 80’s TV Show either).  It is a collection of deeply human songs that span decades… each carefully written, selected and arranged to represent the depth of emotions that speak to our hearts - as individuals; as two soulmates who have devoted our lives to each other; and to others like you who share our love for great melody, feeling and intimacy. It's life As Is – as we know it, as we feel it and as we hope to share it with you – Heart to Heart.

Here's How You Can Help

First, we hope you’ll contribute to our fundraising campaign by selecting the category and accompanying perks that are most appealing to you. But just as important, you can help us by sharing our campaign with your friends and family.  The more we get the word out to people who love heartfelt music, the better! Whether just one or more of our songs have moved you, we’d be so grateful if you shared or told someone you think might like us too!  And then, if you follow us on social media (please follow us on social media!) we hope you’ll share and re-post what we post.  Sharing, like music, creates a multiplier effect…so please help us get the word out to as many people as possible. 

We’d love you to let your followers know why you think As Is is worth a listen and show some love towards our new album. 

What Giving Means to As Is…

When you contribute to this Indiegogo campaign, you’ll be helping us fund the recording, mixing, mastering, musician fees, production and manufacturing necessary to create this series of heartfelt songs in a CD and vinyl record that we hope to give to the world and… who knows... maybe even put your name on it as an Associate or Executive Producer.  Whether you contribute as a fan or a producer, every contribution helps us get closer to our goal … and we are so very grateful. With the right resources, we will be able to create a beautiful album and continue on our journey to connect with the heart of the world through music. 

We thank you in advance for your support and for helping Heart to Heart from As Is become a reality.
story_txt: We’re As IsHi! We’re Alan and Stacey Schulman also known as  "As Is” (Alan & Stacey Is…) – a couple of dreamers who started out as one Guitarist,  and one Vocalist,  who accidentally met over the chord changes of ‘Somewhere Over the Rainbow’ back in 2005.  When the song ended,  we went… “OMG that was soooo musical. We should do this.”  Well, it only took 1 wedding, 2 children, 3 CDs and 15 years for the world to notice too. We finally cracked the Top 10 on the Billboard Traditional Jazz charts with our indie-produced album, "Here’s to Life."  Jazz radio embraced the album and critics rated the effort 4 stars.   And then, just as quickly as we hit the clubs to perform the songs from “Here’s to Life”, the COVID pandemic hit and, like most of the world, we returned home to shelter in place. During these months of fear and isolation, we re-discovered how lucky we are to have music in our lives - and how crucial music is to our ability to express the joy, fear, love and loss of being human.   Like so many of you, we have been waiting to finally emerge from behind our masks and feel the fullness of LIVING!  Although the pandemic has been challenging, we feel so fortunate to have had this time and opportunity to explore a range of human emotion through music -- and we’ve given our hearts over to writing, selecting and arranging a collection of songs for a truly unique new album. Now, at long last, we are ready to bring this new group of songs to life - and we need your help.  This is Where You Share the Stage!Our new album entitled "Heart to Heart" is finally ready to be recorded - but we will need your help to make it a reality.  We would like to invite you to share the stage with us by donating your financial support to help us bring the music to life as we prepare to record and release it to the world in 2022.   "Heart to Heart" is not a collection of the same old jazz standards you’ve heard time and again (and no it’s not a tribute to that 80’s TV Show either).  It is a collection of deeply human songs that span decades… each carefully written, selected and arranged to represent the depth of emotions that speak to our hearts - as individuals; as two soulmates who have devoted our lives to each other; and to others like you who share our love for great melody, feeling and intimacy. With the right resources, we will be able to create a beautiful album and continue on our journey to connect with the heart of the world through music. We thank you in advance for your support and for helping Heart to Heart from As Is become a reality.

story:
20 Years!

Please join me for a very special project for 2020 to celebrate the 20th anniversary of my first album, Not The Tremblin' Kind. I have material ready to make an album, but I've been puzzling over how to properly celebrate this anniversary. Instead of a traditional album, I thought it would be exciting to record two songs with different producers and release them as virtual singles roughly every two months.  Basically, rather than putting out a 10- or 12-song album at one time, I’d like to offer a 5 to 6 "singles" over the course of the next few months to celebrate my 20-year career. We will then compile all the recordings at the end of the process into a full length album that will be available on CD. 

What I Need & What You Get

The money I raise through this project will help pay for recording costs - studio time, producer fees and musicians. These funds will also cover the production of physical copies of the new album once all of the music is recorded.

Through your support, I will be able to record with several different producers and musicians in key music cities.

Everyone who supports the project will get immediate access to each "two-sided" single as they are finished.

If I can raise enough funds then we can press vinyl of the collected singles.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't contribute, you can still help to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. That would be a huge help! 

Thanks, Laura

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for checking out our EP fundraising page! In the last year and a half we have recorded 3 singles, 2 of which charted at #2 on the Canadian iTunes inspirational charts. But it's time to dream bigger. We are so excited to have this opportunity to travel to Nashville, Tennessee and record our all new original EP with a Billboard charting producer. The songs on this EP will include Holy, The Reason, Power In The Name and more. These songs have had a huge impact on the local church here in Chilliwack, British Columbia, but these songs were never meant to be contained within the four walls of the church. They were meant to have a global impact, and that's what we are planning to do with the recording and networking opportunities we have in Nashville. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised in this campaign will help fund travel expenses, studio rental fees, recording and engineering fees, producer fees as well as graphic design and marketing expenses. Any money raised beyond our goal will go towards videography projects and music videos to help promote the songs. 

The Impact

Upon completion, this EP will be marketed and made available for other churches to use as well as pitched to record labels and radio stations globally. The EP will range in variety and will include both praise and worship songs designed to bring hope to people and glory to God.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge will be travelling with some of the restrictions still in effect, but we believe God has a plan and are believing that everything will go smoothly.

Other Ways You Can Help

PRAY. Pray that God's will be done in the making and distribution of this EP, that the whole process would go smoothly from the beginning to the end and that the name of Jesus would be lifted all over the world through these songs.

story:
My Story

Hello - I’m singer songwriter, Malachi Jaggers. A year ago I made a decision to go on this journey as an Americana musician. My wife and I experienced some devastating years before 2020. And borne out of those experiences, new songs, new hearts, and new outlooks emerged about us, about the world, and about our place in it. Armed with these songs aimed to heal, encourage, and entertain I made the decision to go on this journey as an Americana musician. The beginning of 2020 brought much excitement and renewed hope of good things to come. I booked the studio time, worked on pre-production with Producer and friend Matt Coles, and refined the songs. Then came February and the time at the studio with musicians and not just any musicians. Studio and touring musicians that I have long admired for their talents. It was a great day. A few more days doing vocal overdubs.. And then before we knew it we were heading home talking about how amazing it all was and how amazing it all will be. And then came shutdowns, lockdowns, isolation. It sounds depressing and devastating and indeed it was and is for many still. But how in awe we are that the recording was done just under the wire. And that soon, with your help these songs of encouragement and healing from devastation and heartbreak will be available for a world healing from just that- devastation and heartbreak. It seems to be perfectly timed for hearts that need the message. And we hope that is exactly where it lands- in open hearts ready for a new season, a new message, and a new song. And all it takes is is you. I can’t make this happen without your financial support. 

What I Need

I’ve put together a reasonable budget of $10,000.00 for this album, and there are so many different ways you can participate.

What's included in the $10k?

- Mixing + Mastering

- Worldwide Digital Distribution (to Apple Music, Spotify, etc.)

- CD’s

- Merchandise

- Promotion and Marketing (including video and photography)

- Graphic Design (for cover art and merchandise)

What You’ll Get

Package 1 - $8.00 - Digital Download of album - (emailed directly to you)

Package 2 - $20.00 - Signed CD and Sticker

Package 3 - $30.00 - Signed CD, Sticker, Signed flyer, and Digital Download (emailed directly to you)

Package 4 - $50.00 - Signed CD, T-shirt, Digital Download (emailed directly to you), Sticker, and Signed Flyer

Package 5 - $75.00 - Signed CD, T-shirt, Digital Download (emailed directly to you), Sticker, and Signed Flyer, Handwritten Lyrics (one of a kind) to one song from the CD

Package 6 - $100.00 - Signed CD, T-shirt, Digital Download (emailed directly to you), Sticker, Signed Flyer, and a copy of Nashville number charts of the songs - (emailed directly to you)

Package 7 - $175.00 - One on One Zoom meet and greet  (15 minutes with max 1 song), Signed CD and a copy of Nashville number charts of the songs - (emailed directly to you)

Package 8 - $250.00 - Signed CD, Sticker, Digital Download (emailed directly to you), and a song that didn't make the album w/handwritten lyrics for that song- (emailed directly to you)

Package 9 - $400.00 - 1 hour Personal Zoom Concert (Invite your friends!) 

Package 10 - $750.00 - 1 hour Zoom Concert  with a pre concert 15 minute meet and greet + all the swag mentioned above

Package 11 - $1,500.00 - Signed CD and I will compose and record  (acoustic guitar and vocals only) a love song for your significant other or song about your crazy ex. Or pick a topic or a loved one to write a song about. I can write songs about moms, dads, brothers, sisters, dogs, and cats etc. Song must be appropriate subject matter determined by me. I will send a questionnaire to gather information.

Package 12 - $2500.00 The complete package + 2 Virtual singing telegrams for two people of your choosing.(Christmas, Birthdays, Anniversary, etc.) Must use within a year.

If I don’t reach my entire goal the funds raised will still go toward the project.

Your Impact

Your contribution will make will make a huge difference in peoples lives in bringing them the joy of music. Especially during this difficult time, I believe people need to hear the encouraging message within the song lyrics. When you give a gift you are not only giving it to me but to others who will hear this music and be uplifted by it.

The recording is sounding amazing. I had some of the best musicians in Nashville as my backing band: guys who have played with Neil Young, Kenny Chesney, Linda Rondstat, The Wallflowers, Joe Walsh, John Fogerty, Ringo Starr, Peter Frampton and James Taylor to name a few.

The Team

Tom Bukovac - Acoustic and Electric Guitars - Vince Gill, Joe Walsh, Alison Krauss, Kenny Chesney, Bob Seger, Alabama

Chad Cromwell - Drums - Kenny Chesney, Brian Wilson, Peter Frampton, Neil Young, Dolly Parton, The Beach Boys

Dan Dugmore - Steel Guitar and Electric Guitar - Linda Ronstadt, James Taylor, Glenn Campbell, The Doobie Brothers, Alan Jackson,

Jimmy Wallace - Piano and Hammond B3 - The Wallflowers, Kenny Wayne Shepherd Band

Steve Mackey - Bass Guitar - Peter Frampton, Keb ‘Mo’, Dolly Parton, Wynonna Judd

Windy Wagner - Background Vocals - Ringo Starr, Dave Stewart, Joe Walsh

Matt Coles - Engineer, Mixing, Producing, Background Vocals - Willie Nelson, Little Big Town, Chicago, Don Henley, Dan + Shay, A.J. Croce, Dolly Parton

Lowell Reynolds - Assistant Engineer

And of course… I played guitars, sang lead vocals, wrote and co-wrote some songs.

Recorded at: Blackbird Studio, Nashville, TN 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to contribute financially? You can still help me! Share my story with your friends and family via social media. Taking a few moments to share my story, via a click or swipe, is a valuable gift.  And that's all there is to it. I appreciate your help!
