story:
A Little About Me

Hey! Thank you for coming to check out my Indiegogo Campaign! Like many professional touring musicians, this past year has given me an opportunity to take a breath, and to focus on writing new music and learning some new skills. With the songs written and recorded, I am here for my second time on Indiegogo to ask for your support in completing this album, and helping to promote it!

If you are new to my story and my music, here is a little more about me: 

I was born in upstate New York, but raised in Northern California with parents who were big time believers in the Columbia House 20 CDs for $1 deals, so my musical background is a motley mess of everything from Joe Public to Diane Schuur. I started playing guitar at age 14, when I fell in love with Nirvana, the Doors, and Aerosmith. I picked up a paper route, and earned enough money for my first dream guitar, a Gibson SG.

I played in bands through high school and college (Good Question, 24/7, Harvest Red) and had a blast. It wasn't until I met a group of fellas in Chicago that I really saw what opportunities music could open up for me. Vintage Blue was our band. We played some big festivals, opened for some awesome artists, and threw ourselves into trying to "make it" as a working band in Chicago. In 2015, our band had the opportunity to meet music fans from around the world on The Rock Boat, a music-themed cruise, after winning a battle of the bands. Not long after that, the band split, and I tried to find a way to play music and also keep working 100 hour weeks as a lawyer. That did not last long. I decided to leave law when I released my first solo album, "These Dreams".

Since that release in 2016, I opened my life to an experience of performing on the road, and trying to make a living from my music. In a few short years I have played over 600 shows in 44 of the U.S. states, and 7 different countries. I have driven over 500,000 miles. I have opened for international superstars, and I have belted out songs to a lone bartender. 

As all of us know, 2020 was a year unlike any that we have lived through. It was a time when the music truly stopped, along with many sports, spending time with friends, and a host of other things that used to be completely normal. 2020 also meant a financial strain on independent artists like myself. At times it made me wonder if I would still be able to pursue this journey. Luckily I was able to find my way through, thanks to support from many of you.

Now I am back, asking for you to come to my aid again, and help me bring a brand new batch of songs into the world!

What I Need & What You Get

In 2018 I created my first Indiegogo Campaign. With your help, I was able to raise enough money to hire producers Kit Karlson, and Chip Johnson to help me craft six entirely new songs, and make them ready for radio and international distribution. During that last project I asked you to help me raise $15,000 and you all came through in a HUGE way. You all put me over that amount, and made my dream record a REALITY! I was able to complete the project on time, and the album received coverage from all over the world in print and digital magazines, and on terrestrial radio.

This time around, I am looking to raise $9,000.  The reason for the different goal amount from my previous record, is because I have done most of the studio engineering and mixing on my own. That saves a significant amount from the cost of making an album.

The funds will be used in the following way:

  • $2,500 for Album Completion, Artwork, & Mastering
  • $2,500 for Press, Promotion, Playlisting, and Advertising Fees
  • $1,250 for Physical Album Production
  • $2,000 for Merchandise Production & Shipping
  • $750 Fees collected by Indiegogo & CC Fees

In return for your contribution I have a collection of goods ready for you to grab up! I have entirely brand new and EXCLUSIVE goods for Indiegogo backers, including sweatshirts, long sleeve tees, t-shirts, a mug, pint glasses, shot glasses, sunglasses, and all sorts of other goodies! I am really REALLY stoked about the new logo, and my first full color designs on all these goods!

The Impact

As many of you know, I have a difficult time asking for help. Perhaps I owe it to my grandfather and those in the greatest generation, but he made so much of ones ability to provide for themselves and their families. I will always admire the way he was able to do that. For me, sometimes I have to get over that hump, and admit that I need a little push to complete a big project, and sometimes it takes me a little while to make that request. But here I am, putting my new music in your hands.

Your contribution allows me to bring new, thoughtful, and introspective songs into the world. If you know my songwriting, you know that I base my songs in real life experiences, and their impacts on people. These songs are no different.

If you know me and my merchandise, you also know that I will make sure you get high quality goods, that are comfortable and good lookin.

As a bonus, your support on this album, will likely mean more music in the future, since the cost of producing tunes myself is much less expensive.

Risks & Challenges

The best part about this particular project, is that the risks regarding the music are minimal. 90% of the work is complete. Therefore, with the exception of some final mix advice, and mastering work, the music is ready ... unless more songs might be coming (HINT HINT .... )

  • The biggest challenge may be production. 2020 has seen delays in production and delivery of nearly every good you can think of from hot tubs to time machines! So, something I love and list as a reward today, may be backordered or out of stock when time for delivery. That said, I will work to make the items to you as soon as humanly possible. And either way, you will get the music on time!

Other Ways You Can Help

I have made as many levels of contribution that I can feasibly make, but some of you may still not feel comfortable contributing at this point. That is OKAY! Here are some other ways that you can help me out!

  • Share this campaign! Not just share the link, but tag a friend or let someone know why you follow me, and what you appreciate about my music.
  • Indiegogo makes it easy with share tools right on my page!
  • Share your favorite Benny Bassett song!
  • Go watch a Benny YouTube video or listen on Spotify! Both help me!
  • Consider supporting my Patreon whenever you are financially capable.

And that's all there is to it.

In 2015, our band had the opportunity to meet music fans from around the world on The Rock Boat, a music-themed cruise, after winning a battle of the bands. Not long after that, the band split, and I tried to find a way to play music and also keep working 100 hour weeks as a lawyer. That did not last long. I decided to leave law when I released my first solo album, "These Dreams".Since that release in 2016, I opened my life to an experience of performing on the road, and trying to make a living from my music. In a few short years I have played over 600 shows in 44 of the U.S. states, and 7 different countries. I have driven over 500,000 miles. I have opened for international superstars, and I have belted out songs to a lone bartender. 
As all of us know, 2020 was a year unlike any that we have lived through. It was a time when the music truly stopped, along with many sports, spending time with friends, and a host of other things that used to be completely normal. 2020 also meant a financial strain on independent artists like myself. At times it made me wonder if I would still be able to pursue this journey. Luckily I was able to find my way through, thanks to support from many of you.
Now I am back, asking for you to come to my aid again, and help me bring a brand new batch of songs into the world!
What I Need & What You Get
In 2018 I created my first Indiegogo Campaign. With your help, I was able to raise enough money to hire producers Kit Karlson, and Chip Johnson to help me craft six entirely new songs, and make them ready for radio and international distribution. During that last project I asked you to help me raise $15,000 and you all came through in a HUGE way. You all put me over that amount, and made my dream record a REALITY! I was able to complete the project on time, and the album received coverage from all over the world in print and digital magazines, and on terrestrial radio.
This time around, I am looking to raise $9,000.  The reason for the different goal amount from my previous record, is because I have done most of the studio engineering and mixing on my own. That saves a significant amount from the cost of making an album.
The funds will be used in the following way:

$2,500 for Album Completion, Artwork, & Mastering
$2,500 for Press, Promotion, Playlisting, and Advertising Fees
$1,250 for Physical Album Production
$2,000 for Merchandise Production & Shipping
$750 Fees collected by Indiegogo & CC Fees

In return for your contribution I have a collection of goods ready for you to grab up! I have entirely brand new and EXCLUSIVE goods for Indiegogo backers, including sweatshirts, long sleeve tees, t-shirts, a mug, pint glasses, shot glasses, sunglasses, and all sorts of other goodies! I am really REALLY stoked about the new logo, and my first full color designs on all these goods!
The Impact
As many of you know, I have a difficult time asking for help. Perhaps I owe it to my grandfather and those in the greatest generation, but he made so much of ones ability to provide for themselves and their families. I will always admire the way he was able to do that. For me, sometimes I have to get over that hump, and admit that I need a little push to complete a big project, and sometimes it takes me a little while to make that request. But here I am, putting my new music in your hands.
Your contribution allows me to bring new, thoughtful, and introspective songs into the world. If you know my songwriting, you know that I base my songs in real life experiences, and their impacts on people. These songs are no different.
If you know me and my merchandise, you also know that I will make sure you get high quality goods, that are comfortable and good lookin.
As a bonus, your support on this album, will likely mean more music in the future, since the cost of producing tunes myself is much less expensive.

Risks & Challenges
The best part about this particular project, is that the risks regarding the music are minimal. 90% of the work is complete. Therefore, with the exception of some final mix advice, and mastering work, the music is ready ... unless more songs might be coming (HINT HINT .... )
The biggest challenge may be production. 2020 has seen delays in production and delivery of nearly every good you can think of from hot tubs to time machines! So, something I love and list as a reward today, may be backordered or out of stock when time for delivery. That said, I will work to make the items to you as soon as humanly possible. And either way, you will get the music on time!

Other Ways You Can Help
I have made as many levels of contribution that I can feasibly make, but some of you may still not feel comfortable contributing at this point. That is OKAY! Here are some other ways that you can help me out!

Share this campaign! Not just share the link, but tag a friend or let someone know why you follow me, and what you appreciate about my music.
Indiegogo makes it easy with share tools right on my page!
Share your favorite Benny Bassett song!
Go watch a Benny YouTube video or listen on Spotify! Both help me!
Consider supporting my Patreon whenever you are financially capable.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Dawn? Tell us more...

Can you believe it?...our 6th CD! And once again, it'll be a full-length album! This time though it's not just a compilation of random songs that we've pulled together. This time the songs tell a story, a timeline, an album about experiences / challenges / successes that have led Betsy along her musical journey and the tremendous impact each experience had on her life. From the tragedy of losing her mother (Dawn) from cancer when Betsy was just 9 years old to the amazing person she is today.

Instead of releasing a full album all at once, we're releasing each single individually and then ultimately compiling them all on a single album when the 9th single is set to be released. Starting August 27th, we'll be releasing the first single "Forever" followed by another single every 4 - 5 weeks. Each song will guide you along this courageous and exciting journey of Betsy's.  

 

The Reality of Producing an Album

As all of you undoubtedly know, creating music that can stream on platforms like iTunes, Spotify, YouTube, and many other streaming sites, costs a tremendous amount of money. The costs associated with recording, editing, publishing, marketing, artwork, physical albums, merchandise, subscriptions, licenses, professional assistance, social media, and more, can cost tens of thousands of dollars. For the world's most well-known artists...even millions. We truly need your help to reach our goal of raising $30,000 for the creation of this album, and in return we want to share along the way. 

We have created a number of 'perks' (listed to the right) that require a certain level of financial contribution, HOWEVER, will in return give you a gift, or many gifts, helping us to ultimately reach our financial goal. How will the $30,000 be spent? 

  • $16,000 - Recording, Editing, Mixing & Mastering
  • $6500 - Merchandise
  • $4000 - Videos and Multi-Media Needs
  • $2500 - Promotional Efforts
  • $550 - Various Licenses and Subscriptions
  • $450 - Artwork and Photography

There are other miscellaneous expenses, but your generosity will help us cover the amounts listed above. 

 

The Creative Team

While the following is a list of individuals directly involved with the creation of this album, there are SO many others (too many to list) that make this all possible. We can never fully express our gratitude with simple words. Those directly involved:

  • Betsy Ade:  Vocals, Ukulele, Songwriter, Lyricist, Co-Producer, Artwork, Story
  • Joe Adamek:  Guitars, Piano, Keyboards, Percussion, Songwriter, Producer, Artwork, Campaign Manager
  • Cameron Fair:  Cello, Piano, Keyboards, Songwriter, Arrangement
  • John Kulas:  Bass Guitar, Arrangement
  • Scott Fox:  Percussion, Arrangement
  • Victor Cera:  Tour Manager, Campaign Co-Manager
  • Chantel Godlewski:  Merchandise Manager
  • Nick Radovanovic (Nick Rad Audio LLC):  Song Mixing & Editing
  • Steven Servi (Nick Rad Audio LLC):  Song Editing
  • Justin Perkins (Mystery Room Mastering):  Song Mastering

 

Other Ways to Help

We understand that some of our fans simply can't afford to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here's ways to help us get this story out to others:

  • Make noise about this campaign! Share the link! (Use the Indiegogo share tools!)
  • Get the word out on this album! As our singles are released, point others to the songs!
  • Tell music magazines/websites/blogs/other relevant avenues about this project.
  • Post info about this project on social media! 
  • Email your friends and family around the world (this system works the best)
  • Tell your friends directly (old school style.... offline).

 

A Few Challenges

Since we're releasing each single individually, one after the other, the final singles (9th and 10th songs and the full album), won't come out until April 8, 2022. This means that while financial contributions will be needed now, some of the gifts may not come until 2nd quarter of 2022. Other gifts, like the digital download of each single, will be delivered ahead of each single release. 

Also, please know that regardless of the amount that the fundraising campaign will generate, we are fully committed to using all the amount raised for this album. If we exceed our target goal, we'll be armed with additional funds to do more with things like promotion, video, and social media. If we don't reach the funding goal, we will still get the album out, but we would have to adjust the amount of money spent on various elements.

With any question regarding the music, the rewards or any other issue - do not hesitate to contact us! Email us at info@wellknownstrangers.com. 

 

Thank You!

Each and every one of us involved in BAWKS (Betsy, Joe, John, Cameron, Scott, Vic, and Chantel) thank you from the bottom of our hearts! We love you all beyond words! 

- BAWKS

story:
What Moxie are all about 

Hi! We are Moxie, an Alt Folk band from Ireland.  We released our debut album 'Planted' in 2014 and toured our music in Australia, Vietnam and countries across Europe. Our travels and performances have allowed us to share our culture and enable us to learn about the music of the world we live in today. Since then we have grown as professional musicians and released two EP's. Learning new instruments and skills has enabled us to shape our current sound. We're excited for you to hear it.  

This new record will convey the progression of our sound through our travels and experiences with different cultures and people. It features a blend of electric and acoustic instruments with the music showcasing a variety of genres. Our compositions are also influenced by the musicians from the past and present who inspire us, enabling the band to maintain a distinct and original sound.

Meeting and collaborating with singer/songwriter Julia Spanu has allowed us to explore the power of song.  Julia, who has roots in Tunisia, France, Italy and Vietnam will feature on this record. She has a vast understanding of traditional folk songs. This, mixed with our innovative take on Irish music has created a unique style that we are super excited to share with you.

We hope that you will join us on this journey to producing and recording our new record!

Moxie includes Sligo brothers Jos Kelly (button accordion/keyboards/bass-synth) & Ted Kelly (tenor banjo/electric tenor guitar/sampler), Limerick natives Darren Roche (button accordion/glockenspiel/bodhrán), & Cillian Doheny (tenor banjo/guitar/electric guitar) as well as Cork native Josh Sampson (drums/percussion).

This record will also feature guest musicians such as French violinist Jean-Christophe Morel and Irish guitarist Richie Delahunty.

We've had the pleasure to work on this new album with recording engineer, Alex Borwick in Camden Studios, Dublin. 

We are also delighted that Jake Birch will be producing the album. We've worked with Jake in the past and found his approach to our music to be meticulously innovative. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In terms of creative arrangements, we have pushed our boundaries to bigger heights in order to put this record together.  Are you ready to help us over the final hurdle? 

We have combined the best perks for any contributor to our project, so feel free to get the package that suits you the best, you've got plenty of rewards to choose from!

Here is what we need to make this record:

Recording Costs

  • Studio Time €4,000
  • Engineer €3,500
  • Production €5,000
  • Mixing €2,000
  • Mastering €1,500

Marketing Costs

  • Album Artwork €2,000
  • Album Manufacturing €2,500
  • Music Videos €2,500
  • PR and Online Marketing €4,000

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways for you to show your support if you aren't able to contribute financially:

  • You can share this campaign on social media
  • Follow us on our Instagram or Facebook page 
  • Spread the word via word-of-mouth
  • You can use the "share tools" provided by Indiegogo 

Your support over the last few years means a lot to us. We look forward to sharing our new music with you and to meeting you on the road in 2020!

Thank you,

Ted, Julia, Darren, Cillian, Jos and Josh.

story:
THIS ALBUM IS ABOUT
BREAKING OUT OF YOUR CHAINS

 

Join us and realize together with us the production and release of our second full-length album "THE MISSING STONE". 10 new tracks plus bonus track await you and will take you on a journey through psychological crises, despair, hope and regaining your power.

How can you contribute to our album?

 

You don't have a credit card?

To pre-order and contribute to our campaign via Paypal, please click here.
For free donations to the campaign via Paypal, please click here.

Shipping

The shipping costs will be calculated on top of physical perks. If you want to have a combination of perks, that could be packed in one shipment and is not already listed, please contact us at info@dreamocean.net or on this page. We will then create this perk-package for you to order.

UPDATE 3rd August 2021:
We reached our goal of 7000€ and started to manufacture the album! Thank you all very much! All perks are still free to get, but it is not possible anymore to get your name into the booklet, even if the perk says so. In order to have the CD available in time we had to start the physical creation as soon as possible.

This time we have decided to continue our way as an independent band. With our second full-length studio album “THE MISSING STONE” this time we will take you into a psychological puzzle. 

Musically, THE MISSING STONE is our next step in defining our own sound. As a first glimpse, we already have released two singles, "Pendulum of Time" and, as a reaction to the muted stages during the COVID-Crisis, "The Great Silence":

Nowadays, having songs that you are absolutely convinced of, is not enough. We also need to enlarge our presence on social media. Therefore we want to work with good cinematographers and promoters to increase our reach worldwide.
This is where you as a contributor can make a big difference because your funding allows us to make bigger videos and promotional campaigns.

What We Need & What You Get

We are an independent band and we know that we can rely on your support to make the release of “The Missing Stone” happen. With this campaign, we also hope to get to know you, our listeners, more closely and make you a part of this album.

WHAT WE NEED:
We will need to cover all the expenses of the production and release of “The Missing Stone” :

  • Pre-production days at the studio
  • Recording, mixing, and mastering
  • Artwork and booklet design
  • Music Videos of the album for four songs
  • Promotion

We need 7.000€ to fully realize this album.

Stretch Goals:

In the case we exceed our primary goal, we will be able to create even more content!
If we reach:

  • 10.000€ we will produce another music video
  • 15.000€ we will record another song together with a music video: Apex Predator is thematically the follow-up to The Missing Stone. Don't you want to know, what comes next?
  • 25.000€ we will produce an acoustic live dvd with brand-new arrangements of your favorite Dream Ocean-songs

Your Impact

With the music industry changing and leaning more towards streaming platforms, the role of the audience becomes bigger in supporting the artists. Especially in metal music, the audience and the artists are very close. This is why we decided to work this time without a label and come directly to you.
You have the chance to immediately help us making the music you and we both love. A successful release helps us to continue our work and hopefully soon perform again on stage for every single one of you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you decide to join our campaign and be a part of our journey, we would be absolutely thrilled. However, if you cannot contribute at the moment, we understand that. But you can still help us!

Share our campaign and make people aware of our music and our goals. Let us together take this new fire around the globe.

story:
Hey guys!

Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign in support of my first Hip Hopera album!

I (in)formally invite you to join me on the ground level of this album's creation. Your support (both through the years and now) means so much to me, and I look forward to sharing this experience with you in the days ahead! 

 

About me:

I'm a Nigerian-American opera singer whose first musical love was hip hop. I grew up in Lagos, Nigeria and even though I wasn't born into a musical family, I was born into a musical culture. I developed an affinity for rhythmic music early and that affinity turned to love when I first heard hip hop. I was nine years old and my uncle snuck me a tape of Dr. Dre's The Chronic. I remember listening over and over, trying to learn every single word, At that time, I was only vaguely aware of the existence of classical music. 

This happened after I moved to California as a teenager. One of my friends convinced me to sign up for a class that would turn out to be a choir class. This was where I was first taught about singing and harmonies, and where I developed a love for classical music that ran alongside my love for hip hop. I decided to pursue a career in classical music and it was in that pursuit that I ended up in front of the voice teacher that said, "You should sing opera."

A year later I was in "opera college" getting assigned my first opera. I was immersed in opera music but would always notice similarities and relationships between opera and hip hop. I would often sing opera in a hip hop style on my own and in secret because I didn't think my colleagues would appreciate it, but I thought it sounded dope. One day I decided to post a video of me singing the opera aria, Largo al factotum over the hip hop beat from Kendrick Lamar's Humble and it went viral! This inspired me to release an EP titled Della Citta of three operatic hip hop  (Hip Hopera) songs in March of 2019 and people LOVED it! So I've decided to go all out and release a full album of Hip Hopera music, but I need your help!

 

 

Perks of Supporting:

  • Personalized Thank You Video
  • Digital Album Download
  • Exclusive Campaign Merch
  • Advance signed copy of the album (vinyl)
  • VIP admission to Exclusive Listening Party
  • Album credit for sponsorship (the listing of your name in the official album credits as a sponsor of the album)

 

Campaign Breakdown:

The making & release of this record will cost an estimated $50,000 inclusive of:

  • Studio time 

  • Producer fees (pre-production/production)

  • Engineering (recording, mixing & mastering)

  • Studio musician/orchestra fees

  • Travel costs, accommodations & incidentals (for the duration of recording and mixing)

  • Physical copies (vinyls, CDs)

  • Global marketing 

 

​The Impact:

The funds raised by this campaign will make it possible for me to make this album the best that it can possibly be. The campaign for my EP "Della Citta" helped me create something new, thrilling, and game-changing. This has truly been a next-level experience for me and a pinnacle moment in my musical journey so far. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your encouragement, your excitement, and your generous support in helping to bring life to my creative vision. 

 

Risks & Challenges:

Unforeseen costs and challenges often arise during the course of making and releasing an album, especially during these COVID times. Through your valued support, I will be able to minimize those risks while also ensuring that this album is of the utmost quality and fully reflects my vision.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

I totally understand if you would like to support but are unable to make a financial contribution! There are several other ways to lend support should you so desire:

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend who might be interested in supporting it.
  • "Like" and "Follow" me on social media:
    • Follow me on Facebook:                                              https://www.facebook.com/babatundehiphopera/
    • Follow me on Instagram:                              https://www.instagram.com/babatunde_hiphopera/
    • Subscribe to my YouTube:                                                 http://www.youtube.com/c/HipHoperaGuy
    • Follow me on TikTok:                                                                http://www.tiktok.com/@babatunde_hiphopera
    • Follow me on Twitter:
      https://www.twitter.com/tundehiphopera

 

Please know that I'm sincerely grateful for your generous support! You're making what I do possible, and I don't take that for granted. 

I look forward to sharing this experience with you in the days ahead!

Warmest,

Babatunde
story_txt:
Hey guys!
Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign in support of my first Hip Hopera album!
I (in)formally invite you to join me on the ground level of this album's creation. Your support (both through the years and now) means so much to me, and I look forward to sharing this experience with you in the days ahead! 
 

About me:
I'm a Nigerian-American opera singer whose first musical love was hip hop. I grew up in Lagos, Nigeria and even though I wasn't born into a musical family, I was born into a musical culture. I developed an affinity for rhythmic music early and that affinity turned to love when I first heard hip hop. I was nine years old and my uncle snuck me a tape of Dr. Dre's The Chronic. I remember listening over and over, trying to learn every single word, At that time, I was only vaguely aware of the existence of classical music. 
This happened after I moved to California as a teenager. One of my friends convinced me to sign up for a class that would turn out to be a choir class. This was where I was first taught about singing and harmonies, and where I developed a love for classical music that ran alongside my love for hip hop. I decided to pursue a career in classical music and it was in that pursuit that I ended up in front of the voice teacher that said, "You should sing opera."
A year later I was in "opera college" getting assigned my first opera. I was immersed in opera music but would always notice similarities and relationships between opera and hip hop. I would often sing opera in a hip hop style on my own and in secret because I didn't think my colleagues would appreciate it, but I thought it sounded dope. One day I decided to post a video of me singing the opera aria, Largo al factotum over the hip hop beat from Kendrick Lamar's Humble and it went viral! This inspired me to release an EP titled Della Citta of three operatic hip hop  (Hip Hopera) songs in March of 2019 and people LOVED it! So I've decided to go all out and release a full album of Hip Hopera music, but I need your help!

 
 
Perks of Supporting:

Personalized Thank You Video
Digital Album Download
Exclusive Campaign Merch

Advance signed copy of the album (vinyl)
VIP admission to Exclusive Listening Party

Album credit for sponsorship (the listing of your name in the official album credits as a sponsor of the album)

 

Campaign Breakdown:
The making & release of this record will cost an estimated $50,000 inclusive of:

Studio time 
Producer fees (pre-production/production)
Engineering (recording, mixing & mastering)
Studio musician/orchestra fees
Travel costs, accommodations & incidentals (for the duration of recording and mixing)
Physical copies (vinyls, CDs)
Global marketing 

 

​The Impact:


The funds raised by this campaign will make it possible for me to make this album the best that it can possibly be. The campaign for my EP "Della Citta" helped me create something new, thrilling, and game-changing. This has truly been a next-level experience for me and a pinnacle moment in my musical journey so far. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your encouragement, your excitement, and your generous support in helping to bring life to my creative vision. 
 

Risks & Challenges:
Unforeseen costs and challenges often arise during the course of making and releasing an album, especially during these COVID times. Through your valued support, I will be able to minimize those risks while also ensuring that this album is of the utmost quality and fully reflects my vision.
 

Other Ways You Can Help:
I totally understand if you would like to support but are unable to make a financial contribution! There are several other ways to lend support should you so desire:


Spread the word! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend who might be interested in supporting it.

"Like" and "Follow" me on social media:

Follow me on Facebook:                                              https://www.facebook.com/babatundehiphopera/


Follow me on Instagram:                              https://www.instagram.com/babatunde_hiphopera/


Subscribe to my YouTube:                                                 http://www.youtube.com/c/HipHoperaGuy 


Follow me on TikTok:                                                                http://www.tiktok.com/@babatunde_hiphopera


Follow me on Twitter:https://www.twitter.com/tundehiphopera




 
Please know that I'm sincerely grateful for your generous support! You're making what I do possible, and I don't take that for granted. 
I look forward to sharing this experience with you in the days ahead!
Warmest,
Babatunde

story:
After a Brief Pause and Reset, We Are Back On Track!

Please join me for a special recording project to celebrate the 20th anniversary of my first album, Not The Tremblin' Kind. We planned to celebrate this anniversary in a unique way - instead of making a traditional album, we're releasing a set of digital singles that will feature some friends, old and new. While we originally planned some travel as part of this project, we're adapting to the new reality we all find ourselves in and will use technology to help bridge what we can't do in person at the moment. What's certain is we're going to make a celebratory noise, one way or another, and would love your support. You'll get new music digitally every 4-6 weeks as it becomes available, and a CD compilation at the end of the process. 

What I Need & What You Get

The money I raise through this campaign will pay for recording costs - musicians, studio time, and producer fees - and the production cost of physical copies of the new album once the music is recorded. Through your support, I will be able to record with several different producers and collaborate with some musicians I admire.

Everyone who supports the project will get immediate digital access to each "single" as they are finished and a compilation CD at the end of the project. 

If we overshoot our goal, we'd love to press vinyl, here's to dreaming!  

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can't contribute, you can still help to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. That would be a huge help! 

Thanks, Laura

story:
Overview

Welcome to our campaign! We are Brasuka:  6 musicians, representing 5 different cultures, singing in 3 languages (Portuguese, English, and Spanish), all sharing a love of Brazilian music. Reminiscent of artists like Sergio Mendes and Ivan Lins, we enjoy big productions with lots of percussion, beautiful harmonies, and a variety of grooves and emotions. We write and arrange our music together in a way that represents our cultural diversity as well as our Brazilian inspiration. We are excited to finally be releasing our debut album. 

 

The Album

The album is titled A Vida Com Paixão, which means A Life with Passion, and it includes almost all original music.  There's a little something for everyone: from exciting rhythms like Brazilian samba and frevo, to groovy beats like samba reggae and maracatu to tender ballads. It is diverse world music influenced heavily by Brazilian percussion and American jazz.  We have worked hard to create something joyful, welcoming, and beautiful, telling lots of different stories. We hope to share this music far and wide, and we would deeply appreciate your support. 

 

The Campaign

To help us achieve our goals, which include CD manufacturing, video production, publicity, radio promotion, album artwork and website design, we have launched this fundraising campaign. We are offering several fun donation perks, or you could simply click the "back it" button and donate without receiving a perk. We are hoping to raise $15,000 through this endeavor. 

We have many items and experiences available as perks. Choose from things like:

  • Digital download or signed CD
  • Entry to our online Brazilian percussion workshop
  • Leadsheets for all 10 songs on the album
  • Custom-made auxiliary percussion instrument 
  • Private lesson, clinic, or masterclass
  • House concert
  • Executive producer and "the works" package

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It helps us greatly when you share this campaign and help us get the word out.  These campaigns can be very successful and can make a huge difference to what is possible for this music and this band. Thank you so much for your support!

 

More about Brasuka

The members of Brasuka:

  • Jose Aponte (Puerto Rico) - drumset, vocals
  • Ricardo Bozas (Uruguay) - percussion, vocals
  • Tom Burchill (South Dakota, USA) - guitar, vocals
  • Rosana Eckert (Texas, USA) - vocals, percussion, keyboard
  • Denny Robinson (Cuba) - keyboard, vocals
  • Brian Warthen (Texas, USA) - bass percussion

 

The expanded Brasuka band includes tenor-saxophonists Drew Zaremba and Jeff Robbins as well as flautist Daniel Pardo who also helped engineer and produce the project. All three are featured soloists on the album.

story:
The Next Album -


Recorded Live. More Songs, Longer Guitar Solos, More Vibes.
 

Even though it seems like my latest album 'Analog Girl In A Digital World' just came out in May, but I'm ready for the next one. (I'm sure you are too!)

 

Who the HECK Am I? 

Hey. I'm Arielle, a singer-songwriter, guitarist & guitar designer. I have been a professional musician for about 13 years, although playing & writing a lot longer than that. I move around between the US and the UK. Born in the US, bred in the UK. I just put out a new model of guitar called 'The Arielle' with BRIAN MAY GUITARS. 



To make a full album of original material.
(think 10-12 songs this time.) 

Recorded live with a band. Vintage gear, Marshall Full-stacks, tiny little Fender Champs, lots of good music and good vibes. The last album was 28 minutes. I'd like to get this next one longer as well. I have a big collection of songs to dig through, and work up with a band. In my last musical experiment recording digitally & analog, I decided this time I would record digitally to keep things more cost effective, while also retaining the professional sound we need to make this album great. 
 

Your Support. As a completely independent with a small team, (completely funded by myself), the only way I continue going is by my own work, and by you, and my Patreon team. It would literally be impossible.
The goal is $22,000 to make the recordings, the rewards & to pay all of the super talented and deserving musicians.
I know, I know. The number seems big, but I tried to cut my costs as much as I could. 

I only have 8 days booked in the studio. Which means I have to get 10-12 songs done kind of fast.
& work smart! 

There are tons of cool perks. ALL of them are going to be exclusive to Indie-Gogo.
Which means, you will have what no one else does as a major thank you for making this happen.
And as an extra thank you, once we hit 50% funding I'm going to be sharing the lyrics to one of my new songs privately with everyone who has contributed.


If I don't reach the entire goal, it will take a bit longer to put out the album, as well as I will have to simplify some of the rewards. 
 

I'm hoping the album is mixed and mastered by October, 2021. It will be released in 2022 at the beginning of the year. 
Your items will be at your house by Christmas, 2021.
 

This album will allow me to give YOU music in a way I've never done. Over the years you have asked for longer albums, more guitar solos, truer lyrics and bigger vibes. This delivers. In this age of trying to find music that represents the past, I feel like I've got more to say than ever, especially after being off of the road as long as I have due to covid. A lot has happened...

 


The risk is always not meeting the goal. That isn't a massive risk...but it is a bit of a challenge, since putting together funds while I am not able to tour is a bit hard. Plus, you can think of it this way. You get to pay for the album in advance. You not only get it early, but you helped to MAKE it happen.

Either way, I will make sure this album gets made. It may just take a bit longer...

Even if you can't donate, that is totally fine. Having you here means the world to me, and I am so grateful to have you in my life, and get to share time with you on this crazy planet!

story:
In The Light, A Faustian Tale is an original musical inspired by the classic Faust legend.

A full-length concept recording.

This concept recording will be an opportunity to share In The Light with those who have supported it for so long and introduce the show to a whole new audience.  

Over the past year, the music and story have come together in a powerful way, making it the perfect time to record this score.

This recording will be an essential step in bringing the project closer to its ultimate goal: a fully-fledged stage production.

 

Theatre is the ultimate collaborative medium.

There are so many people who work behind the scenes to make theatre happen and an album like this is no exception.

We have a dream list of top-of-the-line collaborators already committed to this project, including TONY and Grammy Award Nominee Jeremy Jordan as our titular character and Drama Desk Nominee Kim Scharnberg as the show's orchestrator. In the coming months we will be announcing the rest of our cast and team. 

Now we just need to find a way to pay all these incredible artists!

 

How you can help make it happen. 

Click on the PERKS to learn how you can get involved and help us raise the funds needed to make this concept recording a reality.

 

Show Background and History.

Composer/ lyricist Michael Mott began writing Faustus, A Musical when he was a senior in high school with book writer, Justin Silvestri. In 2015, with the addition of book writer Nathan Wright, Faustus, A Musical  became In The Light, A Faustian Tale.  

We have had many wonderful opportunities to continue developing In The Light,  including an industry reading in NYC earlier this year featuring TONY Nominee Jeremy Jordan and many other Broadway talents.

story:
Funding the Recording of "Buzz of Bees"

Let's Make an Amazing New Album Together!

 

Hello!  This is Stephen Evans of Stephen Evans & the True Grits, and I would like to invite you to help us record our new album "Buzz of Bees".

Me & the True Grits (Brian Shoemaker - guitar, bass, and vocals, Sam Hess - drums, and Woodstock - mandolin) hail from Asheville, NC and have been together for about 7 years now playing shows and releasing a couple records along the way.  Our debut LP "Something to Bleed", funded through Kickstarter, was released in 2015 to much praise and radio play locally.  And our EP "Under the Bridge" came out in 2017 to some wonderful local attention as well.  Both of those records were recorded on our on a small Tascam Portable Digital Recorder that we dubbed "The Precious", so we have only recorded and mixed on our own before. 

But with this new album, which I have named "Buzz of Bees" after one of the tracks, we are looking to step it way up by getting it professionally recorded, produced, mixed, mastered and manufactured before sending it out to the world.  This is a group of songs that the band and I are very excited and proud to share; so we really want to make this the best quality possible to do these songs justice.  And with that strong desire comes an elevated budget unfortunately.  That's where our supporters come in to help us make it a reality to make something beautiful that can bring a whole lot of listeners some joy.

What We Need & What You Get

So this is what we need from our supporters to reach our budget goal for this project:

The recording studio time cost - $2000

Studio musicians cost - $1000

Producer - $3,000

Mixing & Mastering - $4000

Artwork - $500

Manufacturing 200 Vinyl & 100 CDs - $2500

Subtotal = $13,000

Minus what I will be raising on my own - $5000

Total goal is $8000

 

Here are some unique perks that are available for supporters:

- Your name listed on the album credits!!  Every contributor of $10 or more will be listed on the album credits with the larger contributors getting the larger name size printed.  

- Home shows!  I will come or the whole band will come to your house at your invitation to play a 2-hour show for you!

- Online shows!  I will play a personal online show for you and your friends!

- A signed vinyl or CD copy of the new album!

-  True Grits T-shirts & stickers!

- Signed vinyl & CDs of the past 2 records!

- and much more!

If for some reason we don't reach our goal, the funds will still be put toward the new record, but the budget will be reduced to match what we have received.  Hopefully that will not be the case, and we will be able to make the stellar album we want to make!

The Impact

Your contribution, no matter the amount, will be so very important to the success of getting the new album made well and delivered to the masses.  If you love melodic folk rock with lyrics that are creative and meaningful, as well as tunes that are fun and make you bounce in your seat, you will be helping bring that style of music to life.

Like I said before, our debut album "Something to Bleed" was brought to life with the help of a Kickstarter campaign back in 2015.  With that success, a music career was reborn with the band, Stephen Evans & the True Grits.  Because it was pretty well done with the help of supporters, songs from it were played on a few radio stations, sold to fans of the music and successfully delivered to wanting ears.

You too can help bring "Buzz of Bees" to life as our greatest project yet!

Risks & Challenges

I've always been someone that survives and overcomes challenges, and things always do come up.  But I've already released two records, so I am prepared to take on anything that may occur.  

- If the budget somehow has to be lowered due to a lower contribution total, I will do my best to adjust to that change so we can get the album out to the people who want it.

- If there is a delay in release for any reason, I will communicate with everyone and share the adjusted timeline as soon as I know.

- If certain musicians become unavailable to record for some reason, with the connections I have developed over the years in the music scene in Asheville, I should be able to find a suitable and timely replacement

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

A great way to help is to spread the word about the project any way you can either by word of mouth, social media, email forwarding, directing people to the past music releases, etc.  

And that's all there is to it.

Manufacturing 200 Vinyl & 100 CDs - $2500
Subtotal = $13,000
Minus what I will be raising on my own - $5000
Total goal is $8000
 
Here are some unique perks that are available for supporters:
- Your name listed on the album credits!!  Every contributor of $10 or more will be listed on the album credits with the larger contributors getting the larger name size printed.  
- Home shows!  I will come or the whole band will come to your house at your invitation to play a 2-hour show for you!
- Online shows!  I will play a personal online show for you and your friends!
- A signed vinyl or CD copy of the new album!
-  True Grits T-shirts & stickers!
- Signed vinyl & CDs of the past 2 records!
- and much more!
If for some reason we don't reach our goal, the funds will still be put toward the new record, but the budget will be reduced to match what we have received.  Hopefully that will not be the case, and we will be able to make the stellar album we want to make!

The Impact
Your contribution, no matter the amount, will be so very important to the success of getting the new album made well and delivered to the masses.  If you love melodic folk rock with lyrics that are creative and meaningful, as well as tunes that are fun and make you bounce in your seat, you will be helping bring that style of music to life.
Like I said before, our debut album "Something to Bleed" was brought to life with the help of a Kickstarter campaign back in 2015.  With that success, a music career was reborn with the band, Stephen Evans & the True Grits.  Because it was pretty well done with the help of supporters, songs from it were played on a few radio stations, sold to fans of the music and successfully delivered to wanting ears.
You too can help bring "Buzz of Bees" to life as our greatest project yet!

Risks & Challenges
I've always been someone that survives and overcomes challenges, and things always do come up.  But I've already released two records, so I am prepared to take on anything that may occur.  
- If the budget somehow has to be lowered due to a lower contribution total, I will do my best to adjust to that change so we can get the album out to the people who want it.
- If there is a delay in release for any reason, I will communicate with everyone and share the adjusted timeline as soon as I know.
- If certain musicians become unavailable to record for some reason, with the connections I have developed over the years in the music scene in Asheville, I should be able to find a suitable and timely replacement

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:A great way to help is to spread the word about the project any way you can either by word of mouth, social media, email forwarding, directing people to the past music releases, etc.  And that's all there is to it.

story:
Where it all started...

My journey in music began as a two year old watching my father rehearse with his singing group in our living room. I remember the way the harmonies sounded and can still faintly smell the scent of the different colognes the guys wore. I never saw any band not even my own years later that would be so well dressed for practice. LOL! Nevertheless, before I knew it I was bitten by the bug and wanted to become a singer like my dad. I eventually taught myself how to play multiple instruments, write songs, arrange and produce them.  Hard to believe its been 30 years since I started recording. 

In 2007, I released my first album "Love & Faith: Volume 1" which did really well and in 2013 released my sophomore project "A Wonderful Love: Love & Faith Volume 2". Both projects were regarded as being one of the best R&B / Soul albums in Japan which helped establish me internationally as an independent recording artist. My second album even made it to #2 on the UK Soul Chart! Music has allowed me to play around the world and share stages with many of my musical heroes. There's no greater feeling than sharing your gift and bringing joy to people along the way.

This summer I will be releasing my third album titled "RIVER" which is a collection of songs I've written over the past 6 years. I am a lover and student of classic R&B music and this project is full of songs reminiscent of what I love about the genre. Great stories and strong melodies have always been a hallmark of my tunes and this project is no exception. My first 2 projects were funded out of pocket with little to no outside investment. A labor of love indeed but this time around I felt it would be a great opportunity to include you all, the music lovers into the process.  

Funding & Incentives

I've completed all the recording and production work so the songs are ready to go. This final phase is where you come in. I am hoping to raise funds to replicate the album for CD format,  vinyl pressing as well as for marketing and radio promotion. It has been a lifelong dream of mine to have my music pressed onto a record and with your help I will finally be able to achieve it. 

My goal is to raise $6,000.00 which will cover the costs towards getting the album ready for retail and to promote it. I anticipate this to be my biggest release yet and I want to give it the best launch possible. Rest assured that every penny will go towards doing just that. 

The perks?! The perks are pretty awesome ranging from personally autographed CD's to virtual concerts and more. 

The only foreseeable risk is you passing this up and miss the opportunity to partner with me in releasing this amazing project. :-)

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that although you may want to contribute, current circumstances may not make that possible. If so, you can show your support for me in a few other ways. Here are the other ways you can help. 

  • Share on social media
  • Email the link to your contacts
  • Text the link to your contacts

story:
What's this about then?

We're a collective music group with a core of four who float around the indie folk / blues / rock / jazz / shoegaze / pop genres.   We have recently written and recorded a 4 track EP that we firmly believe to be our best work and want to raise some funds to pay for the CD/download code EP package worthy of the music.
We've been going since 2008 and signed a licensing and publishing deal a few years back with our friends at Songs and Whispers in Germany, leading to some great tours of northern Europe.  Whilst we have had national radio play, we believe there is a very radio worthy track on this EP that deserves to be out there.

You can help us reach a wider audience by funding the package and paying towards plugging the music (getting the tunes to the ears of the top DJs). 

What We Need & What You Get

If you pre-order this CD (with digital download code) package, we will print your name and a word of your choice (keep it clean).

We want to raise £500 to print the CD.  Anything above that will go towards promotional costs (adverts and pluggers). 

We will send you the CD on before release day (to be announced for 2021).

If we don't make the target, we will dig a little deeper into the gig money.

Thanks for reading and look forward to seeing at a gig when this has all blown over (or possibly before if we can grapple with the systems adequately).

Other Ways You Can Help

We realise these are tough times for many and there are many very worthy causes out there.  If you'd like to help in a non-financial way, dig into our back catalogue, have a listen and share with your friends (Facebook, spotify, etc).  That is how we seem to grow.  Big love to all. xx

story:
Before you start reading (boring!), check out the above video for the Spark Notes version. If you want more info, feel free to read on :)

Background

I have been writing and recording music for over 10 years, and I am entering my fourth year making songs with Rich Boy Junkie. As RBJ, I have digitally released three full-length albums and two EPs, but have never had the chance to release any of these songs through a physical medium. Printing vinyl records (along with other costs associated with proper promotion of a music release) is a costly process and usually requires large production quantities, making it challenging for independent artists like myself to bank roll a project like this with no financial support or guaranteed sales. As a result, I'm asking my supporters to help me fund this next step with my upcoming release.

 

What Exactly Am I Asking For (and What Do You Get in Return)?

My intent is to provide as much as I can in return for your contribution. I don't want people to think of this as me just asking for your money, but instead as a pre-order, a credited contribution, or an investment in one of the most significant creative projects I feel I've worked on.

As noted above, the majority of the money raised through this campaign will go towards production costs of the first physical Rich Boy Junkie release. The album will be pressed on vinyl through Furnace Record Pressing, an industry leader that has a long history of high quality products and independent ownership. The costs associated can fluctuate, but a minimum order will cost around $3,000. Any additional funds raised give me the potential for wiggle room to press more records or increase the quality (like pressing more durable records, including inserts, etc.) 

Anyone who contributes $10 or more to this campaign gets a record shipped to them after the album is released. If you're on the fence, this is the cheapest this album will be available for. Again, I want to do my best to make sure you feel there is a legitimate incentive for a small contribution. If you contribute $1 or more, you get it digitally on the release date. Every donation helps, and therefore will be rewarded. One buck for a digital album? What a steal!

Obviously, the more you contribute the more you can get. Consult the perks section for a full list. And please understand, I am not perfect and sometimes I can miss out on a million dollar idea. If there is a perk you would be interested in that isn't listed on the page, then get in touch and let's work something out. Shoot me an email at richboyjunkie@gmail.com

 

What is Have Fun in the Sky?

The simple answer is that Have Fun in the Sky is the upcoming fourth album by Rich Boy Junkie. The medium answer is that it's a piece of work I've become incredibly invested in and proud of, and one that I'm confident enough to say is some of my favorite and best work. People who know me know that I don't take calling something I've worked on 'good' very lightly. But, damn, I think this record is pretty friggin good.

Long answer? As did most creatives, I took the start of the Covid-19 lockdowns as an opportunity to work on something new. I'm lucky enough to have a network of loved ones that have become close creative partners since March, and those people have helped me turn this into one of the most collaborative projects I've ever worked on. Through a network of home studios and professional facilities, we've been able to come together virtually (thank you, Google Drive) and safely to fine tune this project. It's something I am proud to call ours and excited to make yours. It's something that Rich Boy Junkie has never sounded like, but hopefully an opening to usher in a new process and potential for this project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It always feels kind of silly to harp on, but following Rich Boy Junkie on your favorite social media sites and streaming services is always helpful. Seriously, clicking that little follow button on Spotify makes a gigantic difference for artists and is free to do. Even more helpful is sharing your favorite songs with your friends, sharing this campaign, and spreading the word about what this project means for you. I've always viewed music as a spiritual difference maker, and I would be honored to know if I can offer that impact to others.

For links to all my socials and music profiles, visit https://linktr.ee/richboyjunkie

story:
** All funds raised beyond our goal will help cover additional costs in our budget!! We are hoping to raise 1.3k more than our initial amount. Any money we raise beyond this goal will go either to this album or to support future Rising Song artists in making new Jewish music. This is a big project and we thank you so much for your support.**

 

Who am I // Where I come from

Hi! My name is Aly Halpert. I’m a Jewish musician, educator, and activist. I’m a lover of endless harmonies, writing songs about serious and seriously silly things, and being in life with people. I grew up in Ann Arbor, MI and live now on Schaghticoke/Mohican land in rural Millerton, NY. 

I am who I am as a person and young adult musician because of many of you. My songs have grown out of grief, closeness, hope, and love, but always in relationship to community -- Jewish leftist community, Jewish song and camp community, queer community, local organizing-against-power-plants community, and the family and friends I call home. 

Over the last few years I’ve found myself surprised and thrilled to be supported to do what makes me feel most alive, which is to create. I’ve been deepening into my music practice and taking more risks (yikes!). This includes the project of bringing these songs to life in the form of an album -- so you can have them, and so they can reach more people who could use them.

 

Why this album?

This music draws from Jewish traditions, liturgy, and practice, and is grounded in visions of social justice. Most fundamentally, the songs on this album are about healing, imagining the world to come, or both. How do we transform a society that destroys life to one that cherishes life? How do we hold our personal healing amidst so much collective grief? How do we continue to celebrate all that we are and the resilient life around us? We matter so much and we know it so little. This music is about that -- our humanity, and what is possible when we can tell we have each other. 

Music has always been at the forefront of social movements. Song breaks us open, heals us, helps us to dream and to be ourselves. This album is for you, in service of us winning the world we want together. They are for singing in movement spaces, song circles, synagogues, in nature, or quietly to yourself when you need it.

 

Where you come in!

Making this album is a years-long dream come true. I am beyond honored to do this with a team of brilliant, clear-eyed, and good people, and this project will take a lot of work and care. It feels scary to ask for collective support for music, especially in the form of $18,000! This number is actually an attempt to value the time, energy, and gifts of a number of musicians, artists, and engineers. In this way, fundraising accomplishes more than just making this album -- it supports artists to continue doing the cultural work we so deeply need.

 

Redistribution // Match gifts 

Part of the kavanah (intention) of this album is to be part of creating the world we want. As someone with race and class privilege, I have access to networks and resources that indigenous people and people of color have had systematically taken from them. If you are able to donate to this campaign, please also consider joining me in the holy work of wealth redistribution and making a match gift to one of the following powerful organizations working towards our collective liberation:

 

SCHAGHTICOKE FIRST NATIONS is an indigenous tribe working with seven generations into the future in mind, focused on re-establishing a physical presence in the area their ancestors lived for centuries, the Hudson and Harlem Valley regions of New York state. (To support, venmo @sfn.tribal.email@gmail.com)

 

SANE ENERGY PROJECT builds potent grassroots movements pushing for a rapid and just transition to 100% publicly owned renewable and sustainable energy in New York, and builds every campaign through the lens of racial, social, and economic justice.

 

KITE’S NEST builds the collective capacity of young people to bring about healing, personal transformation, social connection, and systemic change in Hudson, NY.

 

Aly's Album Team

Joey Weisenberg: Co-Producer / Musical Director / Bass

Anat Hochberg: Vocals

Arielle Korman: Violin / Vocals

Sonya Major: Vocals

Batya Levine: Vocals

Molly Bajgot: Vocals

Jessie Reagen Mann: Cello

Richie Barshay: Percussion

Don Godwin: Audio Engineer

Shmulie Lowenstein: Videographer

Sol Weiss: Album Art & Graphic Design

…and probably more hands, hearts, and voices!

Amidst the work that you do in the world, if you can afford to support the creation of this album, please donate.* Any amount that you can give is incredibly helpful. You can also share this with your networks as a way of giving.

*Donations are tax deductible.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support this work, and thank you for already supporting in the ways that you do.

If financial support isn't feasible for you, you can help out by sharing this campaign!

Learn more at alyhalpert.com

…and probably more hands, hearts, and voices!
Amidst the work that you do in the world, if you can afford to support the creation of this album, please donate.* Any amount that you can give is incredibly helpful. You can also share this with your networks as a way of giving.

There are many ways to support this work, and thank you for already supporting in the ways that you do.
If financial support isn't feasible for you, you can help out by sharing this campaign!
Learn more at alyhalpert.com

story:
Our Story

We're Malphas, a metal band from Philadelphia, PA. Though we're primarily melodic death metal, we incorporate other elements including black metal, symphonic, and progressive metal. We got started in 2012, released our debut EP in 2015 and followed it up with a full length in 2018. We toured North America and Europe in 2017 and 2019 respectively and have been working hard on album two during COVID.

Why We're Crowdfunding & Perks

Recording an album is expensive and not having to dig too deep into our own pockets helps a lot with keeping us going. Therefore, we're doing a limited edition t-shirt to help finance the project; there will only be a single printing of these shirts. There are additional packages where you can also mix and match with other shirts we have, a physical copy of our album "The 39th Spirit, stickers, etc. Anyone who buys anything will have their name in the special thanks in the album booklet; for you are a tremendous help in the process.

Final Thoughts

We've got an epic new album well over 50 minutes of material and can't wait to unleash it upon the world. We'll be recording in two parts starting in October and then following up in the Spring. Thank you very much for the support, and can't wait for you to hear the new music.

story:
Short Summary

Who I am: I'm a passionate musician with a weakness for creating complex and diversified death metal music with thought-provoking lyrics. As a multi-instrumentalist and producer, I swear by concept albums, exotic instruments, and the independent way of making music. Originality, innovation, and quality are the pillars of my creative work.

If you want to know more about me and listen to my previous record I highly recommend visiting my website: www.theoptiamusic.com

The reasons for this campaign: Since I'm taking my music more and more seriously, with the quality and intricacy also the expenses go up. This campaign will help me bear the production cost of my new record "UNDEAD GODS", which I couldn't help but take the risk of starting to produce in summer 2020. It's a heavy-hitting concept album about the oppressive fake gods of our modern society; like money a.k.a. Mammon. This is a message that I think needs to be heard.

What it means to me: I'm obsessed with recording and so making this record is a childhood dream becoming reality! As a creator I'm always concerned about how many people will actually find resonance in my works, and such a campaign is a wonderful way of having assurance from my supporters before jumping into the ice-cold water that is releasing my music. The success of this campaign will help me to not have the "broke-phase" that artists go through before actually being able to sell the release. And therefore it will enable me to put more love into the making of it, while maintaining some sanity.

Musically with this record I'm gonna take everything up a notch: songwriting, performance, production, and the all around quality will increase tremendously compared to the last record. It will be pretty accurately portraying the essence of what I learned the last three years studying theology and music, hundreds of hours of practice, reading and thinking. If you enjoyed my last record, I think you will absolutely love this one. I tried hard to connect with like-minded musicians to broaden the palette, give the music more depth, and enhance the quality, while saving me some time to do better work in performing and producing. So lots to be looking forward to!

Would you be willing to support this awesome new record? I would be overjoyed to have you on the team!

What I Need & What You Get

What I need: Ok so here's the deal: I will need a considerable amount of money...

My Budget looks like this: (All amounts are in CHF which is pretty much 1=1 to USD)

  •  300 is for the studio drummer
  • 1180 is the estimated complete cost of the studio I'm renting
  •  600 is for mastering (the final stage before pressing)
  •  400 is for the cover art design
  •  100 is for a photo shoot
  • 1500 is for the physical CD pressing (500 pieces)
  • 1600 is for the vinyl cutting (100 pieces)

That's a total of 5680 bucks that I will need.

How I'm saving money: Fortunately I'm able to do some of the recordings at home, which makes this chart as "light" as it looks now. Additionally I'm gonna do the mixing myself. The designer also made me a special deal, as well as the studio owner; so I'm really keeping the cost to a minimum as much as I can.

Also the unblack association (unblack.ch) has already pledged to support me with an amount of 800 bucks. This is why the total amount shown in this campaign is down to 4880! So if you are an unblack member, bear in mind when pledging, that you will be getting a promotional CD from unblack already.

 What you will get: If you support me (depending on your amount), you will get my music earlier than the official release and much earlier than the official complete streaming release, in both physical and digital form. I'm also gonna provide you with (new) Theoptia stickers and patches, to your liking. In addition to a CD I will also (for the first time) offer vinyl as a perk; so for all the nostalgia people out there: Celebrate! If you support me you can also choose to be mentioned by name in the official album booklet! So lots of exciting goodies!

If I don't reach my entire goal, I will still get the money, and I will still find a way to make the project happen. So none of your money will be pledged in vain, and you will get your perks no matter what! This doesn't mean that I don't need your support though. Actually I do, I'm just so passionate about this album that I would rather risk going broke than not being able to do it. Hence the flexible goal campaign and hence Indiegogo and not Kickstarter.

If you like my music-making, I would really appreciate your support! Every cent counts!

The Impact

This album is gonna be something really special.

The concept: Let me quickly tell you what it's all about lyrically: It is a concept album about the pseudo-religious aspects of our modern society. This album could be regarded as the answer to a person, who would claim that they are free from religion, by saying that in our modern lives we’re not at all free from religion; our dependence is only disguised. Let me explain: I have observed so many things in life that have vast religious aspects, that somewhat connect to ancient gods. For example the excessive fitness trend has somewhat transcending promises, requires a regular attendance at the gym (like a temple), dietary restrictions (like plenty of religions do), incorporates somewhat clerical instructions by fitness coaches, and there’s even very preachy sounding motivational speakers and podcasters pushing you to your limits. People are somewhat still worshipping “Adonis”, the greek god of bodily beauty. And so the album follows eight different phenomena/gods in eight different songs.

Besides writing a theological paper on the concept behind the album, and incorporating the songwriting process in a graded project at my university, I also got really good feeback from fellow musicians early on. I believe that this record, even more than the last one, will have an impact on the listeners and will be more than just another piece of music in people's libraries, but rather a cherished meaningful narrative experience in musical form. It will not be a hit-worthy, short-lived, trendy ablum, but an aged, complex, and deep record. I'd like to compare it to a good whiskey. Rough, tough, and really freakin good.

The sounds: As I stick to my roots of incorporating exotic sounds, I'll go another step further and refine the musical vision of Theoptia. It will be more harmonically dense, have multiple guitars, less synths, and a good amount of odd-meters whilst providing groove like not yet before. I wish and hope to have some sort of small scale success with this album. I would like to gain more recognition as an artist and be able to be found on the map of today's metal more easily. This time I really think this record will take me a considerable step forward as an artist. I would be so glad to have you support me in that!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for me is probably to deliver on time. The process so far has been very time consuming; more than I could have anticipated. Right now I'm thinking that we'll be done with the project and releasing the music by March 2021, but I'm hesitant saying that, knowing a dozen things could delay it. I'm studying in my last year of my Bachelors, which means a whole set of expectations to meet that might take my attention, energy, and time away from this project. But don't worry, I will make this happen! The question is only how quickly...

Then there's another risk that I might have underbudgeted a little with it. I hope that there's not too many unforeseen expenses that affect the project. Bear in mind that most of the budget layed out above are estimates; that might change.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that is totally ok! As much as I would appreciate your contributions, you can still support me by getting the word out about my campaign. Share, like, and follow like a star! I really appreciate it! :)

Along with that, you can support me as an artist by following me on Spotify, Instagram, and signing up for my email newsletter (on my website), to be the first one to know about everything that is going on with me and my music!

Your support is much appreciated!

story:
Music for sinners who

need a little soul

I'm Caleb Lawson (recording as Brother John & The Lonely Roads), and this was my first music recording project. It's just a few of the songs I’ve written over the past ten years since leaving home and losing my faith. These songs are me at my most vulnerable: they’re songs about me as a queer man, songs about love and fear, songs about hope and faith, and how sometimes they all feel the same. This little record is called A Different Gospel, and it’s for people like me (and maybe like you) who’ve had to go their own way and find their own gospel.

What I Need & What You Get

I’ve worked with some outstanding talent on this project: the artist who painted the album cover, the bluegrass banjo player whose skill far outshines mine, the guitar player that make these songs rock, the pedal steel player whose twang makes the songs sound country as hell, the background vocalists who added depth and power to my songs, the audio engineers who made this sound like a real damn record, and so many others.

I want to make you a part of this record, too. I'm asking you to contribute to this campaign to pay for CD duplication, so we can all have a real thing to hold and listen to.

My base goal is $300 dollars for just the cost of CD duplication, with stretch goals that would help me put more of my music into the world. Indiegogo requires a minimum of $500 listed as the goal, but this campaign is set to Flexible Goal, so I will receive everything you contribute even if that required minimum isn't met.

Campaign Goals:

Base Goal:

  • $300: CD duplication through DiscMakers.

Stretch Goals:

  • $500: Starter camera and basic lighting setup for cover songs and other social media content (brand and model to be determined).

  • $900: Upgraded microphone and mic isolation shield for the singles I’ll be releasing this summer (brand and model to be determined).

  • $1,500: Savings fund to hire session players for my upcoming singles and albums.

  • $1,501+: Direct donation to the Color Me Country Artist Grant Fund, to support Black musicians in country music.

The Impact

This record is important to me because I love music, because I love telling stories, and because sometimes, a song can save your soul.  Additionally, 40% of all streaming and album sales revenue will be donated to the Color Me Country Artist Grand Fund, so just by streaming my music you'll be contributing! This campaign is so that I can have physical CDs to offer when I play out, for social media giveaways, to send out to indie radio stations to shoot for some radio time, and, most of all, so we all can have something to have and to hold.

Risks & Challenges

There's no risk to you in donating. If we don't meet the base goal, I plan to save up and pay for the remainder from my own pocket, so you'll still receive your perks! The project is already finished and available for streaming, so even if you can't contribute financially, you can still listen to and enjoy the album.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to donate, you can still help! You can share the campaign using Indiegogo's share tools, stream my music and add it to your playlists, and follow me on Facebook and Instagram. You can also send me a message through any of those mediums — I love to hear from the folks who listen to my songs, and I love hearing about what the song mean to them.
