You need top-notch engineers, producers, management, labels, photographers/videographers, publicists, etc to utilize all resources and to make sure the project is the best-oiled machine on the market!
Here are an example of some of the expenses:

$10,000 - Mixing with Chris Bell (Destiny's Child, The Eagles)
$2,000 - Mastering By Grammy-winning engineer David Glasser (Grateful Dead, Hot Tuna, Leftover Salmon) 
$10,000 - Two video shoots ($5,000 each)
$5,000 - Tour promotion.

It is also time-consuming and difficult to coordinate the schedules of 4 full-time, working musicians who do nothing but eat, sleep, write, create, and breathe music, so the limited time Neville Jacobs spends together needs to be spent wisely.
Other Ways You Can Help
We know times can be tough and money can be tight, so even if you can't chip in $5, please share this campaign on all social media outlets and help us spread the word!

Please  use the Indiegogo share tools! They make it easy for you to help tell the world!

And that's all there is to it. Thanx so much from Ivan, Cris Tony, Brady and Joe

story:
While serving faithfully for six years World Prayr has seen a lot of pain and hurt. The main reason is that most are disconnected from local bodies of believers. We are working to not only connect them but support the churches, as well. We sure could use your help, make a donation to our Crowdsource campaign of $1, $2, $5, $10 or more by clicking on the Contribute Now.



Read More About Our Campaign


Background

Vision and Mission

World Prayr will aggressively evangelize the web providing online resources of encouragement, support, and prayer. It will also develop a network of believers in Christ that will reconnect hurting people to local ministries and local bodies of believers to offer fellowship, support, and real answers; and treat them as family ought to be treated - nothing more nothing less.

Who and what is World Prayr?

World Prayr is a global  ministry team seeking out those who need mentoring, prayer and counselling coupled with foundational Biblical teachings; then reconnecting them to an offline local church and/or to a body of fellow believers.  

What started as a little Twitter account has now grown into a global ministry and mission team that is serving as a support for other ministries, authors and changing the culture of churches, while reaching those who have been disconnected from community to help them get reconnected. They do this by offering encouragement, support, prayer and working to connect them to local bodies of believers. With a focus of inspiring others to follow the example of the one who gave the only perfect performance and to live in the freedom that comes from believing “It Is Finished.”

World Prayr is working to be difference makers by establishing greater commonality by being "Big Kingdom Minded" in building the kingdom. While working hard to "Reconnect a Broken World".

Below are some of those who serve faithfully in the World Prayr Ministry, perhaps you might recognize a face or two.

We asked our team members to describe in one word what World Prayr means to them. Being eager to do just that, they got on their cell phones, computers, wherever and whatever, to tell you what being part of the World Prayr ohana means to them. Now, it is easier to say than do, because as you are about to find out, while this video does indeed show the global reach of World Prayr, it is not the best quality. Nonetheless, the responses are heartfelt and genuine. We thank our video team for working hard on taking this rough collection of recording and making something of them.


Why are we crowd funding?

World Prayr has been self-funded since our launch in 2009.

We are a lean organization making every cent stretch as far as possible.

We have developed a wonderful community around the globe.

We have seen people rescued, reconnected, and reborn. We know World Prayr works. We want to reach out even further.

For this to happen, we need to grow, develop, and establish our full-time team. We need to underpin World Prayr with sound financing - that is where you can help. By supporting this Indiegogo campaign you can enable World Prayr to take the next step - and above all help to grow the Kingdom of God.

Our goal

We are seeking to raise $100,000

We are raising funds to invest in the following key activities:

  • Faith Factr Store - bringing over 10,000 products from 300 vendors into new store and giving 100% of the profits to the Christian ministries we support around the globe
  • World Prayr Reconnection App - connecting people with churches and ministries, discipling, guiding prayer life and devotionals and giving 100% of profits to Christian ministries we support around the globe
  • World Prayr publishing - building on our first book "Walking in God's Grace" and giving 100% of profits to the Christian ministries we support around the globe
  • Strengthening the Local - delivering support to churches and ministries to help reach out to people in their area.

The allocation in the chart below will be applied to any and all the funds we raise with your help.

Rewards for you

One of the founding principles of World Prayr is that we do not seek donations to support the work we do. Since our launch we have been self funded and while we now need to raise investment to further our work we are offering you the opportunity to receive a range of rewards in exchange for your support. Nevertheless, if you would like to contribute but do not want to receive a reward, that option is available to you.

On the right of this page you will see details of the rewards, to make a contribution click on the  Contribute Now button. 

Please note; if delivery is required  outside Mainland USA, we will contact you to discuss the cost that would be additional to cost of the reward.

$2 - Thank you


$5 - Gospel Phat Band


$10 - Walking In God's Grace 


$10 - Pierced Iron Fish Pendant


$10 - Hope Stone


$25 - Downton Village Storage Basket 


$25 - Forgiven Jewelry Cross Pendant


$50 - A Signed David Bowman Painting "Security" in Matted Taupe Frame


$50 - A Signed David Bowman Painting "Security" in Matted Umber Frame


$50 - Wooden Marble Game Board


$100 - Handcrafted Pen


$100 - Soaring Eagle Sculpture


$250 - He Is Risen Sculpture


$250 - Cobalt Dicroic Cross


$500 - Cypress Flared Bowl


$500 - Carved Cherry Framed Print Shrouded Forest



The Impact

With your help, we can accelerate the plans we have researched and developed over the last few years. You can help to make a difference. All projects undertaken have the single goal that we give 100% of the profits they generate to help other ministries in different parts of the world.

Ministries we support

We have supported the following ministries, and through the new developments we have planned, we intend to continue with and to grow the financial support we can provide.

Account 417, Bibles for China, CEMI Ministries, Congo Ministries, COPE - Coalition of Prison Evangelists, Evantell Ministries, Finish Line Ministries International, Jews for Jesus, Koinonia House National Ministries, Mission Aviation Fellowship, Pioneers, Reece's Rainbow, Recon Ministries, Verse By Verse Ministry International, Victim Relief.

Follow this link to learn more: Ministries Supported by World Prayr


How World Prayr Has Helped

Michelle's Story: The Value Of Listening

She had just started getting back on her feet after 18 years of physical abuse by her husband. Then, being abandoned by family and wrongfully evicted by a family friend, felt alone.

Here are her words, “I was able to tell her everything. I shared every detail, every worry. I justcried and cried. The servant at World Prayr prayed with me, urged me to share with my church and bible study classes, and good friends. I did this and was pleasantly – unexpectedly – relieved. 

The proverbial weight was lifted off my shoulders. Through all this, this servant and WP have been a constant source of strength and prayer”.


Nelly's Story: The Gospel and Prayer Brings A Change

Nelly - Please pray for me. I just had my 2nd anniversary and 3 days before my husband told me he doesn’t love me anymore and he doesn’t see me as his life partner.

World Prayr servant - I have prayed that God will bless your marriage and I pray that your marriage will honor God. Please let us know how things are going and we will keep you in our prayers.

Nelly - Thanks for your prayers. I have seen God's hand in my life, in my marriage and even in my husband's life. I have noticed he has made some attitude changes not only at home but also in his job. Yesterday he openly told me he was looking for some devotionals at internet! He realized his feelings are changing!

Glory and Honor to the Lord!


John's Story: Practical Needs Met

He and his children were being evicted from their home due to the landlord going into bankruptcy. A World Prayr servant went to work. She found them a home. This one was cheaper than what the landlord normally charged and allowed the father to do some work to cover the security deposit. Now this family will be able to have a home for Christmas.


Km's Story: The Peace Of Knowing

Thank you for the response. I got great news today! An individual who owns a place is going tolease it to me! I’m so excited. Thank you for all your prayers. Again, thank you for all your help. It is much appreciated. I know our Heavenly Father is pleased at the works you all are doing. Much love and God bless.


Arnold's Story: Gospel Brings Gratitude Which Leads To Change

Through chatting with someone at World Prayr, I started serving on the team and learn more about God’s love for me. My wife died in late December on a Tuesday, I was at church that Sunday. During the service, God spoke to my heart. I developed a budget and learned I had to give up some things. It was a hard and difficult task. Looking back, I’m grateful and humble for this servant’s insight, love and compassion. Were it not for World Prayr and God, who knows where I might be.


Risks & Challenges

We are under God in the work we undertake. We are embarking on this crowdfunding campaign trusting in The Lord's provision. With His blessing and your help, we can overcome many obstacles that might otherwise slow down or even stop the work we undertake.

We are very conscious that this campaign may seem to be moving us away from our principle of not seeking donations; however, we have some exciting plans as you can see, and to realize them we do need to raise funds.  We have adopted this crowdfunding approach with rewards because it can help us achieve our goal while providing attractive products in return.

Rest assured we will continue to make every penny count. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just cannot contribute, but that does not mean they cannot help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Please use the sharing tools on this page
  • Pray that the campaign will be successful.

Thank you for your time and attention, please help in any way you can. 

We will keep you informed of progress. If you have any questions, please select the World Prayr contact in the team list below and we will answer you as quickly as possible.

story:
My name is Danny O'Callaghan. I'm a passionate singer, songwriter, and worship leader. This year, with your help, I'm going to be making my first record! 

It's been a dream of mine for many years to record my own music and my hope for 2015 is that this dream can finally become a reality. 

This project began with an invitation for me to travel to the US and record with reputable producer Elijah Mosely (John Mark McMillan, Jonathan & Melissa Helser)  at The Threshing Floor in Asheville,  North Carolina. This is an incredible opportunity for a worship artist like me to be able to work with one of the top producers in the field at a world class studio and I would absolutely love it if you can help me make it happen!

All I need to do to make it happen is your help in raising £10,000. This amount will cover all the costs from start to finish (i.e. studio time, equipment, producer, musician fees and mixing/mastering). Raising these funds would allow me to make professional quality recordings of the songs I've had burning in my heart over all these years. (Anything raised above the target will go towards making videos, building a website and CD production.)

This project is so incredibly valuable to me because it is my life; I live and breathe worship and love to express it through my music. I have the privilege of being involved in a worship movement that brings people together and I continually see the power that worship has to awaken the human heart to love. We were created to love and to be loved. It is in the moments when the music and message of God's love collide that our vision is expanded and the world around is is transformed through an encounter with His presence. This is what this project is all about and I hope to be able to record something that will be able to invite others into those moments. The prospect of recording is one of the most exciting and scary things I've done. I've featured on and made a few music projects before but these songs and this record is something that has been birthed entirely out of my own walk with the Lord. 

Partnering in this dream of mine also has its perks (not to mention the satisfaction of making a man's dream come true!). Check out all the options on the page to see what things are on offer - I would feel so honoured if you would join with me by sowing into this record. Every little helps!

If you're not able to give financially, you can help in other ways. Please help me to get the word out to people who would want to invest in this! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this - let's make this happen!

story:
L.E.A.F's new full length album

From the start is has been LEAF's intention to reconnect people back to nature, their history and to each other. The new album will be a continuation of this journey.

On the new LEAF album we will breathe life back into the cultural heritage and folklore of the Nordic and Scandinavian countries. By revocalizing authentic, almost forgotten languages and intwining these voices of the past with the melodies coming from within. LEAF will create an album that treasures and guards the images and wisdom of our ancestors, bringing it back to the ears and hearts of the people LEAF's new full Album will be it's second release, following up on the successfully received debut EP 'Leaf' from 2011.

The people who will be working on this

This album will be produced by none other than Christoffer Juul from LAVA studio in Denmark (known for his work with VALRAVN, HEILUNG and EUZEN) and of course Kati Ran herself of LEAF. Together they will capture the spirit of the past into sound and music.

All recordings for the new album will be done by Fieke van den Hurk at the ORCHVS studio in the Netherlands. Known from recordings for OMNIA, Cesair, Jyoti Verhoeff and many more music projects. Vocal recordings will be done by Christoffer Juul of LAVA studio (Of euzen, valravn, heilung and many more) 

Fieke has been involved with LEAF from the start and will contribute her energy and talent to the new album. Assisting Kati Ran to record parts of the songs before the creative mixing process will take place with Christoffer Juul.

On the album we are lucky enough to have exciting musical contributions by other well known artist from both the paganfolk music scene.

Why we need your help to raise funds

This fundraising project via INDIEGOGO is set up to connect our collective energy of our listeners, to help us birth the first full length album of LEAF. We simply cannot do it without that help and whatever you have to spare for our production.

The funds will make it possible able to record the songs further and complete the mixing and mastering in the studio. Also, we will be able to bring it from written songs and concepts to something concrete and materialized in your hands.

For this all to happen we do need YOUR help, our supportive audience and that of our old and new listeners. This means we will need your excitement, your trust and your donation upfront before you can acquire the full CD.

In helping us raise these funds you will, of course, get the music. And hopefully the realisation and satisfaction that by helping us out you are a significant part of making this LEAF CD a reality.

The release

The release date itself cannot be set to a concrete date at this part of the production stage. This is also because we aim to make an album CD that will stand the test of time and will remain a joy to listen to. To really capture what we want to bring out to world. We strife for perfection, not a rush job.

However, we do promise you this

  • We will start right away, recording more of the new songs and continue the production until it is finished. People who we work with often, know our passion and drive in creating. So we will not stand still. When the funds arive, we will dive in at the deep end with the whole team
  • We will keep you updated. Every step along the way we will communicate via all the channels available to us. You will know the status of the album as it develops.
  • We strife to have the album done in the SUMMER of 2015, now this is not a promise but a intended production goal. A goal that we will work very hard for to achieve with all the producers who are at work.

Other ways you can help

Help us get the word out! Share it everywhere you can, facebook, twitter, blogs, websites, anywhere online. Tell your brothers, sisters, parents, classmates, friends and lovers. Anyone who might be interested in this very exciting, spiritual music project.

Also, do not forget the Indiegogo share tool on this very website.

Thank you so much in advance for any help you are able to give. We'll make sure it's put to good use

Kati Ran | LEAF

We strife to have the album done in the SUMMER of 2015, now this is not a promise but a intended production goal. A goal that we will work very hard for to achieve with all the producers who are at work.

Other ways you can help
Help us get the word out! Share it everywhere you can, facebook, twitter, blogs, websites, anywhere online. Tell your brothers, sisters, parents, classmates, friends and lovers. Anyone who might be interested in this very exciting, spiritual music project.
Also, do not forget the Indiegogo share tool on this very website.
Thank you so much in advance for any help you are able to give. We'll make sure it's put to good use
Kati Ran | LEAF

story:
Please help Susan finish the companion CD soundtrack of the Homesick video!  Tentatively titled, “Under Santa Fe Skies”, there are 12 original songs Susan wrote while the film was gestating (a 15-year process!).  Susan’s songs arise out of her own experience with Multiple Chemical Sensitivities (MCS) and the other chronic conditions she lives with.  Her songs validate, touch and entertain with humor and warmth those who live daily with chronic health issues, disability and the physical and emotional challenges they bring. 

So many of you helped us to reach our goal in 2011 to complete and release the Homesick video in 2013.  Homesick is currently available online for sale. Now distributed nationally by Filmmakers Library, Homesick is “… bringing understanding and compassion to mainstream America...[to] help dispel some of the widespread ignorance about MCS.”  Erica Elliott, MD

                                  

We didn’t have enough funds to fully complete the CD soundtrack. Now 4 years later, we really need to finish this CD, but WE NEED $4500 TO DO THAT!!! PLEASE HELP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN. 

About The Songs

Two songs deal with specific issues of the chemically sensitive “Home Song” and "I'm Too Tired"

Several songs deal with isolation, a painful part of living with chronic illness. Susan tackles the subject with a sense of humor in “What’s Not Wrong?” and sweet compassion “In the Stillness” and “Joanie’s Song”. These themes are universal as well.

Other tunes focus on the joys of life by writing about the things that Susan loves: “Ella” “Under Santa Fe Skies” “For You”, “Tender Moments” and “Caffiene” (by Patty Larkin). Instrumental music from the film e.g. "Lullabye", will also be included.

HEAR HERE   - Listen to excerpts of songs in production.


What we need to complete the CD


$4500  We are almost finished.... Here's what's left to do:

Musicians' fees to record solo tracks & vocals       $1100

Studio time (recording, mixing mastering)            $2500

Indiegogo and fiscal sponsor fees                         $ 350        

Manufacture and Production of CDs                      $ 550


Listen and view more of Susan's music here.

"Susan's songs are filled with an intimacy and a zest for living."      Boston Herald


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and help me make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools

story:
Hello Everyone, Iam Yonni. I am a Producer that's been in the Music Industry for about 10yrs. I've Produced for some of your favorite artist from Lil Wayne to Trey Songz to Missy Elliott & More.
I'm currently working on my project titled "If I Want To”, which features heavy hitters, such as The Game, Christina Milian, Mya, Jeremih, Rock City and more. I Released (3) Songs so far to. I just recently dropped my Official 1st Single 
“SnapChat” ft. Leon Thomas, Eric Bellinger, Rayven Justice of which I'm about to release a video for. Im Doing This Project Independently, and as you know that can be a very tough task, especially when you have a Wife Kids & a Home to take care of. Im About to Push My Single to Radio, Which can get very costly. But I believe in my Song(s) Sooo Much that I'm Trying to Go Sooo Hard to Push them the "RIGHT WAY". Investing my own money etc etc, However I'm only able to do but So much due to having a family and how expensive LA IS! lol 
  • The Reason this Project is so important to me is because its coming from a genuine place, loving what i do & just having fun. I just so happened to have built a Great Reputation with Many Artists so I'm doing music with My Celebrity Friends. So much music now a days is tainted by Politics & People trying to just make that "Quick Fix". 
  • Each & every contribution is important, whether $1 or 100, it will Allow me to give my Current Single "Snapchat" & the other songs on my project the Proper chance to be Heard. 

Any Donation or Contribution is Appreciated. It Could Be $1! I Truly Thank & Appreciate Everyone That Donates and Supports & Rocks With Yonni on My Journey :) God Bless!!!

story:
My new album is finished. It's called Mojo Deluxe. A companion live DVD, "Mojo Live," is just about to be finished. Since 2013, most of my spare time and disposable income have gone towards making these recordings a reality. Now, after 3 years of sweat, tears, happiness, frustration, long hours, bloodletting and neurosis, I want the world to hear the finished product. This is where you can help.

If you're reading this, I'm guessing you're a fan. If you're a fan, you probably want to help spread the word about this music you love. Here's your chance! I intend to hire a great promotional team and get this done the right way. Reviews in influential publications and blogs, widespread radio play, a primo late-night TV appearance - these are just a few of the things a great publicist and radio promoter can make happen.

You can make this possible simply by pre-ordering the new CD. You'll get it 3 months before the official release date, autographed and everything! And if you want to contribute more, we have plenty of perks for you! CD and DVD bundles, t-shirts, posters, sheet music, piano lessons, and personal house concerts. 

Many of you have been a part of this journey with me for years, and I couldn't have done it without you - this is our chance to take it to the next level together!

story:
Dear all,

I have chosen to record an album entitled "Aletheia" (Greek for 'Truth').

I dedicate it to my grandmother, Ruth - a patron of the arts, a Unitarian Universalist, and an enthusiastic supporter of my work. And while Ruth would want the attention to be on her grandson (and neither on herself nor on the notion of Truth), this endeavor would not be possible without her.

All donations will go to studio time at Futura Productions in Roslindale, MA.

Many thanks in advance for your generosity!

Peace,

Evan

story:
Throughout the past decade, Music in Common (MiC) has served thousands of people in more than 200 communities across the globe, deepening understanding between people of diverse faiths and cultures in underserved regions and communities in conflict.  Our focus on youth equips future generations with the skills they need to work and live together in partnership, even in the face of long and difficult odds.  

MiC's impactful programs unite Jews, Muslims, and Christians; Israelis, Palestinians, Americans, and others face to face with collaborative music and multimedia projects.  Through this experience participants discover their commonalities while recognizing their differences as something to embrace rather than something to fear.

Your support of our IndieGoGo campaign will keep these much needed programs in the U.S. and the Middle East alive and growing.

We are raising $35,000 to help fund our programs, which include: 

  • International MiC Youth Summit - A diverse group of high school students from the U.S. and Middle East live, work, and play together for 10 days on a college campus.
  • MiC Immersion - Pairs Jewish and Arab high schools in Israel to write a song and produce a multimedia project together as one group.
  • MiC Community Concerts (FODfest, Meeting of the MiCs, Raise the MiC) - Awareness-raising, free live music events that have featured nearly 2,000 musicians at more than 100 concerts across the U.S. and abroad.
  • JAMM (Journalism as Music and Multimedia) - Empowers youth to speak their minds with songwriting and multimedia, integrating journalism methodologies to substantiate their viewpoint.

Your support provides scholarships, airfare, and room & board for deserving teens in need, venue rentals, facilitator fees, equipment needs, transportation, and logistical costs incurred with last minute venue changes out of conflict zones.

We've got some awesome perks for you including CDs, DVDs, house concerts & wine tastings, and even a trip to the Middle East with MiC.

As the horrific accounts of Jihadism, anti-Semitism, and Islamophobia continue to circle through media outlets around the globe, it is evident that programs like ours are needed more than ever.  At the center of this violence are young people bullied, bribed, and brainwashed to do the bidding of those who teach hate. Only with deepened understanding and empathy for our differences and our humanity can that hate dissipate. MiC programs have a proven track record for success in bringing youth of all walks to the table of peace:

  • 94% of MiC program participants said Music in Common helped them develop skills for communicating and working with others   
  • 88% of MiC program participants said they learned things about the faiths and cultures of other program participants that they did not know beforehand and 75% said this experience changed their perceptions of people from those faiths and cultures
  • 88% of MiC program participants said they had grown as a person from their experience in the program
  • On a scale of 1-5 with 5 being the best, MiC programs received a cumulative score of 4.5 or higher from program participants
Simply by virtue of what we do, MiC faces challenges on a daily basis.  Time and again, we have prevailed even in the face of the most trying of odds - including active conflict during programming - a testament of our commitment to our work. 

Contributing to our IndieGoGo isn't the only way you can help. You can support us by sharing the campaign on your Facebook and Twitter pages, emailing friends and family, and telling everyone you know about it. Join our mailing list, volunteer, make some noise, and be a soldier for peace.

story:
What is Choicee Qee Robot?

Choicee Qee Robot is not only a fashion icon and a beloved character popular in countries all across Asia, but now Choiceee Qee has been brought to life as a multi-functional Robot speaker system that delivers incredible sound quality.  A real robot! 



Change the way you hear music by playing with Choicee Qee your childhood robot dream toy. Choicee Qee will:
1.  Dance with you
2. Move with you
3. Groove with you 
4. Controlling with your phone is simple and easy



How Does it Work?


No need for a boring speaker that just sits there and takes up room.  Choicee Qee is mobile and can deliver music wherever you want it sent.  Choicee Qee can even deliver your own surprise messages to whoever you want. With the touch of your finger Choicee Qee will roll to you and you can rock together. 

1. Turns Left 

2. Turns Right 

3. Moves Arms

4. Turns Head

5. Moves Forward

6. Moves Backward



Features









Free APP


Choicee Qee Robot Specifications


Retail Packaging



Qee 8GB USB Flash Drive





Mini Qee 8GB USB Flash Drive




Schedule


Where will the funds go?



Our Team


Perks



 

FAQ

Which Version of iOS that Choicee Qee Robot compatible with?

Choicee Qee Robot is compatible with: iOS 7 and later version

Which Version of Android that Choicee Qee Robot compatible with?

Choicee Qee Robot is compatible with: Android 4.0 and later version.

Do I need an app to control Choicee Qee Robot?

Yes, there is a Free iOS app you can download from App Store or Android App from Play store (search: Choicee)


What to Expect from us?

As professionals in design and product development with a wealth of experience in these types of product categories you can expect us to deliver a premium product in a timely manner.

For further information, please visit us at www.choicee.com

Please feel free to contact us for support.

We’d love to hear from you! info@choiceonlyusa.com

Thank you for your support!


There are many ways to contribute! Even if you don't have the money right now, you can still help us by sharing our campaign with your friends. Just click on any of the Facebook, Twitter, and other sharing buttons and  let the world know about us. Thank you!

story:
What is "OKLAHOMA RAIN"?

Hi. My name is Dara Tucker. I'm a singer/songwriter, originally from Tulsa, Oklahoma, now living in Nashville, Tennessee who's released 3 previous studio projects, and one live album. I plan on beginning work some time in the next 6 months on my next full studio album - a tribute to love, loss and healing - a collection of songs I'm calling, "Oklahoma Rain." 

After losing both my parents to cancer last year, I began to intensively write as a way of working through grief and creating catharsis. The result is a group of songs that document The Very Difficult Year, and the challenges and promises that are brought about by change.

It won't be all gloom and doom, though - not at all. This album, as with my previous projects, will ultimately focus on hope and healing. 

What We Need & What You Get

$6,000 - Tracking, musicians and engineer's pay 

$1,500 - Mixing, Mastering 

Additional expenses would be included under our 'stretch goal.'

$1,500 - CD Manufacturing 

$3,500 - PR/Advertising

$1,500 - Radio Campaign

$1,200 - Graphic Design/Photography/Website Redesign

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, getting the word out about the campaign is of the utmost importance. Even if you can't give what you'd like, it helps us tremendously when you share the campaign via social media (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook) or by word of mouth. We need foot soldiers! Thanks in advance for your help!

story:
Short Summary

My Name is Mandy Steward of The Speakerphones.

After working diligently over the past couple of years practicing,writing, recording, fine tuning, playing gigs and getting our name out there we are excited to have enough material for a whole album! 

We have already recorded and mixed our 12 original tunes, and now need help with the final hurdle for mastering,ordering tangible copies and putting together a great night for celebrating our final product the you're invited to!

:D

story:
Short Summary

I passed an Audition for Show me the Money 4, a Korean audition program (like the Voice, Australia's got Talent, Superstar K etc.) online and have been asked to compete with South Korean local rappers in Korea to try and win 1/2 million dollars.

Although winning would be great, my main aim is to gain fans and exposure so that when I release my own music, I have a wider audience and enjoy hip hop and rap music with many other musicians in Korea, while I gain more experience.

What We Need & What You Get

It's very expensive to chase your dream halfway across the world. I have borrowed money, sold some possessions etc. to try and get myself over there on time. While I don't want to ask for much, any help in buying my plane ticket back home after my journey is completed, would be gravely appreciated.

The Impact

If every person on my friend list gave me $1, I would be able to pay for my return flights to Korea. So, even if you can't give a lot, giving a little will help to go a long way.

1 Night accomodation in Korea is $30, one meal about $3. Any help supports me a lot even if its not a lot.

Risks & Challenges

I am challenging to compete with native speakers in their native language in rap battles. It will be intense and I might not go to the top but, I'll go as far as I can and enjoy the experience~

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link with your friends :)

story:
Who is Aquil and why I need your help

Hello good people!! I am Aquil an Hip Hop indie artist native to Philadelphia, PA. I have been recording professionally for the last 9 years releasing 3 studio albums and a few mixtapes. I have had the pleasure of performing in music festivals with artists such as Ice Cube, De La Soul, Killer Mike, and have had the opportunity to record music with Grammy award winning producer 9th Wonder and the Soul Council. My music is described as intense, passionate, lyrically complex, thematic and content driven.

I submitted my video into the Teambackpack Cypher 2015 Mission Underground Los Angeles (MULA2015)  competition on youtube and was asked to participate in the next round of live auditions on May 1st through the 3rd. This is a once in a life time opportunity for me to travel to L.A. (West coast) and network with artists, producers, DJs, and promoters. Traveling to L.A. for the first time, I plan to gain more listeners and a chance to perform at different venues in the near future.

What We Need & What You Get

My campaign goal is to raise $800 USD to cover travel (Airfare) and lodging (4 days/3 nights) expenses.

  • $1 = Personal thank you note
  • $5 = Exclusive digital download of a song
  • $10 = Digital download of "Land of Synth" album
  • $20 = "Land of Synth" T-shirt and digital album 
  • $30 = Signed copy of "Land of Synth" album and T-shirt

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share the campaign and spread the word to your friends and family

Thank you and lets make this a great and successful campaign!!
story_txt:
Who is Aquil and why I need your help Hello good people!! I am Aquil an Hip Hop indie artist native to Philadelphia, PA. I have been recording professionally for the last 9 years releasing 3 studio albums and a few mixtapes. I have had the pleasure of performing in music festivals with artists such as Ice Cube, De La Soul, Killer Mike, and have had the opportunity to record music with Grammy award winning producer 9th Wonder and the Soul Council. My music is described as intense, passionate, lyrically complex, thematic and content driven.
I submitted my video into the Teambackpack Cypher 2015 Mission Underground Los Angeles (MULA2015)  competition on youtube and was asked to participate in the next round of live auditions on May 1st through the 3rd. This is a once in a life time opportunity for me to travel to L.A. (West coast) and network with artists, producers, DJs, and promoters. Traveling to L.A. for the first time, I plan to gain more listeners and a chance to perform at different venues in the near future.

What We Need & What You Get
My campaign goal is to raise $800 USD to cover travel (Airfare) and lodging (4 days/3 nights) expenses.

$1 = Personal thank you note
$5 = Exclusive digital download of a song
$10 = Digital download of "Land of Synth" album
$20 = "Land of Synth" T-shirt and digital album 
$30 = Signed copy of "Land of Synth" album and T-shirt
 Other Ways You Can Help
 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Please share the campaign and spread the word to your friends and family   Thank you and lets make this a great and successful campaign!!

story:
Loppen is collecting funds to build a new ventilation system.


We are collectively driven venue, just within the walls of the Freetown Christiania. We have existed since 1973 and we are still part of the social experiment Christiania started in 1971 which means all of our decisions are made based on consensus democracy.

Every year we hold organize around 175 concerts, with every kind of band from the small and new bands, to the legendary musicians who has been touring for years, bands from Denmark and many musicians from abroad.

However when the summer comes near, our room temparature hits the limit for what our volunteers, artists and guests should be served with.
By helping this campaign, you will be part of keeping our unique venue going strong and thereby we can continue to offer musicians a great chance to get out to their audience with their music.

We are trying to collect money for a new ventilation system, which is a costly affair, the price has been estimated to 850.000 DKR (approx. 114000 €), it would be mayor help for our campaign if we could collect a part of the money here from Indiegogo, our volunteers has already gathered 30.000 DKR by collecting 1 DKR at a time from sales in our bar. The rest of the funding we are counting on from different local foundations.

If you can´t help by donations, help by spreading the word of our campaign by sharing it with your social network.

story:
Short Summary

I'm BQ, a 15-year military veteran who happens to make music and also happens to have some wonderful supporters.  Most artists prefer to monitize their talents and even tho its great to make sells, some of these awesome supporters don't get to enjoy all of the music because times are hard.  Some of my supporters are much more fortunate than others and have been excited to join me in this "Pay It Forward" movement.  Its time to make music for those who can't afford music. 

What We Need & What You Get

It is my goal to raise at least $700 to press up a slew of CD's (at cost) and give the gift of music to those who could use a break.  All I ask of them is to pay the favor forward! I've got some great incentives for those who chose to pledge!

The Impact

Music is theraputic and healing. I've got fans/supporters who are only able to enjoy my music videos, free downloads and singles I make public via Soundcloud and other platforms. MP3 quality is a low quality and I want these people, who work hard to share my music,  to enjoy a CD quality product in their car or home.  We want to build an unselfish brand that cares most about touching people through good music.  These CDs are not meant to be passed out at the mall or on the streets.  This is music for current supporters who need good fortune.

Risks & Challenges

Those who make donations will not have to wait until the campaign is over to receive their special copies. If the goal is not met, those who donated would have to purchase their copy off of my official website 30 days later. The % of those who follow through after the campaign could be very well be low.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this campaign on social media, tag a few friends and help me get the ball rolling.  

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Walla Walla already has a solid music scene, in fact, the best it has been in years. There seems to be one thing missing that is  key to keep this solid music scene: a solid venue. Walla Walla needs a spot for young adults to connect around progressive, shared music interests. I have had too many come to me about wanting to do music shows, art shows, and slam poetry readings. I am more than happy to plan fun events like these, but the only thing that is needed is space! Being able to find such space is not the most simple thing when it comes to money. Doesn't that always seem to be the problem? The young adults of Walla Walla deserve such space, and I, alone, can't give it. We have multiple venues but, none dedicated towards young adults' music and art.  We need a space to host designed events for teens and young adults. I am looking to create a drug and alcohol free safe space for all youth to enjoy. I am asking for your help to create an amazing art and music collective here in Walla Walla that is dedicated to the teens and young adults of Walla Walla. 

Our goal is to raise $5,000 towards:

  • Rent and security deposit for a new space 
  • Construction materials for a stage 
  • Sound and lighting equipment

We need Your help!

story:
Are you ready for a centrally located space in San Diego that puts grassroots progressive organizing, local music and art first? The "Grassroots Oasis" needs YOU!

We've updated our video to show you how much work has gone into the new space. You can see our original campaign video on YouTube.com.

The Problem: All the time and effort we expend to find affordable and accessible space for our progressive political, artistic and cultural events and organizing efforts. 

The Solution: A place for events, meetings, training and sharing resources, live music, spoken word, book/play readings, other performances on a smaller scale, speakers, films, art exhibits and other cultural exhibits and conferences. 

What We Need & What You Get

-It was a heavy personal financial lift for me to undertake this -- signing a commercial property lease and taking most of the responsibility for the 4,600 s.f. building, unlike a residential lease. It is a mixed use building -- commercial on the ground floor and residential on the upper floor (where I live with a roommate and my dog), but commercial dictated the lease, as I have found it dictates trash/recycle pickup -- I have to pay for commercial service due to City of San Diego policy. I had to get a commercial liability policy and name my landlord as an additional insured, plus insure the "business" (e.g., the event/meeting space).

 The ground floor I leased was primarily a warehouse space, with concrete block walls, a painted concrete floor and a 12-foot high ceiling. In order to make it functional as a showplace for visual art of all forms, live music, spoken word, and other performance, and as the gathering place for progressive political organizing that I envisioned, it needed carpet and wall covering to muffle the echo of sound that reverberated around that warehouse. Plus strategically placed lighting for the stage area and something other than fluorescent tubes on the ceiling.

Commercial lease = $4,750/month plus $5,500 security deposit

Commercial insurance = $3,900 1-yr policy

Commercial trash/recycle pickup = $240/month

U.S.-made, enviro-friendly carpet tile = $1,600 + $200 install

U.S.-made organic cotton/bamboo fiber and burlap wall covering = $700 + $600 install

New wiring and install of Stage lighting and ambient ceiling lighting = $1,700

Major One-time costs = $11,050

Major Recurring Monthly costs = $5,500

The satisfaction of seeing my vision take root = Priceless

-We are seeking $16,000 to cover start-up and operational expenses for several months so we can focus on growing the GRASSROOTS OASIS as a vital part of the San Diego community, and as a resource for national movements such as ending captivity for marine mammals here in the birthplace of SeaWorld. 

-You'll receive various perks, benefits and items that cannot be found elsewhere. *All contrbutions over $75 are applicable for placement of your name or honoree's name displayed in the entrance lobby(subject to agreement by management).

-Whether we reach our funding goal or not, the space has been leased and your money goes directly to keeping the center vibrant and full during our start up months. 

Amenities:

-A well maintained private building with parking, close to Old Town Transit Center hub for trolley, coaster and bus.  Wheelchair-friendly.  

-Open spaces - you decide what kind of events or classes, subject to Grassroots Oasis agreement.  

-A variety of workshops and cultural events - local and national scale. 

-Stage with sound system and lighting, with a "listening room" atmosphere.

-Digital Projection for Power Point, videos. 

-Wi-fi 

-Ample seating and tables available.

-Environmentally friendly carpeting (91% post-consumer recycled content) and wall  covering (organic cotton and bamboo fiber).

Mission Statement: "To encourage and support progressive community members to use their strengths and gifts for the improvement of life in our San Diego communities. To provide access to educational, social, cultural and economic programs, facilitate partnerships and achieve progressive community goals toward this mission."  

History of Our Business: Apply Liberally Enterprises, LLC (ALE) was founded in 2008 and is owned and managed by Martha Sullivan.  From 2009-2012, Martha hosted a live music series in conjunction with her fine art and collectibles business in her leased business space in Sorrento Valley, San Diego, called Oasis House Concerts.  This live music series was treasured by audience and artists alike, and brought together a wonderful community.  During this time, Martha also hosted many progressive political events in her leased business space for fundraisers, touring speakers, and organizing/action meetings. This experience sowed the seeds for The Grassroots Oasis.

Objectives: 

-Commitment to universal values of dignity, justice and respect for all beings.  

-Sustainable stewardship of the planet on which we live, starting with zero waste and a plant-based diet. 

-Building a movement for government at all levels controlled by its citizens, not by corporate elites, with policies that promote broad public interest, not just private interests.  

-Money Out of Politics

-Reorient our domestic and international policies from maintaining a worldwide military empire to meeting the needs of our people for healthcare, education, nutrition, decent housing and jobs.  

-A truly people-powered space not dependent upon the dictates of corporate, government or large-donor funding, nor shackled by the restrictions on political advocacy associated with 501(c)(3) charitable organizations. Keep our legal structure simple so as to minimize the bureaucracy associated with so many of the larger advocacy organizations.

Find more about us on Facebook.com/grassrootsoasis

Other Ways You Can Help: 

Just because you can't contribute financially doesn't mean you can't help!

-Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

-Use the Indiegogo share tools and social media; help make this come to life!

-Invite your friends.

story:
* Any inquiries please e-mail tylerbing@hotmail.ca*

                          

Campaign is nearing completion, We are so close to being fully funded! If you have been bidding your time on that awesome perk you have been eyeing up, Now is the time to pull the trigger. Thank you to everyone who supports us in this crazy awesome goal!

                


                         * This World Rocks! *

We are getting most of our views from Ireland and around the world, which is totally awesome! thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign and the cause we support even though attending the events is difficult. 

* If you live outside of Alberta or Canada and still want to help out? We have an option in the perks to simply make a $20 donation to the Right to Play foundation. We appreciate all the help we can get and with Air Guitar Being all about world peace we Thank everyone that helps near, or very far! 

Who are we?

About Air Guitar Canada and Air Guitar Alberta: 

After a four year absence from the world stage Canada returned last year crowning Toronto’s Lee “Brymtime” Brymer our National champion. Leading the way at the helm of AGC is former canadian champion Tim “Glen Air Glen Rocks” Evans who competed in Finland in ’07. Air Guitar Canada is a Non-Profit in support of the Right to Play foundation. 

Air Guitar Alberta was formed under the Air Guitar Canada banner to help bring these amazing events to the west and spread the Air Guitar message of world peace. Air Guitar Alberta was created by Tyler Gardner and Marcus Iannattone, Both represented Alberta at the 2014 Nationals in Toronto under the stage names “Cat Friday” and “The Shane Saw”.

OUR MISSION:

1. Win the World Air Guitar Championships
2. Spread joy and usher in World Peace
3. Raise Awareness for and make a meaningful donation to Right To Play.


                             


What are we using the contributions for?

*All Indie-gogo funds will be used to support the development of Air Guitar Alberta including:

1. Venue, marketing, and prizing for the competition

2. Flight and accommodation in Toronto for Canadian Nationals on July 25th for our Alberta Champion and Alberta Commissioner.

3. A donation to our charity Right To Play will be ear-marked at 50/50 for all dollars generated during this campaign and our Alberta events.

Example - So if we make $4000 on the campaign and events - $2000 goes to Right To Play and $2000 goes to running the events.

                                                   

About Right To Play Canada:

Right To Play is a charitable organization dedicated to using sport and play to educate and empower children and youth to overcome the effects of poverty, conflict, and disease in disadvantaged communities world-wide. They serve over 1 million children globally every week with their programs.


About the World Air Guitar Championships:

The World Air Guitar Championships were started in 1996 with a dream of encouraging world peace and love. Every year since thousands of people flock to the northern city of Oulu, Finland to see people jump around playing an invisible guitar with the shared goal of becoming the next World Champion. This is the 20th year of the championships. Since it’s incarnation it has grown to include over 20 countries spanning many different languages and religions with more joining the cause every year. The idea is that anybody anywhere can be a world champion. Air Guitar doesn’t judge people based on gender, religion, ethnicity, social status, or any thing else. Air Guitar is completely inclusive. The Air Guitar World Championships were started as a way to promote world peace and bring people together in solidarity. The Ancient Air Guitar proverb goes “When you are holding an Air Guitar, you can’t be holding a gun.” To this day that same sentiment is echoed by every Air Guitarist as we shred our way to peace. In the beginning it was thought to be a completely ridiculous idea but has proved that sometimes it takes something ridiculous to bring change!

Perks include:

  • T-shirts
  • Banger Bingo swag
  • Tickets to Air Guitar Events 
  • Hand made Custom wall mounted guitar Hangers
  • Concert Tickets to Rush and Journey
  • Be on the Judges Panel!

                                 Custom Heart-o-gram Guitar Hanger

                                              

                      Custom Beatles and Rolling Stones Guitar Hangers

                                 

                                           Custom Coffin Guitar Hangers


                *Shipping extra on all metal work sent outside of Alberta*


RULES:

Air Guitar Alberta runs events with the rules established and set fourth by the Air Guitar World Championship in Oulu, Finland. 

  • performances are limited to 60 seconds each
  • This can be any part of a song or any number of mashed songs.
  • Back up bands are not allowed (real or Air)
  • Air Roadies are permitted but must vacate the stage before competitor starts
  • Competitors instrument must be invisible and must be a guitar (e.g. no Air drums)
  • Competitors may use props if they wish however real instruments are forbidden.

Judging Criteria:

Panels are made up of 3-5 independent judges. All performances are scored on a scale of 4.0 - 6.0 with 6.0 being the highest (just like figure skating). If there are 5 Judges the highest and lowest scores are eliminated to prevent bias. Each Air Guitarist is given a single score for each round, the competitor with the highest combined score at the end is the winner. If there is a tie for first place a sudden victory round will be implemented. Judging criteria can be is based on 6 key categories:

  1. Originality
  2. The Ability To Be Taken Over By The Music
  3. Stage Charisma - How engaging are they? Are they pulling off any rock moves like the power slide, Windmill, throwing the guitar in the Air, Pre tuning, jumps or flips. This is where a performers personality shows through. 
  4. Technical Merit - They don’t have to hit every note perfectly, but they should have a working understanding of how a guitar works. The more they work the fret board the better. Flips and tricks are great, but it doesn't mean a thing if they aren't rocking the guitar just as hard.
  5. Artistic Impression
  6. “Airness” - Many definitions exist for this incredibly vague yet important criteria. It is often the most difficult to explain and usually the most decisive element to any Air Guitar performance. Officially it is when an Air Guitarists performance transcends the limitation of a real guitar and becomes an art form in itself. It is that little bit of crazy that every Air Guitarist knows, it’s that special something that sets the performer apart. It is the ability to make the observers forget they are watching someone jump around with an imaginary guitar and believe in the power of Air.


Anything helps and we appreciate any donations. The Edmonton Regional goes June 27th at The Rendezvous and the Calgary Regional and Alberta Finals goes July 11th at Lord Nelsons Pub. See you there!!!!

T-shirts
Banger Bingo swag
Tickets to Air Guitar Events 
Hand made Custom wall mounted guitar Hangers
Concert Tickets to Rush and Journey
Be on the Judges Panel!



                                 Custom Heart-o-gram Guitar Hanger
                                              

                      Custom Beatles and Rolling Stones Guitar Hangers
                                 

                                           Custom Coffin Guitar Hangers


                *Shipping extra on all metal work sent outside of Alberta*




RULES:


Air Guitar Alberta runs events with the rules established and set fourth by the Air Guitar World Championship in Oulu, Finland. 



performances are limited to 60 seconds each
This can be any part of a song or any number of mashed songs.
Back up bands are not allowed (real or Air)
Air Roadies are permitted but must vacate the stage before competitor starts
Competitors instrument must be invisible and must be a guitar (e.g. no Air drums)
Competitors may use props if they wish however real instruments are forbidden.





Judging Criteria:


Panels are made up of 3-5 independent judges. All performances are scored on a scale of 4.0 - 6.0 with 6.0 being the highest (just like figure skating). If there are 5 Judges the highest and lowest scores are eliminated to prevent bias. Each Air Guitarist is given a single score for each round, the competitor with the highest combined score at the end is the winner. If there is a tie for first place a sudden victory round will be implemented. Judging criteria can be is based on 6 key categories:



Originality
The Ability To Be Taken Over By The Music

Stage Charisma - How engaging are they? Are they pulling off any rock moves like the power slide, Windmill, throwing the guitar in the Air, Pre tuning, jumps or flips. This is where a performers personality shows through. 

Technical Merit - They don’t have to hit every note perfectly, but they should have a working understanding of how a guitar works. The more they work the fret board the better. Flips and tricks are great, but it doesn't mean a thing if they aren't rocking the guitar just as hard.
Artistic Impression

“Airness” - Many definitions exist for this incredibly vague yet important criteria. It is often the most difficult to explain and usually the most decisive element to any Air Guitar performance. Officially it is when an Air Guitarists performance transcends the limitation of a real guitar and becomes an art form in itself. It is that little bit of crazy that every Air Guitarist knows, it’s that special something that sets the performer apart. It is the ability to make the observers forget they are watching someone jump around with an imaginary guitar and believe in the power of Air.


Anything helps and we appreciate any donations. The Edmonton Regional goes June 27th at The Rendezvous and the Calgary Regional and Alberta Finals goes July 11th at Lord Nelsons Pub. See you there!!!!

story:
WHAT IS LADYFEST?

Ladyfest Baltimore is a not-for-profit event highlighting the music and other creative contributions of woman-identified artists and their supporters. Join us in Station North May 29th-31st for a weekend of music, workshops, speakers, and more!

--------------

WHY DONATE?

In light of recent events here in Baltimore, and the citywide curfew that followed, the Baltimore Ladyfest Collective was forced to cancel our remaining scheduled fundraising events. We are happy to report that the festival will still be held, but we now need your help more than ever!

This year's Ladyfest Baltimore will be even bigger and better than last year's - including the use of an outdoor stage. The cost breakdown for that includes (but is not limited to):

- Audio/Staging Rental: $1500

- Event Insurance: $800

- Generator Rental: $335

- Outdoor Security: 14 security x 12 hours @ $10/hr - $1680

- 2 police officers & 1 liquor board rep (mandated by Baltimore City): $1590

- Port-A-Pottys: $375

- Fencing: $600-$1200

We are asking for 5K from the community to help us with these up-front expenses. That amount, combined with the money that we ourselves are putting forward, will help ensure that as much money as possible from the festival itself will be able to go to charity. 

...And speaking of charities, we are proud to announce that the proceeds from this year's Ladyfest will go to:

THE BALTIMORE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION'S FUND FOR REBUILDING BALTIMORE: A fund helping to both provide short-term assistance to individuals and local businesses impacted by the events of the recent unrest and to address the long term needs of communities disproportionately negatively affected by structural racism and systemic inequities

-AND-

TURNAROUND, INC: A domestic violence and sexual assault center in Baltimore that helps women and children affected by intimate partner and sexual violence to address their needs and prevent further violence through advocacy and education

--------------

We've set up some perks to sweeten the deal for contributions of $20 or more, but any amount you are able to donate helps. Thank you so much for your help in making this year's Ladyfest a success! LET'S DO THIS. 

Sincerely,

The Baltimore Ladyfest Collective <3

story:
This project is the first of its kind for both James Montgomery and I in our over 35 years each in the music business. Though both well versed in music performance and doing benefit work for others we have taken it upon ourselves to create our own organization and control the way we raise funds and overs their distribution.

James has been one of New England’s top performers over the last 5 decades, preceding many of Boston’s best known acts to the top. He has continued to be one of the hardest workers in the movement of assisting veterans. As you can see, from the attached video, he did not become a proponent of support as a recent cause but goes back to the 70’s in his support of it.

He has done events of all sorts to support the cause ranging from large concert events to performing in the lobby and rooms at VA hospitals to a handful of vets during their morning coffee. He does not seek any rewards for these efforts but rather looks the pleasures he brings to these veterans.

Myself, over the last 35 years have had the pleasure of working with and touring with many great performers here and abroad as a tour manager and producer, learning every facet of how an event like this must be done if it is to be done properly.

On the other hand I come to it as a veteran. I served at the tail end of Vietnam and was fortunate not to have been deployed there. My luck came in the fact as I was finishing basic training the US ceased sending fresh troops to Vietnam. Though if ordered I would have gone; I am thankful it did not come to that.

We both have disagreed with the Government over the battles we have waged overseas during our lives; even enough to attend protests and write to politicians to show our displeasure with them. The one thing that has never wavered though, is our support for the men and women who have been willing to make that ultimate sacrifice so that the rest of us are able to enjoy the freedoms they help afford us. Though these veterans may have felt as I did when enlisting, not willing to enter the fray but realizing someone must answer the call. We feel this is one way we can help repay those who did not return home the same as they left.

This project is important to us because in a small way we will be able to help fund several of the Veteran’s Assistance Organizations we have worked with over the years, through sales of the CD that will be produced from this live event. We also feel from discussions with patients and outpatients at the VA Hospitals we have been to that those people would enjoy the ability to get out for the day and attend an event that is centered on them and not on others. Their small reward.

The contributions to this campaign will allow us to put in the concert and record the CD to help further our assistance with these programs. The number of programs we can assist is limitless and we realize we cannot help all of them, but feel if we can even help one of them our efforts will not be wasted.

We need your assistance and are reaching out for your help in funding this project. The funding campaign will be used to underwrite the cost of the tickets we will be distributing to Veterans Hospitals for those out-patient vets who have expressed a desire to attend and to pay for the cost of the actual recording. The actual event is limited to only 100 general admission tickets, not nearly enough to help cover the costs of what we are seeking to do. But enough to provide the seed money to begin the project. Were we to sell the remaining 450 tickets we would not need to fund this; but we would not be able to do this in the way we envision honoring those who sacrificed for us.

We have created a set of perks, that we hope people will find creative and there are more to be added. The attempt is to raise funds for the event itself and the actual recording of it and give people things that specifically as music fans they may appreciate. We are very thankful to the musicians who have donated of their time to make these contributions at no expense to themselves.

Should we fall short of our goal we will not be deterred in moving forward, rather we will need to reduce the number of tickets we can donate to the Veterans and delay the release of the resulting CD while exploring alternative funding sources reducing what we can ultimately provide to the Veterans. Under no circumstance will we cancel the event because we feel these people have already sacrificed enough for us and we will find a sacrifice to make for them.

In closing please let me express to you the importance this project means to us. We will not give up on it as it is to important to us to not complete it. We have not been asked to sacrifice nearly as much as these heroes have, but they have asked us for nothing in return. As they did, I learned in the service that an obstacle must be overcome and there is nothing you can’t overcome with persistence and drive.

With this as our plea to you we hope you feel this is a worthy cause. Worthy of your help in helping those who ask nothing in return from us for their sacrifices. We hope you feel the same way and if so are willing to take advantage of the perks we are offering. Some which will benefit you and most which will benefit the veterans.

And please, if you like our goal please feel free to share it with your friends because no contribution will be deemed as to small of insignificant for this cause.

Jim Tirabassi

story:
Hello! 

We are Gino (Mr the Fox) and Heidi Gabrielle, from the Netherlands/Belgium! We are Country music / Gospel songwriters, singers, musicians, and make our music with all the passion that is in our body and soul. Finally after years of hard work and commitment, we were so surprised and honourd by a Nomination on Texas Sounds Country Music Awards! Can you imagine, we from those little countrys in this big world, nominated for a award in the land of Country Music! That is such a dream come true! Never ever had we expected that, and it made us so happy......
Hallo! 
Wij zijn Gino (Mr the Fox) en Heidi Gabrielle, uit Nederland/Belgie. Wij zijn Country/Gospel (en meer) Songwriters, Muzikanten en maken onze muziek met alle passie die we hebben in ons lijf en ziel! Eindelijk na jaren toewijding en hard werken, werden wij onlangs compleet verrast met een nominatie voor Texas Sound Country Music Awards! Kun je je voorstellen? Wij, uit die twee kleine landjes in deze grote wereld, genomineerd voor een Award, in het land waar de Country Music geboren is....Dat is echt een droom die uit komt..Nooit maar dan ook nooit hadden wij dit verwacht, we zijn er dan ook zeer vereerd en gelukkig mee...

But then.....
The deadline to confirm our performance in Jefferson Tx at the Country Music Award Festival is comming closer...and we have not be able to fund the money for the trip yet...we hardly make it to France to be honest....so sad about that...so we thought we give it a last try on here..and maybe, there are some people with a golden heart, who understand why this is so important to us (and for Belgium and the Netherlands, cause Country music is not that popular over here) so we hope to be able to confirm that we are going to the USA..We might give some cd's away or raffle some other nice things if you donate us something! :) 
Maar dan.....
De deadline om ons optreden in Jefferson Texas op de Country Music Awards te bevestigen nadert heel snel, en we zijn er helaas nog niet in geslaagd om de centjes voor de reis bij elkaar te krijgen, sterker nog, we redden het nog niet naar Frankrijk..heel verdrietig...dus dachten we, laten we het nog eenmaal proberen via dit medium en misschien zijn er wel een aantal mensen met een gouden hart die begrijpen hoe belangrijk dit is voor ons (En voor Nederland en Belgie want zo populair is Country muziek hier helaas nog niet) zodat wij misschien op een korte termijn eindelijk onze deelname kunnen bevestigen...en misschien geven we wel wat cd's weg of verloten we andere leuke dingen als u ons helpt! :) 
The money
For our trip to the USA we need at least 2500 Euro's (didn't know it was soooo expensive) that is a lot of money...but hey it is a once in a lifetime oppertunity...anyway every given Euro is helping us getting to Texas...
Voor onze reis naar de USA hebben we minstens 2500 Euro nodig (geen idee dat het zo duur zou zijn!) Dat zijn een hoop centjes, maar ja zo een kans krijg je maar een keer in je leven.....maar goed, elke Euro gegeven is er een, en helpt ons op weg naar Texas....Als je niet wilt doneren middels paypal of creditcard, is er een gewone bankrekening tot onze beschikking..stuur hiervoor even een emailtje. ;)

Our campaign, 


People who know us well, also know that we are not the kind to "ask or beg" so this is a huge step for us, guess it only shows how much we want to go there....and how dedicated we are, to let the world know about, and hear our music that is made with so much love....

Mensen die ons goed kennen weten wel dat wij niet de mensen zijn die "vragen of bedelen" en dit is dan ook een grote stap voor ons, maar het zegt wel hoe graag we daar naar toe willen en hoe toegewijd we zijn om de wereld onze muziek te laten horen en te laten leren kennen, muziek gemaakt met zo veel liefde...

Texas Sound Website

What is Texas Sounds Country Music Awards? 

Texas Sounds is a production of East Texas Performing Arts, Inc. a 501c3 nonprofit corporation. In 2014 the concept of a worldwide country music competition was launched in the little tourist town of Jefferson, Texas. The concept matured quickly into one of the most exciting country music events anywhere in the world. In 2015 there will be 13 performers, from nations all over the world! How are Texas Sounds nominees selected?Nominations for Texas Sounds are usually initiated by one of East Texas Performing Arts’ experienced Board of Directors members. We scour the web, listening to posted music from around the world. Most nominees are found on sites such as REVERBNATION, YouTube,SoundCloud, and Facebook. We qualify our selections by researching their websites, online reviews, and listening to all their available music online 

The Challange

Yes "the Challange" :) of course we are going to do the BEST we can to get one of those Awards! But...the other country's man they are sooooo good! So it would be wonderful to win one of those awards, but if we don't...we are still so thankfull we were able to participate, to be chosen and to perform in Texas. 

Ja " de uitdaging" :) Natuurlijk doen wij ons uiterste BEST om zo een award te winnen! Maar...de deelnemers uit de andere landen die zijn zoooo goed! Het zou dus geweldig zijn om een award te winnen, maar winnen we niet, zijn we nog steeds heel dankbaar dat we mee mochten doen en uitgekozen zijn geweest en hebben mogen optreden in Texas....

Other Ways You Can Help

Now of course we know not everyone is able to contribute in the way of donating money...but you can contribute too, by sharing our campaign and spread the word for us!!! There's also another bank account available, if you do not wish to use a creditcard or Paypal just sent me a mail...

Natuurlijk weten we best dat niet iedereen financieel in staat is om een donatie te doen, maar u kunt ons ook helpen op een andere manier! Door het delen van onze campagne en het woord te verspreiden!!! Er is een gewoon bank account aanwezig in geval je niet wilt doneren via credit card of Paypal...mail me gerust eventjes....
