story:
Short Summary

The Heart Will Jump (With Nowhere to Fall) is a labor of love from all angles of production. These are my most poetically and musically ambitious songs to date, and with some help, I am so proud to finally share them with you! Brenden Silk of STFU Robot is engineering sound, and a handful of Bellingham's finest musicians are accompanying, including: Julianne Thoma ( of The Julianne Thoma Band) on vocals and piano, David (Swab) Lofgren (of Robert Sarizan Blake and Snug Harbor) on drums and Lyman Lipke (of Baby Cakes) on bass. 

If you don't know me already, hello, it's nice to meet you! I've played music professionally since age 15. This will be my fourth full-length record. Most of these songs are in open tunings with delay and reverberated guitar effects. Songwriting is my first and one true love, though, I also have side affairs with poetry, non-fiction and fiction. I hold a bachelor's degree in Creative Writing from Western Washington University and am a future M.F.A. fiction candidate at the University of Colorado.


What I Need & What You Get

My funding goal is set at $2,500. This pays for studio time, mixing, mastering, the accompaniment and online and radio distribution. If I exceed my goal, I plan to press vinyl copies and/or print new t-shirts.

Breakdown of cost:

  • 20hrs of Studio Time: $300
  • Engineering: $500
  • Mastering: $300
  • Accompaniment: $600
  • Online Distribution (Spotify, Itunes, etc.): $100
  • Radio Play Distribution: $700
  • If I exceed my goal, pressing 100 copies of vinyl costs roughly $1,000. I know it's a long shot, but it would be so cool!

What You Get:

Everyone who pledges gets a digital copy of the record, no matter the amount. I'm sorry I don't have a lot of bells and whistles to offer. This is really just about making a great record. For pledges over $100 that are located in Washington or Colorado, I am happy to set up a free, all ages performance in your area. If I don't reach my goal, all funds raised are still going to go towards this project. Without your support, unfortunately none of the distribution (the getting-it-out-there) can really happen. 

The Impact

Are you tired of hearing music that only features a male voice? A story between a guy and a girl? A narrative built on the foundation of a cliche? If you answered yes to any of these questions, please consider contributing to this project. I am a woman, a lesbian and more importantly, a disciplined writer, listener, reader and guitarist.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends. Have an authentic voice. Make art. Collaborate.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
The Heart Will Jump (With Nowhere to Fall) is a labor of
love from all angles of production. These are my most poetically and musically ambitious songs to date, and with some help, I am so proud to finally share them with you! Brenden Silk of STFU Robot is engineering sound, and a handful of Bellingham's finest musicians are accompanying, including: Julianne Thoma ( of The Julianne Thoma Band) on vocals and piano, David (Swab) Lofgren (of Robert Sarizan Blake and Snug Harbor) on drums and Lyman Lipke (of Baby Cakes) on bass. If you don't know me already, hello, it's nice to meet you! I've played music professionally since age 15. This will be my fourth full-length record. Most of these songs are in open tunings with delay and reverberated guitar effects. Songwriting is my first and one true love, though, I also have side affairs with poetry, non-fiction and fiction. I hold a bachelor's degree in Creative Writing from Western Washington University and am a future M.F.A. fiction candidate at the University of Colorado. 
   What I Need & What You Get
My funding goal is set at $2,500. This pays for studio time, mixing, mastering,
 the accompaniment and online and radio distribution. If I exceed my 
goal, I plan to press vinyl copies and/or print new t-shirts. 
Breakdown of cost:  20hrs of Studio Time: $300

Engineering: $500
Mastering: $300
Accompaniment: $600
Online Distribution (Spotify, Itunes, etc.): $100
Radio Play Distribution: $700
If I exceed my goal, pressing 100 copies of vinyl costs roughly $1,000. I know it's a long shot, but it would be so cool! 


What You Get:
Everyone who pledges gets a digital copy of the 
record, no matter the amount. I'm sorry I don't have a lot of bells and 
whistles to offer. This is really just about making a great record. For 
pledges over $100 that are located in Washington or Colorado, I am happy to set up a free, all ages
 performance in your area. If I don't reach my goal, all funds raised are still going to go towards this project. Without your support, unfortunately none of the distribution (the getting-it-out-there) can really happen.  

    The ImpactAre you tired of hearing music that only features a male voice? A story between a guy and a girl? A narrative built on the foundation of a cliche? If you answered yes to any of these questions, please consider contributing to this project. I am a woman, a lesbian and more importantly, a disciplined writer, listener, reader and guitarist. 
    Other Ways You Can Help
Share this campaign with your friends. Have an authentic voice. Make art. Collaborate.

story:
THE STORY   A celebration of melody, rhythm and soul, ORIENTE was formed in the early ‘90's by Cuban guitarist and songwriter, Eddy Balzola, at a time when Cuban roots music in South Florida was still taking a back seat to Latin pop and cookie-cutter Salsa. Eddy's deep respect for his roots plus Jazz and Blues and a lifelong love affair with early '70's Soul music, were the major influences on his new musical adventure and ultimately distinguished ORIENTE from other great Latin Jazz groups.  

With only a rough cassette recording and the word of a respected New Orleans' musician, the band's official debut was at that city's premier jazz club, Snug Harbor. Snug's audiences were accustomed to very funky and progressive music and, with raw energy, ORIENTE delivered that and more. Over the years the band's evolution has seen some changes in instrumentation and personnel but the heart and soul of the music remains organic and fresh. 

THE CHALLENGE   In spite of the band's reputation and consistent performances, the myriad of costs involved in producing a recording, not to mention touring in support of the new music, is almost unaffordable. ORIENTE has made four recordings to date, all great but all on a shoestring.  Tracks for the newest release, titled "Soul eNclave", have been recorded live in the studio as well as the vocal parts, and now it's time to add some amazing guest instrumentalists. The additional recording along with mixing, mastering, artwork, disc production and promotion lay ahead, which beckons this humbling request for donations from friends, fans and believers.   

THE MUSIC  This new CD features some of the finest musicians in the land alongside Balzola's melodic guitar riffs and poetic lyrics - band mates Yoel Del Sol (congas and multi-percussion), William Paredes (trombone), Dony Felix (bass), and Orlando Machado and Rey Monroig alternating on trap drums. Guests will include Stuart King on trumpet, alto saxophonist Jesse Jones, Jr., tenor saxophonist Felipe Lamoglia, percussionist Raymer Olalde and harmonica virtuoso Randy Singer. Most of the songs are composed and arranged by Balzola including EARTH TONES (an uptempo Latin Jazz number with flavors of Eddie Palmieri and Mardi Gras Indians) and OVERTOWN REDEMPTION (Southern Gospel meets cha cha cha). ECHOES OF TRANE TRACKS brings together Coltrane classics, Naima and Equinox with  guaguanco' and features Balzola's eloquent spoken word tribute to JC in a style reminiscent of the Nuyorican Poets and Gil Scott-Heron, and IBIANO - dedicated to the band's late bassist Pepe Aparicio, a beloved friend and mentor, who had adopted the arrangement from his time playing with Mongo Santamaria.

THE TRUTH   At a time when live music, performed by live and dedicated musicians, is in danger of being totally replaced by tracks and gimmicks, ORIENTE stands alongside those who believe there is nothing more powerful and beautiful than a story told through the poetry, melodies, rhythms and sounds of a well crafted song. ORIENTE's musicians are full-time players and some also teach music. They are fabulous cats who dedicate their lives to music and art, and any amount of donation will be appreciated and put toward the final production costs of this beautiful new recording. You can follow the band, listen to the music, view videos, calendar etc. at  http://orienteband.com/ or https://www.facebook.com/Orienteworldmusic .

 William Paredes    Eddy Balzola     Yoel Del Sol        Dony Felix     Raymer Olalde

story:
The original fundraising campaign has ended. We didn't meet our ideal goals, but we are moving ahead with production! It will be a shorter run than originally planned, so be sure to pre-order your copies now. You can do that here or through our facebook page. Releasing October 2015. THANK YOU!

 

Summary

My name is Innosanto Nagara, and I'm the author and illustrator of two successful children's books, A is for Activist and Counting on Community. I wrote these books to fulfill my desire to have books that reflected my family's values to read to my two year old. Little did I know that they would eventually be in independent bookstores across the US and around the world.

But there has always been another thing that I've missed. You see, I grew up in Indonesia, and when my son was born, I went looking for recordings of some of the Indonesian songs that I grew up on. Unfortunately, despite finding some good individual recordings, I have not been able to find an album of the most well known Indonesian songs from our youth that is not so heavily produced that it feels better suited for a TV show than my child's bedroom.

To make a long story short, after commiserating with my brother Biko Nagara, who happens to be an awesome musician, and my friend Suzi Herawati (Ujie), who happens to be an amazing singer—we decided to record our own. And since I'm an illustrator, why not put it all together with a book of illustrations that go with each song.

Ujie (on the right) singing in a "Vocal Group" competition when we were still in school together in Jakarta.

These songs will be in Indonesian, but they will be easy for anyone to listen to, and sing along with. We imagine that the most immediate interest in this CD/Book set will come from those of you with an Indonesia connection. Perhaps you are Indonesian ex pat. Perhaps you have lived in Indonesia for some period in your life. Perhaps you plan to spend some time in Indonesia and are learning the language? But even if you're not connected to Indonesia in some way, if you are interested in your children (or children you know or teach) having some exposure to the culture of the fourth largest country in the world—the country where the current president of the United States spent some of his childhood—then this CD/Book will be for you too!

Biko and his daughter performing at the Starry Plough in Berkeley.

What We Need & What You Get

This is going to be a homegrown project and a labor of love. But even though we are doing all the music and illustration labor in our time, we will still have significant production costs. We will have to rent recording studio time, pay for CD mastering, and pay for book printing. Our very minimal $2500 goal, if achieved, will pay for some of that. There is no risk in backing this project. We can produce as many CD/Book sets as we get $20 pledges for, even if it's a small number. But the economies of scale in printing and CD production mean that each set will be more affordable the more we do at the outset. What we hope most people will do is make a $20 pledge that we can treat as a "pre-order" so that we know how many to produce.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is getting enough pre-orders to be able to produce these at an efficient price. With today's printing and CD mastering technologies, we can produce one, one hundredd, or one thousand. But without knowing how much real interest there is going to be, it's hard to know how big of a commitment to make.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your networks. And if you have know any other Indonesia-interested people or World Music and Culture" programs for kids who might be interested, please put us in touch.


Terima kasih!

story:
Hi! I'm Nathalie Hope.  Welcome to my campaign!

Thank you so much for taking some time to read a little about me and the heart behind this EP! 

I'll start by introducing myself.  I'm Nathalie Hope...Hi!!  I've been married to my sweet & talented husband (the man behind the camera/graphics) for 10 years, we have 2 amazing kids (age 7 & 5), and we live in a small town right outside of Nashville, Tennessee.  I've always been passionate about music, and I'm so grateful I'm get to live out that passion every day. 

Over the last several months I've been writing songs specifically for this project.  A lot of thought, prayer, scripture meditation, and heart to heart conversations went into creating these songs, and I'm so excited to share them with you.  

As I shared in the video, I've been writing music and singing for quite some time. It's been within the last couple of years that I've realized that leading worship and writing worshipful music is where I feel most at home in my heart.  The songs on this project come from a new season of my life in which the Lord has been showing me who I am/who we are in Him; as his children and as His Church. As we were writing the songs, my heart was inspired to make music that's accessible to the listener/worshiper--no matter the season, walk of life, or circumstances. The songs come from a personal place in my own walk with Him, but they were written for us. My prayer is that these songs will become a collective prayer, celebration, and declaration of truth, and ultimately, lift your eyes to Jesus. 

WILL YOU JOIN ME?

As an independent artist, I get the creative freedom to make the music I feel inspired to make.  That's awesome and such a blessing! However, the challenge is not having a label with funds to make this project happen.  I humbly and joyfully invite you to join with me and help me make this EP a reality. 

(What's an EP? It simply stands for "Extended Play". It's a recording that has more songs than just a single, and fewer than a full length studio album)

What We Need & What You Get
Here's the breakdown of costs to record 4 songs:

  1. It will cost $1500 per song, which includes studio time, the producer, musicians, mixing and mastering. 
  2. The price to press & package CDs is around $300
  3. About 7-8% of the total raised goes to Indiegogo fees and processing fees. 
  4. Miscellaneous (packing & shipping cost, etc) $300-$500
That's a grand total of $7,350.

**PERKS!!!**

I'm excited to offer you some awesome perks as a thank you for investing in this project! (Take a look at the side panel and get yours!)

  • Pre-Order a digital copy of the EP
  • Pre-Order a physical copy of the CD
  • Get this beautiful hand drawn lyric print from the EP's title song
  • Your name in the liner notes!
  • A Day at the Studio
  • A Night of Music & Worship at your house 
  • A Writing Session with me + Writing Demo
  • Get the title of Executive Producer

AND when you give any amount, you'll get access to a private Instagram Account with exclusive updates.  You get to be part of the creative process!  This includes behind the scenes photos, videos, & demo tracks....even the chance to vote on the album artwork!

What if we raise more than the goal?
Yay! We'll record more music!

What if we don't reach the goal?
We'll use what was raised to record fewer songs! But we still get to record! WOHOOO!


Risks & Challenges


Scheduling and coordinating musicians, studio time, and the mixing and mastering process makes it challenging to pinpoint an exact release date. BUT, we've already been working on that to make sure we can give you a good estimated date now, and a firm date in the weeks to come!


Other Ways You Can Help

Here are additional ways you can help me reach my goal:

Share my campaign page on Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram (and share often!..without being obnoxious of course).  You have influence beyond my reach and I value your help in spreading the word!


THANK YOU!!!

Thank you from the deep down bottom of my heart.  I am so grateful for your support and encouragement as I take these steps of faith.  I can't wait to see it all unfolds!

story:
Clubbers Die Younger...
... is preparing a huge party and needs your help!

    (If you are not from the Czech Republic, please just scroll down to the English part.)


    CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER chystá pořádnou párty a potřebuje vaši pomoc! Pokud jste narazili na tuto kampaň, možná nás už znáte, ale pro ty z vás, kteří se s námi setkávají poprvé: CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER je pravidelná hudební akce, zaměřená na alternativní scénu, která se pokouší vnést do Brna trochu té méně tradiční hudby (o tu se starají nejrůznější kapely a goth/industrial/cyber/electro DJové) a ještě méně tradiční zábavy (body-mod a BDSM představení, gothic belly dance, pole dance…)
    Momentálně se připravujeme na naši zatím největší akci – oslavu 2. narozenin CDY 16.5. 2015 se čtyřmi kapelami, z nichž tři jsou zahraniční (včetně úžasné Tying Tiffany). Chceme dělat i nadále co nejlepší akce, ale co si budeme povídat, bez peněz to v dnešní době není lehké! Jsme jen dvě, a nemáme žádné sponzory ani jiné zdroje financování pro naši akci. Momentálně jsme tedy na všechno samy, včetně pokrývání nemalých nákladů, které se na této scéně zkrátka nevrací. Zároveň nechceme zvyšovat cenu lístků, která zatím nikdy nepřekročila 180,- , protože si přejeme, aby naše akce byly dostupné opravdu pro každého, včetně studentů, kteří nevydělávají.
    Proto se obracíme na vás s prosbou o pomoc! Mrkněte se na naši kampaň a chcete-li, aby to v Brně žilo, podpořte nás – každá koruna se počítá! Těm, kteří přispějí trošku více, rádi pošleme některou z cen od nás samotných, nebo od kapel, které se Clubbers Die Younger účastní. Informace o cenách jsou k dispozici v angličtině i v češtině, takže vám nic nebrání, vybrat si tu svou! Pokud patříte k jedincům, kterým paypal a indiegogo nic neříká, ale přesto nám chcete pomoci, můžete poslat příspěvek i jednoduchým bankovním převodem na účet 1251624023 – stačí přidat variabilní symbol 160515 (datum naší příští akce).
    Cíl, kterého bychom rády dosáhly, by měl v kombinaci s penězi, které získáme prodejem lístků, pokrýt veškeré náklady. Pokud onu částku nevybereme, akce stejně proběhne, jen to pro nás bude náročnější. Pokud získáme víc peněz, než je cílová částka, vše poctivě uschováme na další koncert! Jestli chcete o nás a naší kampani vědět víc, následují vyčerpávající informace v angličtině.

    AND NOW IN ENGLISH!

    WHO WE ARE

    Clubbers Die Younger (CDY) is a regular club event, mainly focused on goth/industrial/cyber/electronic/alternative genres. It takes place in various venues around Brno, Czech Republic, and provides the alternative scene with  a semi-monthly dose of music, dance and other interesting program. CDY was created 2 years ago by two girls that weren´t happy with the declining state of local subculture - one of them had plenty of experience with organizing events, the other brought in lots of youthful enthusiasm. We wanted to fill the gap left on the goth scene and offer both seasoned and new people a place to meet like-minded individulas, have fun and dance their heart out. And we also wanted them to be able to see bands they love in their hometown, not only at summer festivals in Poland or Germany!

    WHAT WE DO

    Through better and worse, we have stuck with this party for two years already, and have no intention of stopping! During this time, we have invited various DJs from Czech Republic, Slovakia, Austria, Poland and Australia, and organized a number of concerts, from popular electronic bands, such as H.Exe, to unique concerts, such as Gothic Prince Ken from Australia/Japan. We also support new bands on the scene – last year, two young and promising cyberpunk bands had their first show at CDY. Furthermore, we attempt to form a connection between underground music scene and the BDSM scene by incorporating thematic body-modification and BDSM performances into our events. We also feature gothic belly dance and tribal fusion dancers and a variety of other performers to provide our visitors with a broad range of amusement.

    You can check out our page here:  https://www.facebook.com/ClubbersDieYounger

    In the future, we would love to make our events even bigger and better, and most importantly, bring well-known bands to Brno. Our town is strategically placed within 2 hours of 3 capital cities: Prague, Vienna and Bratislava. In the distant past, it used to be frequented by people travelling between these cities, and nowadays, it´s still an awesome place to be included in band tours! And trust me, bands LOVE to come here – they like the Czech Republic, the enthusiasm of our audience, and last but not least, our pretty girls and cheap beer. There is a problem, though: we can´t really afford them.

    CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER has no sponsors whatsoever, no grants from the city/country, virtually no source of funding. One of us is a self-employed translator, the other is still a student, and we pay EVERYTHING by ourselves. If there is a financial loss, we have to bear it – and when organizing an underground concert in our town, the chance of a huge financial loss is very, very high. There is no chance to get back what we invested solely through the income generated by ticket sales, even if attendance is high, because our tickets are generally priced around 5 Eur. While it seems the logical decision would be rising their price, we do not want to do that, because our goal is for everyone to be able to afford attending our events. The financial situation of most people here, be it due to crisis or general low incomes, frequently doesn´t allow for spending 20 or 30 Eur on a concert. Moreover, Brno is a student town, which means that the biggest part of our audience is composed of young people, who hardly have any income at all.

    WHAT WE NEED

    Currently, we are planning a 2nd birthday party of CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER on 16.5. 2015 – our largest event so far, with 4 bands, 3 of them from abroads, several Djs, pole dance performance and other surprises. (Check out the poster and event link below!) It´s success or failure could mark the future of CDY. 

    Please, help us make this event huge! To cover most (not all!) expenses, we need to raise 1000 Eur. This amout of money together with what we gain from ticket sales, will assure that we will not have to reach into our own pockets to cover for losses, and that everything, including small things like refreshments for our bands, will be safely provided for. What we aim for is for everyone to be able to afford attending our party, and we hope that those of you who can, will not mind spending a little bit more to support our campaign, so that we wouldn´t have to bear the expenses alone.

    Any help from our friends, subculture folks and like-minded people from abroads will be greatly appreciated too! For you, 5 Eur is the price for a subway ticket. For us, it is how much we get for one person attending the show! Please, consider spending a few Eur to support our case and enable the subculture in a smaller country to thrive. Even the tiniest amount of money makes a huge difference! To make this sweeter, we have prepared a few perks for you - in collaboration with some of the bands performing at our birthday event (Bart Cathedral/Splendor, LateXJesus and Der Himmel über Berlin). Please, check them out, perhaps you´ll discover something you fancy!

    DISCLAIMER: All the money raised through this campaign will be used to cover the expenses of Clubbers Die Younger Birthday Party. In case that more money than the necessary amount is raised, we will not keep any of it for ourselves. Instead, we will invest it in future events, which take place every month! In case the goal is not met, the birthday party will, of course, still take place, we will still be thankful for whatever money we have raised, and cover the rest of the expenses from our pocket! All the perks purchased will be signed on 16.5. 2015 and sent out within a week after the event (or handed to you personally, in case you attend the event).

    PLEASE HELP US SPREAD THE WORD AND ALLOW THIS CAMPAIGN TO REACH AS MANY PEOPLE AS POSSIBLE!
story_txt:
Clubbers Die Younger...... is preparing a huge party and needs your help!  (If you are not from the Czech Republic, please just scroll down to the English part.)   
CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER chystá pořádnou párty a potřebuje vaši
pomoc! Pokud jste narazili na tuto kampaň, možná nás už znáte, ale pro ty
z vás, kteří se s námi setkávají poprvé: CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER je
pravidelná hudební akce, zaměřená na alternativní scénu, která se pokouší vnést
do Brna trochu té méně tradiční hudby (o tu se starají nejrůznější kapely a
goth/industrial/cyber/electro DJové) a ještě méně tradiční zábavy (body-mod a
BDSM představení, gothic belly dance, pole dance…) Momentálně se připravujeme na
naši zatím největší akci – oslavu 2. narozenin CDY 16.5. 2015 se čtyřmi
kapelami, z nichž tři jsou zahraniční (včetně úžasné Tying Tiffany). Chceme dělat i nadále co nejlepší
akce, ale co si budeme povídat, bez peněz to v dnešní době není lehké! Jsme
jen dvě, a nemáme žádné sponzory ani jiné zdroje financování pro naši akci. Momentálně
jsme tedy na všechno samy, včetně pokrývání nemalých nákladů, které se na této
scéně zkrátka nevrací. Zároveň nechceme zvyšovat cenu lístků, která zatím nikdy
nepřekročila 180,- , protože si přejeme, aby naše akce byly dostupné opravdu
pro každého, včetně studentů, kteří nevydělávají. Proto se obracíme na vás
s prosbou o pomoc! Mrkněte se na naši kampaň a chcete-li, aby to
v Brně žilo, podpořte nás – každá koruna se počítá! Těm, kteří přispějí
trošku více, rádi pošleme některou z cen od nás samotných, nebo od kapel,
které se Clubbers Die Younger účastní. Informace o cenách jsou k dispozici
v angličtině i v češtině, takže vám nic nebrání, vybrat si tu svou! Pokud
patříte k jedincům, kterým paypal a indiegogo nic neříká, ale přesto nám
chcete pomoci, můžete poslat příspěvek i jednoduchým bankovním převodem na účet
1251624023 – stačí
přidat variabilní symbol 160515 (datum naší příští akce). Cíl, kterého bychom
rády dosáhly, by měl v kombinaci s penězi, které získáme prodejem
lístků, pokrýt veškeré náklady. Pokud onu částku nevybereme, akce stejně
proběhne, jen to pro nás bude náročnější. Pokud získáme víc peněz, než je
cílová částka, vše poctivě uschováme na další koncert! Jestli chcete o nás a
naší kampani vědět víc, následují vyčerpávající informace v angličtině.

AND NOW IN ENGLISH!

WHO WE ARE
Clubbers Die Younger (CDY) is a regular club event, mainly focused
on goth/industrial/cyber/electronic/alternative genres. It takes place in various venues
around Brno, Czech Republic, and provides the alternative scene with  a semi-monthly dose of music, dance and other
interesting program. CDY was created 2
years ago by two girls that weren´t happy with the declining state of local
subculture - one of them had plenty of experience with organizing events, the
other brought in lots of youthful enthusiasm. We wanted to fill the gap left on the goth
scene and offer both seasoned and new people a place to meet like-minded
individulas, have fun and dance their heart out. And we also wanted them to be
able to see bands they love in their hometown, not only at summer festivals in
Poland or Germany!
WHAT WE DO
Through better and worse, we have stuck with this party for
two years already, and have no intention of stopping! During this time, we have
invited various DJs from Czech Republic, Slovakia, Austria, Poland and
Australia, and organized a number of concerts, from popular electronic bands,
such as H.Exe, to unique concerts, such as Gothic Prince Ken from
Australia/Japan. We also support new bands on the scene – last year, two young
and promising cyberpunk bands had their first show at CDY. Furthermore, we
attempt to form a connection between underground music scene and the BDSM scene
by incorporating thematic body-modification and BDSM performances into our
events. We also feature gothic belly dance and tribal fusion dancers and a
variety of other performers to provide our visitors with a broad range of
amusement. 
You can check out our page here:  https://www.facebook.com/ClubbersDieYounger

In the future, we would love to make our events even bigger
and better, and most importantly, bring well-known bands to Brno. Our town is
strategically placed within 2 hours of 3 capital cities: Prague, Vienna and
Bratislava. In the distant past, it used to be frequented by people travelling
between these cities, and nowadays, it´s still an awesome place to be included
in band tours! And trust me, bands LOVE to come here – they like the Czech
Republic, the enthusiasm of our audience, and last but not least, our pretty
girls and cheap beer. There is a problem, though: we can´t really afford them. 
CLUBBERS DIE YOUNGER has no sponsors whatsoever, no grants
from the city/country, virtually no source of funding. One of us is a
self-employed translator, the other is still a student, and we pay EVERYTHING
by ourselves. If there is a financial loss, we have to bear it – and when
organizing an underground concert in our town, the chance of a huge financial
loss is very, very high. There is no chance to get back what we invested solely
through the income generated by ticket sales, even if attendance is high,
because our tickets are generally priced around 5 Eur. While it seems the
logical decision would be rising their price, we do not want to do that,
because our goal is for everyone to be able to afford attending our events. The
financial situation of most people here, be it due to crisis or general low
incomes, frequently doesn´t allow for spending 20 or 30 Eur on a concert.
Moreover, Brno is a student town, which means that the biggest part of our
audience is composed of young people, who hardly have any income at all. 
WHAT WE NEED

DIE YOUNGER on 16.5. 2015 – our largest event so far, with 4 bands, 3 of them from
abroads, several Djs, pole dance performance and other surprises. (Check out
the poster and event link below!) It´s success or failure could mark the future
of CDY.  
Please, help us make this event huge! To cover most (not
all!) expenses, we need to raise 1000 Eur. This amout of money together with
what we gain from ticket sales, will assure that we will not have to reach into
our own pockets to cover for losses, and that everything, including small
things like refreshments for our bands, will be safely provided for. What we
aim for is for everyone to be able to afford attending our party, and we hope
that those of you who can, will not mind spending a little bit more to support
our campaign, so that we wouldn´t have to bear the expenses alone. 
Any help
from our friends, subculture folks and like-minded people from abroads will be
greatly appreciated too! For you, 5 Eur is the price for a subway ticket. For
us, it is how much we get for one person attending the show! Please, consider
spending a few Eur to support our case and enable the subculture in a smaller
country to thrive. Even the tiniest amount of money makes a huge difference! To
make this sweeter, we have prepared a few perks for you - in collaboration with
some of the bands performing at our birthday event (Bart Cathedral/Splendor,
LateXJesus and Der Himmel über Berlin). Please, check them out, perhaps you´ll
discover something you fancy! 


DISCLAIMER: All the money raised
through this campaign will be used to cover the expenses of Clubbers Die
Younger Birthday Party. In case that more money than the necessary amount is
raised, we will not keep any of it for ourselves. Instead, we will invest it in
future events, which take place every month! In case the goal is not met, the
birthday party will, of course, still take place, we will still be thankful for
whatever money we have raised, and cover the rest of the expenses from our
pocket! All the perks purchased will be signed on 16.5. 2015 and sent out
within a week after the event (or handed to you personally, in case you attend
the event). 
PLEASE HELP US SPREAD THE WORD AND ALLOW THIS CAMPAIGN TO REACH AS MANY PEOPLE AS POSSIBLE!

story:
The Happily Entitled

Our band has spent months practicing hard and writing lots of rad songs, and we're ready to hit the recording studio. After some searching around, we discovered Bell Labs, a fantastic studio in Norman, Oklahoma. We fell in love with the studio, but it's quite a bit more than we can manage to pay for out of our own pockets. 

We hope you all can help us reach our goals and make a great record!

The Goal

Our hope is to raise $5000 and make this record happen! If we can reach this goal, we'll have all the time we could need to track, and enough left over to properly master and distribute our EP! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Things are expensive, and we feel that. If you can't make a contribution, we would greatly appreciate your help in spreading this campaign as far as possible! Thanks everyone.

story:
This all started...

...as a band to play music from RL Heyer's debut solo album. That was released 12/13/14 and was titled "Sweet Action." It featured songs written, produced, engineered, and mostly performed by RL. Also present on the album were Scott Goodwin and Bob Rees (drums and vibraphone, respectively on Capsule), and Tina and Indy Heyer (vocals on We Can't Forget Love, Paradise, and Song for the Top of the Mountain).  You can hear that album that represents this band's embryonic journey at rlheyer.bandcamp.com. That was supposed to be it, the end of a 3 year process of slowly tweaking these songs into reality. What happened was completely beyond RL's expectations; by bringing 5 of his favorite musicians together to play some of his most personal songs, RL had created a supergroup that could bend the fabric of time and space. 

Well, people move, get amazing opportunities elsewhere, land into dream-jobs. But over the past year, the band has solidified into this lineup:

RL Heyer - guitars/vocals/songs

Kathy Moore - guitars/vocals

Norman Baker - bass/vocals

Scott Goodwin - drums/vocals

Jacques Willis - vibraphone/percussion

Joe Doria - keyboards

If you've heard these wizards before, you surely know that this is a group that needs to be recorded. With lush vocal harmonies, intricate arrangements, finely crafted songs, the ability to not just shred, but twist reality from everyone in the band, there is never a dull moment.

What we need:

If our full goal is met, we will be able to record and mix an album of new songs at one of Seattle's many amazing studios, have that album mastered, press CDs and Vinyl, produce a video, hire a publicist, and most importantly, get the musicians in RL's band paid a small fraction of what their artistry is worth on this collection of songs.

story:
Help fund the latest music video from Four Femmes on the Thames, 'Woman Up!'

We are EXCITED to announce that next month we will be filming our latest music video, 'Woman Up!' Think London. Think Feminism. Think Vaginas. After the huge success of 'The Shard' we are ready to take the world by storm. 

We are a comedy jazz band and we have been together for the last five years. We have performed at Ronnie Scotts, The Hideaway, Leicester Square Theatre, Speigeltent and the Hippodrome to name a few and have appeared on the front of The Times and on BBC London Radio. Our last song reached 14,000+ hits and Stephen Fry and Sam Smith were big fans!

What We Need 

Filming is expensive.

The money will be used towards:

  • Our venue 
  • Filming expenses 
  • Paying our director 
  • Flying our cameraman in from Prague 
  • Post - production 
  • Feeding our lovely extras!
  • PR 
  • Launch Party 

We hope the video will help build the Four Femmes' profile and put a smile on people's faces! Everyone who donates will be given a very Special Invitation to our Launch Party at the end of November. 


We really appreciate anything big or small and thank you in advance for taking the time to read this.


Love The Femmes XXX

story: Mr.Louis n'a pas les moyens de se payer un avocat, aidons le à gagner son procès face à Dieudonné. Après tout ce qu'il a enduré pour nous et tout ce qu'il a fait, il mérite qu'à notre tour nous l'aidons ! Si chaque personne le soutenant met quelques €, nous atteindrons rapidement le seuil des 3000€ pour Mr.Louis. Soyez solidaire !

story:
First Of All - THANK YOU for visiting my campaign and considering to help me fund my record, "Hope It Grows"! Now, let's MAKE it grow!


Why Plant THIS Seed??!!

My name is Kenny Ray Horton. I am an R.I.A.A. certified gold record awarded songwriter and country/bluegrass singer needing your help in the funding of my new record! With your support, recording will start in January 2016. The goal is to release the record by July of 2016. 

I have great musicians and music industry professionals ready to record, promote and market this record. The only thing stopping me right now is $25,000 to get this album recorded, packaged and marketed.

Clearing the Land! 

I am and have been serving in the United States Navy for 15 years. I am a singer and guitar player for the Navy's Premier Country and Bluegrass group, "Country Current", in Washington, DC.

After retirement from the Navy in 5 years, I will be able to focus full time on my music career. This gives me 5 years to prepare for that transition! Because of my opportunities and experiences in the Navy, I am a stronger writer, singer and performer and am more confident than ever!


I Had A Farm Before This!

Prior to the Navy, I was a staff songwriter in Nashville, TN and have had music recorded by Kenny Rogers and Donnie Osmond! Check out Kenny Rogers' album 'The Gift' - look for the track called "A Soldier's King"! You'll see my name next to it! 

I have had the opportunity to record with some AMAZING musicians, such as Adam Steffey on mandolin (The Boxcars and Allison Krause & Union Station), Barry Bales on upright bass (Allison Krause & Union Station) and the incredible songwriter, Verlon Thompson (Guitar Player for Guy Clark and Writer of 'Boats To Build' by Jimmy Buffett and 'You Say You Will' by Trisha Yearwood), helping me write songs!


Planting the Crop!  

I'm humbled by the fact that there are many super talented folks involved with this project! To have folks willing to help an artist like me is amazing! To add YOU to that list would make it even more so!

Joining me by fully funding this campaign doesn't just get a record released and out there for sale, it launches my career!  I'm excited  for a new adventure and the successful funding of this record! I know the next 5 years will be filled with a lot of hard work towards a future career in music, but my experiences in Nashville and the Navy have prepared me for it and I'm ready to dive in!


Harvest is $25,000 - Why??!!

Why do we need $25,000? Major record labels will spend millions to make and promote a record. Indie artists have learned that this can be done for a fraction of the cost. How can we do this? Because we don't spend money frivilously. 
Just getting a record out to the folks is a daunting task, even for an established artist! I will need a team to help me execute my marketing plan to get this record to you! MOST IMPORTANTLY, I need your FAITH IN ME!  The FAITH being the money you put towards this endeavour! I want you to know the breakdown and understand it, so here it is followed by a more detailed explaination.

***Studio, musicians, mixing and mastering - $12,000
***Photography and Album Artwork - $2000
***Duplication for single release - $1000
***Primary Album Duplication - $2000
***Promotional Materials and Social Media Marketing - $3000
***Video Production - $2000
***Record Release Event and Promotion - $1000
***Trade Magazine Ads, Live Event Booth Merch - $2000 

Are You Sure I Can Grow A Crop!?

Damn straight! I have plowed these fields before! In 2009 I released my first bluegrass record called "A Canary's Song". I received great reviews, got airplay on SiriuXM Radio as well as celestial stations and a lot of support from the bluegrass community.

The Fruit For YOU!

I have put together what I hope will be enticing and exciting rewards for all of you to get for your support! I want you to not only come away from this experience with a sense that you have helped start a successful career, but I want you to feel value in what you get as your initial rewards as well! Please, take a look at them and see where you can fit into the successful funding of this campaign! 

Currently Out of Seeds To Plant With Us? 

There's Options!

Every dollar is a blessing for us. Don't think you have to give a ton! But, if you're not financially able to help us out? No worries! There are a lot of things you can do to help us reach our goal! 

Social media has made it very easy for us to share our ideas and things we want to support, (LIKE THIS CAMPAIGN, RIGHT?) help us by posting a link to our IndieGoGo site on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or whatever you use the most! Do it every day so your friends get it that you really want to support me!

Also, in this age of the internet, some folks have forgotten the value of 'word-of-mouth'. It is simply THE MOST effective way of getting the word out. Talking to folks about my campaign shows them your interest and passion for what I have going on. Top that with social media and HOW CAN WE LOSE!!??

Top that with social media and HOW CAN WE LOSE!!??

story:
A3C and Center for Civic Innovation have launched a competition for ideas that use art, music and hip-hop culture as a vehicle to advance social justice and civic engagement.

We need help from you, our friends and fans, to create a fund for social change. We are currently looking for your support to help us invest in amazing, talented social innovators from around the country. Your gift of $10, $25 or even $100 can make a huge impact in empowering underserved communities.

Where is this money going?

A3C has partnered with Atlanta’s Center for Civic Innovation (CCI) to create A3C Action, a campaign that aims to find, support, and invest in new, innovative ideas that use art, music & hip-hop culture as a vehicle to advance social justice and civic engagement in underserved communities. We will select five ideas from around the country, and those ideas will be pitched at our 11th annual A3C Festival & Conference in Atlanta from October 7-11.

In short, A3C friends and fans help build a community fund and then vote to decided which ideas get that money.  We will be asking attendees to vote for their favorite ideas during 2015 A3C Festival & Conference and the result of those votes will determine how the A3C Action fund is allocated.

A3C & CCI are committed to ensuring A3C Action, and the ideas selected, create real positive change.  We will be working with the top teams selected at A3C Festival & Conference throughout 2016 to provide guidance and resources in addition to the monetary support. 

I have an idea, can I participate?

We want lots of new and different ideas! Applications are rolling from now until September 3rd so submit your idea today. Semi-finalists will be selected by September 21st and the top five finalists will get an all-access experience at the 2015 A3C festival + a chance at funding for their idea!

What is A3C?

A3C [All 3 Coasts] Festival & Conference is the preeminent hip-hop event in the US, commonly referred to as, “hip-hop’s family reunion.”  A3C is an incomparable platform to reach and interact with the influential organizations, leaders and artists within the hip-hop community.  The A3C Festival & Conference features nearly 1,000+ performers and 200+ speakers over 5 days, while the international hip-hop community ascends on Atlanta.

What is the Center for Civic Innovation?

The Center for Civic Innovation serves as a home for conversations, experimentation, and action around social challenges and opportunities in cities—and we are starting in our hometown of Atlanta. CCI creates networks of social entrepreneurs around key issue areas, runs a program called Civic Labs that helps connect public organizations and local innovators, and helps local agencies, nonprofits, and businesses better connect to their communities through unique capacity building programs.

story:
Summer 2013.

This little thing landed on my doorstep. We the Please Please Me wanted to make a record but were stone cold broke. She had an idea.


"If you love what you do and you think it can add something to the world, ask for help," she said. So we did. More importantly, YOU DID. Together, we launched Shake a Little Harder, hit the road, were inspired by artists we met along the way.

We kept creating.


Somewhere in 2014

the road got bumpier.


Jessie got a crazy bout of insomnia. We went through break-ups, life changes, faced big choices. Alissa got pregnant (good news!), & for awhile we stopped touring.

But we wrote & wrote. Poured all our feelings into new toys -- a drum sampler, synth -- and made sounds that at times captured our sorrow, at others captured the joy we knew was still under there somewhere.

Then we met Frenchie Smith. Grammy-nominated producer. World-class wacko.

YEAR OF THE HORSE was born. But it's not here yet.

We're asking for your help again.


These tracks have given us a nice push... A label coming onboard... Now we hit the road. We design t-shirts. We play our hearts out. Hit repeat. Send love notes to DJs. Write new songs, this time with some songwriting dates down in Nashville.

If we can recoup the money we put into this record, we can do our part. And let the label push us out there.

Here's hoping... if you hurl yourself into the future, it'll catch you. 

                                 x o x o x

We rounded up some of our favorite Austin artists... Suzanna Choffel 
(sexiest voice ever), Amy 
Cook (soulful'ist lyrics ever), Pauly Deathwish (i can play more 
instruments than you have fingers), Sydney Wright (puppy snuggler)... 
Matt Parmenter (bassmaster)... We threw down our credit cards.









   YEAR OF THE HORSE was born. But it's not here yet. 

We're asking for your help again.

These tracks have given us a nice push... A label coming onboard... Now we hit the road. We design t-shirts. We play our hearts out. Hit repeat. Send love notes to DJs. Write new songs, this time with some songwriting dates down in Nashville.
If we can recoup the money we put into this record, we can do our part. And let the label push us out there.

Here's hoping... if you hurl yourself into the future, it'll catch you.

story:
Hi everyone!  My name is Abby Ward.  Although I'm only 14, I am a passionate and determined singer/songwriter.  I have loved and gravitated towards music as long as I can remember.  I feel like I started out singing rather than talking... probably not, but it feels that way!  My life has been challenging for a few different reasons.  I was born with congenital nystagmus (eye disorder) as well as DVM (delayed visual maturation) This condition created social challenges for me growing up and I was teased about my "funny eyes"  Although hard, these experiences have helped me create the music that is constantly in my head.  LIfe is constantly revealing things to me,  which then comes out in the music I write.   I want to take part in being a voice for anti bullying, and I hope this campaign will allow me to do that.

This campaign will also allow for me to finish my album, increase my chances for music marketing in film/T.V., tour with other musicians short term, and co-write with people in Nashville who have expressed interest.  All these things require funds that are not accessible right now, however,  music opportunities are available now, and I want to go after it.  I have so much inside of me, now I just want to share :)  Thanks for reading this and taking the time to check out my campaign.  I hope you can be an integral part of this musical journey!

 E.P. IS NOW AVAILABLE ON ITUNES AND ALL DIGITAL SITES!! 

Search "Abby Ward" and you will see 3 of my original songs, "Wait", "Perfect Ending" and "Mind Games", 

This is just the beginning....I have so many more that I can't wait to share with you!  Get ready!!!

What is needed and how I can give back:

The funding needed for everything to happen over the next couple of years is 50,000.  If I can reach my goal I want to donate 5% back to multiple anti-bullying organizations.  

Funding will go towards these items over the next 2 years:
* Touring:  $15,000
* Travel to and from Nashville frequently to write and co-write with some top people in the industry  $15,000
* Marketing for film and T.V.  $5000
* Finishing my original album ( 3 song e.p. on iTunes and  everywhere (under Abby Ward):  $15,000

Perks for contributors:
For most of the financial packages, there are  perks!    All you have to do is donate!  This is just the start of big things to come....and we want you guys in on it!

Where the funds will go:
Our initial goal is to raise 50,000 to 100,00  similar to what a record deal would provide, but this will give fans and supporters a voice and an opportunity to lend a helping hand, which will create a platform for musical freedom.    The funds raised will go into a managed business music LLC account,  to be used for all music endeavors, including touring, marketing, production, and travel.  

How you impact this campaign
Your contribution shows that you have belief, and words cannot express how much that means.  This can't be done without you!  Your contributions will basically kick start a huge career.  What an amazing opportunity! 

    THERE ARE ALWAYS WAYS TO HELP OUT, EVEN WITHOUT FUNDING
    Through the crowd sourcing endeavor, YOU are a huge part of the campaign's success.  And even if you cannot donate or only donate a small amount, you can still have a HUGE impact.  Word of mouth is beyond awesome!!  You can engage people on your social media!!  Help get me out there by posting often on your Facebook, or give me some love on Twitter.  You can even tag me on instagram (abbywardmusic) getting your jam on to one of my songs.  My fan base is growing each day because of kind, giving people like you!  With your help I can keep going!  Try using the INDIGOGO SHARE TOOLS!  

    I cannot do it without you!

    BIG, ENORMOUS THANKS!!!!  YOU ROCK!!

    xo

    Abby :)

story:
It's always a special time of year when SpelHouse homecoming takes place. Alums from all over the country come to meet up for one weekend, to celebrate, connect, and to kick it... just like old times!

This year, Toasted Life will be having another tent during tailgate, but we are looking to make things 3x bigger for everyone to enjoy. Since this is a family affair, we wanted to give people the opportunity to contribute if they are able and interested in doing so. 

We want to create a unique environment ... that's open to everyone. Below are examples of what your contribution will be helping support. We look forward to hanging with you at the #ToastedTent! 

1) Full DJ set up and professional DJ
2) Kegs, drinks and & alcohol 
3) Free food & BBQ
4) Potential Artist meet & greet
5) Professional videographer
6) Professional photographer 
7) Small giveaways and gifts

Let's put all our powers together to make this year's tailgate the best one yet!!

story:
Short Summary

We are the Denver local band, Public Display of Aggression, and we are looking to fund our first tour ever. We have worked hard, running the local circuit in Denver for the last 5 years. We have played with local bands as well as traveling nationals in Denver. We finally have our first album recorded so now it is time to go to the next level which would be touring it, and hopefully be able to make this band our lives.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need s roughly 1500 dollars to rent a half way decent trailer, put gas in our van, and keep food in our stomachs. Essentially the money we are asking for isn't to put us on the tour because we are going regardless, it is to keep us alive and moving while we take this risk. A donation of $20 or more can get you a copy of our debut album "To Live and Die in your Suit and Tie." or a shirt or both or signed PDA swag, or an mention in the 2nd album we decide to record! (We will give you guys something cool if you donate less than $20)

The Impact

The honest truth as to why we need this, is because, like i have said before, this is our first time ever touring, it is a dream of ours to finally do it. You guys helping us achieve our goal gets us closer to becoming what we have always dreamed, a national act. In addition, your donations will also be greatly appreciated in the sense it will be keeping us fed, moving, and giving us a reliable trailer for our gear.

Risks & Challenges

Our risks I have made pretty obvious. This our first ever tour opportunity we will have with it coms a lot of of risks. The biggest risk is that we play a dead show and not a lot of people show up to buy our merchandise and that will hinder our food and gas budget. With these donations we will stay moving and come home to Denver safely with our cars where we left them and a roof over our heads when we return. Another risk we are facing is staying fed and moving, with these donations it ensures we can survive our tour comfortably, $1500 seems low but it would be what we need because it is only a 2 week long trip, but the mileage is the only thing missing on our press kit, with the mileage we have a completed press kit that would be ready to submit to labels.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you do not have any money to contribute we encourage you to share this message to help us further our goals of making this tour as comfortable as possible. Share this article, show it to someone who can help, every little bit of contribution helps.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hey, all! <y name is Jackie Gomez, aka ArwenStarsong. As you can see, I am just a simple girl who really enjoys creating music! I am self- produced, self- promoted, and I produce my own music videos as well! This is what brings me to this site:
  • You see, I wish to create content that is even better! in order to do so, I need to upgrade some of the materials I own. It is just really hard because I am what society calls a "starving artist". Music is my dream and I want nothing more in life than to create it!
  • If anyone contributes, they'll be helping someone live their passion to the fullest! With this money I am hoping to buy better programs to write music with and I am hoping that I can get a better video camera and a special- effects program so I can create better looking videos. They'll also get me one step closer to starting to make live streams :). I want to raise money with live streaming to donate to various charities!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

I NEED-

  • Logic Pro
  • Aftereffects or Final Cut Pro
  • A new video camera
  • A few months of advertising on Reverbnation

THAT IS IT...

  • I am hoping to get T shirts made so I can return the favor! The T shirt design will be unique! ^^
  • If I do not reach my goal, I will just be buying whatever you all helped me pay for or I may save it in the bank and restart another campaign until I can get what I need to create my videos!

The Impact

I wish to create an impact. Provided as my ad is my latest music video: NO MORE HEROES. In this video, I try to express a powerful message. I want to create more content like that! I want to make my music videos have an impact on people and call them to action to do something to change the world we live in! Any contributions will be helping me produce something even BETTER than NO MORE HEROES. I intent to take the world by storm with my next video and I need YOUR help to do so!

Risks & Challenges

It seems crazy to donate money to a singer/ songwriter that has no band behind her and is not a viral youtuber, but I can assure you that I will make 100% use of any funds so that I can get my next message out! You never know what we can create TOGETHER!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, all you gotta do is click that share button! hopefully someone out there is willing to help my cause!

story:
Husky Riders

Husky Riders is the pet project of Record Producer/Audio Engineer/Musician Alexandre Moreira, from Portugal, and Safety in Numbers is the debut album. It was written during Alex's college years and it fuses all of his influences from classic Prog Rock to Electronic Music, from Rock to Metal, from Björk to Meshuggah. 


This campaign is a home made solution to the need for a physical edition of this record. It took a long time and a lot of perseverance to complete this record and it seems fitting to have a small printing of it to commemorate this first step! With your help this can become a reality. Each donation above 15€ (20€ outside Europe) equates a copy of the record printed! This means that, although there is a goal in mind, there is no actual limit for the amount of money we raise since everyone is paying for their own copy of the record! On the other hand, any donation at all is a huge help and an investment in publicity and future records.


This is a very exciting age where virtually anyone who can get their hands on a computer and some gear can make a great sounding record. What enables that is the internet. It's YOU! Every single person who takes the time to support their local bands directly. You're empowering a whole generation of musicians and song-writers and we're very thankful for that!


As previously stated, all the money made from this crowdfunding, however much or little, will: 1) print out however many copies, 2) help fund future records and fuel the success of this project!


Why crowdfunding?

As stated previously, crowdfunding is an immensely powerful tool. As some of you may know, the music industry used to revolve around record companies and managers and record producers, and the bands seemed to be incidental, a product to be marketed, just like any other. Bands had little or no control on the money they made, how it was invested back, where it was spent and who earned most of it. With the advent of the internet things changed for the better and now bands can finally dictate how best to approach their fans, how much money they actually need to put out records and how to earn that money! 
This is very important for projects like this one: studio-driven, focused mostly on song-writing and special guest appearances. A project of this nature has a harder time finding concerts and other money-earning gigs, so crowdfunding means we get some money back for our countless hours of work and (in some cases) hundreds of dollars spent on musician fees, studio time and such. 
Thanks for everyday Joes like you and I, we get to do what we love and (hopefully) get paid for it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Listen to the record at https://soundcloud.com/jackpaice/sets/safety-in... 
Share it with friends and family, give us your honest feedback (always super important) and share this crowdfunding campaign! Every bit of help is massively appreciated! 

Thank you all!

As some of you may know, the music industry used to revolve around record companies and managers and record producers, and the bands seemed to be incidental, a product to be marketed, just like any other. Bands had little or no control on the money they made, how it was invested back, where it was spent and who earned most of it. With the advent of the internet things changed for the better and now bands can finally dictate how best to approach their fans, how much money they actually need to put out records and how to earn that money! 
This is very important for projects like this one: studio-driven, focused mostly on song-writing and special guest appearances. A project of this nature has a harder time finding concerts and other money-earning gigs, so crowdfunding means we get some money back for our countless hours of work and (in some cases) hundreds of dollars spent on musician fees, studio time and such. 
Thanks for everyday Joes like you and I, we get to do what we love and (hopefully) get paid for it!

    Other Ways You Can Help Listen to the record at https://soundcloud.com/jackpaice/sets/safety-in... Share it with friends and family, give us your honest feedback (always super important) and share this crowdfunding campaign! Every bit of help is massively appreciated! Thank you all!

story:
UPDATE: We're keeping the campaign open! >>> Pre-order or contribute here!

(Original message:)

Dear friends,

I’ve got an exciting update about a chance to move my music career forward in a big way, and I want to share it with my closest supporters first.

Jeff Bova, a top-level Grammy Award-winning producer in LA, is putting a huge show of faith in me... by producing my next record! :D :D :D

Jeff is an old soul with a hefty resume: Michael Jackson, Eric Clapton, Tina Turner, Billy Joel, Lionel Ritchie, Katy Perry… and it goes on.

Even with a generous discount from Jeff, a 5-song EP at this level is costly... but it’s going to catapult me forward. It’ll help me reach larger audiences, attract a top-notch band, and open doors that will lead me to the national stage.

Step 1 is to record and release , to show what I’m talking about and set the stage for the full EP. The song we’ve chosen is, aptly, “Small Sweet Step.” :-) You can hear it and a few other new ones on my website.

Thanks to Kelly’s incredible support and encouragement <3, she and I are covering a big chunk of the costs for this first song, but we need your help to bring it over the finish line, when the full bill is due October 2nd.

I’d love for you to join my circle of support by helping take “Small Sweet Step” one giant leap forward.

Thank you for believing in me, and thank you for believing since even way back in the day that I have something to offer, and that I could actually “make it” in music, even when I’ve doubted it.

I’d love to have you alongside me now as we head into this new and exciting chapter!

love,
Zo

p.s. - I can hardly wait for you to hear what we produce. :-) I think it’ll show the promise and possibility of what we’re doing… like, “Wow… He really can make it and go big with this.” Eeee! :D


THE PERKS

$1: Digital Download: Be the first to receive a digital download of "Small Sweet Step" once we complete it!

$18: Digital Download + Shout-Out: A digital download of the finished product, plus a personal shout-out on Facebook.

$54: Digital Download + Good Luck: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, plus VERY good luck. (In Jewish Numerology, 18 corresponds to "CHAI" חַי, the Hebrew word for life. Numbers evenly divisible by this number are considered good luck.)

$90: Commissioned Voicemail: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, plus a personal voicemail from Zo, singing a message to you on the topic of your choosing!

$180: Handwritten autographed lyrics: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, plus handwritten autographed lyrics.

$360: 1-Hour Coaching Session: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, plus a 1-Hour Coaching Session for you or someone close to you. Zo is a credentialed Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coach Federation (ICF), and has coached hundreds of people and logged over 1,200 coaching hours.

$720: Community Producer credit: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, handwritten autographed lyrics, and recognition in the liner notes for your special role in bringing this song to the world!

$1,800: Associate Producer credit: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, handwritten autographed lyrics, and recognition in the liner notes for your special role in bringing this song to the world!

$3,600: Executive Producer credit: A digital download of the finished product, a personal shout-out on Facebook, handwritten autographed lyrics, liner note credits as an Executive Producer, AND a Skype or phone chat with Zo from the studio (September 12-14 or 18-21)!

story:
We at Pulsar Recordings always try to take care of our artists without whom all of our enjoyment in this blissful thing we call trance music simply wouldn't be possible. But when of our most known artist doesn't produce anything for 2+ years and when we ask him what is the reason? We would always get a response: “Too tired to do anything”. It means something is wrong.

Couple weeks ago, Raytheon got fired from his job on his birthday, and this is when we knew we had to help this guy somehow. A guy that is totally down to earth, with this God given talent which is getting wasted due to long working hours, and a pile of stress day after day, wondering if he will be able to feed his family.

This is why we have decided to help Raytheon by financing his new single and giving him 100% of the proceeds here after all the fee's and rewards are covered.

We cannot forget his works of art:




Frequently Asked Questions:

Q: Isn't Raytheon's job to produce music?

A: Actually no, producing music for most of our producers comes only as a hobby, as they're not touring musicians. Since the record sales are low, they cannot rely on this income and must search for real jobs instead.

Q: How much did Raytheon earn from those record sales?

A: Up to $100 per single.

Q: How much will Raytheon earn here?

A: About 40% will go to the fee's and the rewards bit, the rest is in Raytheon's hands as we are not taking any cuts from him.

Q: What is Pulsar VIP?

A: Pulsar VIP is a monthly membership where every week you receive a new release from Pulsar Recordings straight to your inbox.


Summary: While Raytheon is on the lookout for the new job, we want to give him an incentive to go back to his home studio and produce another trance classic for our ears. We want to pay him for his time and his effort he has put into everything so far and not only for this new single, this will also come in hand for his bad financial situation he is in. We would be honored and so grateful for any amount - even a dollar or two can get us further along the way.
